review_title: I'm probably at the older end of people…
review_content: I'm probably at the older end of people who use this service, but even I have found it fairly easy to use Ditto to release my music. I love checking how streams are going and who in the world is listening to my songs, people I've never met and I'll never know. Its not big numbers and royalties don't meet recording costs yet, but its quite a buzz.

CONSTANTLY IMPROVINGWhen i first started with Ditto I must say I did struggle with different things, but they have continued to work on the site and their customer service is really responsive and helpful. Now i'd say I have always been able to get my music to the masses with no issues and I appreciate that they continue to add features and improve the site!

I love Ditto! The platform is very user friendly and there are lots of tools right at your fingertips. They offer distribution to every digital platform you can imagine, and you always have the option to register your releases for national and worldwide charts for more exposure.

review_title: I've been using Ditto for 7 Year's now…
review_content: I've been using Ditto for 7 Year's now and they've been One of the best Distribution Company via my music. Like any company that exists , they do have their ups n down I mean sometimes they don't meet the requirements of a client which helps a lot to use ditto because their supports it's the number when it comes to helping out clients, not fast replies but they do make sure they fix your problem before the end of the day you've reported the issue. So far I'm happy with ditto and I don't see myself using another distributor.

review_title: Ditto music have improved alot in most…
review_content: Ditto music have improved alot in most aspects:1.Publishing royalties2.Release approve3.Quick customer support4.100% royalties5.Quick royalties payout6.Quick pending withdrawal approvalPlease one more request, your team should try and consider shorten release time to 3-5 days instead of 10 days or still increase your artist plan fee and keep an option for immediate release (24hrs), just like Distrokid.Thanks, i will keep recommending other artists to ditto music as usual.

review_title: Been with Ditto for about 10 years now
review_content: Been with Ditto for about 10 years now. Any issues are quickly resolved. Fantastic analytical data which is massively helpful. Always things they can improve but overall I have never had any major issues. Now well over 1 million streams, here's to the next 10 years. Thank you.

We've been releasing and marketing with Ditto for some years now and the experience has been first class. The best distributor for Indie artists and small labels in the world. Any issues are dealt with by support very quickly and always helpful. Thanks Ditto xxxx
I have used many of the main-stream music release platforms and without doubt, Ditto is the easiest, most stress-free and user-friendly service out there - and such great value for money!

review_title: Just like any other company Ditto has…
review_content: Just like any other company Ditto has its flaws but what i do appreciate is the communication. If you pick up a flaw and raise it up with their team surely a resolution to the problem will be worked out. I've been releasing music with Ditto for years and yes we have clashed heads from time to time but all i can say is , if no mistakes are being made then something is wrong. I believe in Ditto and trust that their services will continue to get better and better as they have over the years. Would i recommend them? Yes i would because the small 'bugs' you face with them trust me you will face with other distributors as well. Me personally , Ditto just has so much more to offer compared to other distributors.

review_title: Ditto makes the whole process of…
review_content: Ditto makes the whole process of releasing music easy and seamless along with great tools to help spread the message about my release. My music goes everywhere my fans listen to music and getting it there is easy and affordable thanks to Ditto.

My account got hacked and someone defined a 98% of royalty shares. I contacted customer support, it's been a week and i haven't received any answer. I erased my catalog and also my ditto account. Awful customer support.

Ditto was doing well at first, when my friend was using their platform, whic I was admiring their services until I joined  the platform on September 2023 from that day till now, it has been a regret 😭, royalties are not paid according to the streams gotten per month, I got over 100k streams each month according to my analytics but they paid just 48$ this has been happening continuously.But my royalties from on other platforms from the same Spotify stores has been going through successfully.This is exactly 4 days I sent Complain to their support team but no response 😭Please don't bother signing up on their platform 😡

review_title: I love Ditto. But bring back Bank Wired Transfers
review_content: i am Abochi, an artist and producer from Ghana and i MUST SAY Ditto has served me well. Please bring back Bank payments for Royalties. It was easy and simple. Payoneer is too strict and stressful. They block you without reason.

The support might be one of the best things, other than the main thing of distribution of courseBecause they respond very promptly and they are very helpful and willing to help. Otherwise, everything else is great

SCAM! AVOID AT ALL COSTS. I know they have a shockingly bad reputation, but someone I know recommended the Ditto Promo package and I thought i'd try something different. They have basically taken £399 and provided no service at all. They sent me a copy and pasted "social media plan" and then two graphics which were just my own artwork with some cheap looking writing over the top. They requested access to my meta business account to run an instagram ad campaign which never happened. They also promise some press coverage which also has not happened. My release has been out for two weeks and I have heard nothing from them. They have now decided to ignore me and all communication has ceased. I have requested a cancellation and a refund as they are two weeks late on delivering the product that I paid for. They also told me that I could not use the artwork that I wanted to which has never happened with another distributer.  Don't risk it, its a scam!

review_title: Every time I have had an issue as I am…
review_content: Every time I have had an issue as I am A new unknown artist the TEAM have helped with every query that  I have had on my musical journey promptly and in a polite manner. I am glad I moved over to them. very professional GREAT DISTRO!!!!!!!!!   I would recommendcheck out my music next gen EDMiJAZ Rising

I just started using Ditto after using multiple other distributors for a couple years. I have had speedy customer service when I had a question or when something wasn't going right, and all my music that I've released through them has come out in a speedy and reliable fashion. They do their job, and it's clear that they're good at it. Highly recommend Ditto.

Good morning gentlemen, ditto music, what will happen to my royalties? Will it be released or not? Why is it still held? I need an answer. Days have passed.Your Current BalanceGBP 57.28Available Balance: GBP 0Pending: GBP 187.03
great distributor ever, excellent customer care
Ditto is the platform period!

review_title: Don't believe any of the positive reviews!
review_content: I have been using DITTO for a few years now and they were great in the beginning, but they have got dramatically worse and worse over time. I think that all these positive reviews about great customer service and in 5 stars reviews in general are all fake or written by them, they have to be because their customer service is the WORST. They pick and choose which issues to respond to. I have had them respond to small issues within minutes (seriously, I was shocked too) and then other major issues like a problem with an upcoming release, no response for over two weeks. You can see in the chat (they have a live chat, but you can never chat with anyone live, lol, go figure) that the person is online or was but never reads your message. They must have a feature where it shows they never did, but I assume they see it. Anyways, customer service may be least of your worries. They previously had a good system with getting your royalties out whenever you had funds to withdraw, direct deposit into your bank acct. Now, they have recently changed it to using Payoneer, which they have had options to use in the past, now their system isn't working. They tell you it is Payoneer's fault and you must resolve with them. Once you resolve your issues with them and you think you will be okay, you still have issues and you can't withdraw your royalties they are now on lockdown for whatever reasons. Also, for all you guys out there youtube reviews of DITTO, there are many other artists saying Ditto is holding funds from them or not paying 100% which they claim, I assume there are plenty of hidden fees in the small fine print you sign when you sign up. Of course, I have tried to communicate with Ditto about getting my royalties and why I don't have the option to withdraw my funds, but yet again they have ignored me and its been two weeks as of today. It has to be a problem with them, if I fixed everything with Payonner, and Payoneer gave me a confirmation that I can now withdraw funds with Ditto, but Ditto has a message saying it is still processing. As you become one of the many artists in their pool you will become like all of us ignored and not cared for. There are other issues I can go on and on, but these are the main ones as of recent they have led me to write a negative review. Believe me, I did not want to sit down and write this, but I have had it. And I want to make sure you don't get screwed too and stuck in in this and regret it later. So just beware before you sign up with this disgraceful company that claims to support independent artists. Do your research and watch real reviews from real people on YouTube, I wish I did before signing up. I will move my whole library this year like many others I assume.

However I can now ask the likes of Amazon, Apple Music and Spotify to play My Original Songs and they do. Spotify even put me in a playlist including U2 and Manic Street Preachers. WARNING - WARNIG!! To the reply below !! Those breakdown figures Ditto gave were false. As I said I did not do promotion on over the 6 months it was only over 2 . Your team quoted over 1 million fake streams over the 6 months period  - impossible.Ditto took my Royalties Back in April of 2023 for $800 on 240k plus Spotify streams, my first Royalty payment was £25.00 Bank Transfer on April 28, 2023 Paid. I paid a professional company $1500 & then another $500 AUD to promote 2 songs from late 2022. I have retained Bank Records as evidence. I sent dozens of emails to the Ditto CS who accused me of Fake streams. Going by the remark below this appears now standard procedure for Ditto who have obviously lowered their standards by Ripping of small Artists. I have all evidence to suggest that Ditto had stolen my first Royalties back then as I use a Spotify Ads promotion company Geek Marketing to generate streams of 240 k I witnessed land on my Artist page. After Investigations i noticed that they never made in back into the Ditto back office so Ditto are manipulating the software to remove Artist streams, I also never used any promotions on the alleged streaming months they say i had 1 Million false streams over 6 months November of 2022 - April of 2023 this is impossible as i have Bank Records of the months i paid the marketing firm for the promotions. Also I never received any [ Official Spotify Takedown ] Notice from Ditto that are supposed to be sent to you via your Distributor. Ditto can say anything its just hear say.Also if this Allegation was true Ditto would had of removed alleged Tracks from their servers however No Actions were taken to remove me from their platform during this time.Im owed about $850 USD Dollars for back streaming. I have now made a Report to the Better Business Bureau along with other Artists. I also found links that also claim Ditto doing the same to at least 20 plus others in the same fashion including mine named Popeye on reviewopedia

review_content: Ditto is the only platform that has marketed my contents well and paid me I therefore with to say that Ditto Music is the way to go.

I uploaded a track with this company and paid for my release on all platforms, I think it was about £19. I then scheduled promo stuff (features in local papers, stuff like that, national radio play) for the week following its  release. After a few days of the song being out I tried to cancel my sub with Ditto as they were looking money to extract royalties, so being a small artist that wasn't overly important to me. However one of their employees decides to cancel the sub and pull my tracks off all platforms. So when radio presenters or newspapers guide readers and listeners to my music there is nothing there. Ditto admitted that it was just an employee mistake but they've have been very relaxed and slow in replying and remedying the situation.  The tracks are still down five days later. Highly frustrating after putting so much in to the track. Just a warning to other artists using the site to be careful and very specific to avoid situations like this. No refund has been issues either.

review_title: Easy to follow process when uploading.
review_content: Easy to follow process when uploading my latest track.

I've used Ditto for years. They have always been great. Easy to use, and quick to help. Now, the support communication is awful. Slow response with no useful information. Or they close off tickets and ask for a review on how an agent did without even getting any info from them. Recently had royalties held because of some claim of fraudulent streams. We have zero control on who creates playlists of music online and we had not bought into a service that offers this. As they possibly suggest. We're a small DIY punk band, that just wanted to share music and earn what we can from the little you get from streaming. Which then goes back into subscription for the streaming services distribution. From seeing multiple reviews here, I assume this is a widespread issue where false claims if this are happening and affecting the smaller artists and getting screwed over by corporations. Absolute shameful behaviour and until they sort this out. I'd would avoid.

Quite possibly the most dodgiest distributor in the business, i had a release out early this year which was an album and cost over £8 on Beatport, i was reported to have sold 174 copies and have made £80 which is less than 50P an album, when i enquired i was told that they had got their numbers mixed up, then later this year i released over 30 albums of which over the course of 5 months accrued over 100K of Streams, but Ditto were reporting numbers that were 6-700% lower than the analytics and what was showing on the streaming sites, no emails to inform me of suspicious activity or anything.  In their terms and conditions they state that they can and will withold royalties at their discreation, so you dont even need to be flagged by a site.  They can just keep your money and that is that.  My friend had a similar issue and requested that they take down his works but leave the subscription to expire.  I Which Yevhenill informed him that 'he understood his reasons for leaving and that he had immediatley had canceled his subscription meaning if any royalties did come in he couldnt withdrawn if he wanted to, i find this practice pure scam and would recommend. you stay well away from them.

review_title: They stole my royalties and do not want…
review_content: They stole my royalties and do not want to release them. I was getting pay every month for my royalties, as I should, and I was receiving low amounts of money, but then I got 2 really good months, and all of a sudden, they decided to freeze my royalties and I was accused of fraudulent views when we all know that now a days anything can go viral, it was not my fault that I got pretty good views, it's something that nobody can control, so now I do not have other choice than see my account balance and not being able to withdraw or do anything, money that they will obviously keep for themselves.

I'm just about to release my third album with Ditto. That pretty much tells you how happy I am with the quality of the service and backup. They were recommended to me by the sound engineer at the recording studio and it was great advice.

review_title: There is very little human interaction…
review_content: There is very little human interaction to tell the musician/artist when something is wrong, and only after the release doesn't come out on the day that it's due, does the artist realize something is wrong. And the last time this happened, Ditto didn't even indicate where there was a problem. And then the artist has to start the whole process of releasing the music again, and it gets postponed. A release that should have been made on January 20, 2024 has been now postponed to February 17. Instead of allowing the artist to correct the problem, the release must be taken down by the artist himself and the whole process of listing the ISRC, contributors, lyrics has to be restarted.
All of a sudden, Ditto is making people pay for a subscription to have access to their royalties. How is that legal?
As a music producer, I've been able to distribute my music with a lot of ease to my listeners who are always eager to listen to my next release.
The customer service is filled with understanding people who take their time to make sure that everything goes smoothly for me.

I copied these reviews from "A.A. dIGIHIRO" and "Tim" because they sum up our thoughts exactly."DITTO model designed not to care about your release, to deliberately delay releases evenThe DITTO model has no interest in the success of your release or even releasing it at all. It's all about getting subscriptions and add on sales, they do not care if you win or lose.Can you imagine putting something out for release, getting an urgent error the artists needs to fix but locking the release (by mistake or in purpose), then after two weeks and no reply? In the message it said I could 'repair' the release but I can't. Truly awful company displaying it's true agenda.The urgent message they sent me 11th December was intentionally vague, knowing I'd need to ask further questions, I knew they wouldn't reply in a reasonable time, made worse from the fact I couldn't make my own adjustments.How they have made it this far is beyond me but I'll certainly be going elsewhere for the next release"And this from "Tim":trash"...cancelled my 1 year subscription (which was already paid in full) 2 months before renewal so it didn't renew.I then get told i can't withdraw royalties without an active subscription. why wouldn't you just keep the subscription active for the paid for duration like literally every other subscription service on the planet earth."We also cancelled our subscription so they can't take more of our cash (paid up until July 1st 2024) and now get told we can't change, edit or repair a release without a subscription!?!?!?We're paid up until July 1st!!!Hello ditto??? Is this even legal???We asked and asked and asked again what the problem was with our release so that we could correct it. Still nothing from them via chat or email, only "Hi there, “Yevhenii” is jumping in to assist you.":-D - “Yevhenii” is doing nothing of the kind - 7 days and still nothing!!!:-(We missed our release date which was meant to coincide with our gig at HMV.This is not the first time they have wrongfully hampered our releases and failed to explain why.ZERO STARS. They do not deserve the 1 star I was forced to give in order to submit this review.Any recommendations for an honest, straightforward digital publisher, one that actually has friendly, responsive support?

Ditto make releasing new material so easy with access to all the major platforms.  Their customer support is also excellent with quick response times to your enquiries.I have launched three tracks via Ditto and plan on launching more....

review_title: What make my experience great making my…
review_content: What make my experience great making my distribution on ditto is how simple it is, and than they give me the chance to add loats of details to my release.

review_title: the least competent music company i…
review_content: among the least competent services i have ever encountered. missed release dates, releases delivered too late for playlist pitching and release radar, random changes to release dates and titles, inability to deliver even the most simple releases, impossible to communicate with. very much not recommended.There really needs to be an ombudsman or some other form of regulation for these companies.

Edit after Ditto response: Yes, you always responded but I kept contacting you because I always had problems. All this because you are not able to insert an "edit release" section. No, you didn't solve the yt music problem, my new distributor (distrokid) allowed me to do it independently and when you replied you said "it seems that the problem has already been solved". The bank issue is inconceivable: I can't cancel subscriptions from my bank's app, nor can they (I contacted them and asked) so you should have included the option to remove the payment method from your site. Regarding your "being happy to make changes that the stores allow to be made", no, because I have always and only asked to insert titles in lower case and I was denied by you saying "Apple Music doesn't allow it" and now I have with my new distributor lowercase track names without problems. And yes, the price of the plan changed from 30 to 60 euros per year without me knowing before purchasing (I wouldn't have done it otherwise).I repeat, rather than justifying yourself, you should just apologize and make improvements... especially to those people who have not had the opportunity to earn their royalties because they were blocked by you (I read the other reviews). I'm sorry but when I'm made fun of I don't get over it.REVIEW:This is my last message sent to them:*Ditto, don't respond to this review with a useless justification as you always have, rather apologize for at least once*Il messaggio:Do you know that due to the poor service you offer I have had to contact digital stores, YouTube, my bank and your customer service every day because you are not able to offer a service that is at least "user friendly" for your customers? I have also been denied the opportunity to receive a refund for a service I did not receive... even now I have had to contact the bank because you are unable to cancel an automatic subscription to your flawed service. I wrote to your assistance every day for every little thing which was annoying for me and for you. Stop promising a service that you offer with thousands of problems a day, just insert a section where each user can independently modify their releases and you would have much less work to do. It's embarrassing to think that after the first subscription, the next one costs 60 euros a year without this being explicitly said somewhere when you decide to sign up. I know it's not your fault and that you're just working for a customer service that is always ready to assist, and at least I'm grateful for this because otherwise it would have been truly impossible to solve any problem. Instead, send this message to some of your superiors so that maybe they realize that they are being ridiculous. Thanks and have a good day

review_title: Avoid Ditto Music: A Scam Company That Steals Your Money and Lies About Your Streams
review_content: Dear artists, musicians, friends. Definitely avoid Ditto Music as publishers for your music. I waited 3 months for them to pay me 20$, where it increased to 120$ and in the end they sent me an email that in cooperation with another company they think I had artificial streams and licensing problems. Of course everything is a lie, just an excuse to keep the money for themselves. Through other distributors I raised even 3 times the money for the same period.
I love the experience, it feels quite indie but with a big team behind working hard, best of both worlds

I really enjoy releasing with you guys at Ditto. Simple as that. It can be really hard as an independent artist to be treated with respect but every time I have raised a concern with the support team at Ditto, I have been met with solution after solution with no wait time. You all understand how important people's music is to them and how small issues can feel a lot bigger when left in the dark. Thank you, I'll wear your merch on stage one day ;)
Excellent distribution service, better and more user friendly platform. Easy to distribute music

review_title: hello i am being defrauded by ditto…
review_content: hello i am being defrauded by ditto music, the company where i actively publish my song. they transferred my previous earnings to my bank but now they refuse to deposit my latest earnings and moreover they see my messages in the help chat and do not give me any justification. imgur. com/EAFcoM4

For the most part, I've used several distributors in the past and was very underwhelmed with their "sales pitchy" ads, articles, advice, and, most of all, form responses to everything I asked or said when talking directly. It felt like a bad upsell dream I couldn't wake up from. The last distributor I had, made me reevaluate my choices with music releases because an overzealous fan thought they were helping a song I released by "boosting it" somehow, and it got my whole account canceled for a service violation I didn't create! The email I received after the fact from the distribution service (Songtradr) had no warnings, no one reached out to discuss an issue, no nothing. I just woke up one day to check the status of my account, and they cut my account! I didn't know the person and didn't know any of the particulars other than I was accused of using bots or something. Needless to say, I started paying attention to the backstory of the next distributor I would select. Ditto rings all the right bells with me. After five distributors and many issues along the way, I finally feel a relaxed disposition, an easy-to-use platform that anyone can operate, and a non-pushy approach to live help and interactions is the best I could hope for. The Ditto music service has allowed me to release three tracks flawlessly. Splits are easy, promotions, and the few times I spoke with a rep, the whole experience was great. Everyone was competent with no upsell agenda leading their motivations! Awsome start Ditto!CT - ULOV Entertainment

review_title: How Not To Win Customers Loyalty...
review_content: On 9/1/24 I got an email from Ditto increasing my account price from £29 to £59 (actually the email didn't give me any price, I had to log in to find out what my price increase was). Increased functions? I don't need them. Also I can't delete my CC, so it will automatically renew at the increased price unless I cancel the account. This is really not a way to win customers loyalty...[Update: thanks for your reply. Your original email didn't display correctly in my inbox and so didn't offer any link to prices – I had to go to the website and login to find the new cost. However I believe a 100% (from £29 - £59) increase in price, doubling the cost, is significant.]

The articles and videos have helped me understand how to be a successful indie artist. Their release options are quick, and their platform is extremely user friendly. The new phone app is an added bonus! DITTO has been the only distributor that I feel truly understands, supports and cares about independent artists.

review_title: I recently used Ditto Music for…
review_content: I recently used Ditto Music for distributing my music, and I must say that despite a slightly longer-than-expected process, I am overall quite pleased with the service. The platform offers a user-friendly interface and a straightforward submission process. While it took a bit longer than I had initially hoped for my music to be fully processed and distributed, the end result was worth the wait.Ditto Music provides a range of helpful features, and I appreciate their dedication to supporting independent artists. The customer support team was responsive and helpful throughout the process, addressing any concerns or queries I had.Despite the minor delay, I'm happy with the distribution service overall, and I look forward to using Ditto Music for future releases. The platform's benefits and the positive outcome for my music outweigh the brief inconvenience of the extended processing time.

I have been using a paid ditto plan since august 2023. It has its good and its bads. The bad is how hard it is to get emails from ditto. I never get any form of emails. Even when i paid for a plan i dint get an email. One of my recent releases got rejected and i wasnt notified in any way. This is not the first time either is happened. You are supposed to mail your customers when events happen on their accounts.One of my releases had a takedown request i didn't send but I wasn't notified. I have tried to change my password multiple times and yet i have not receive the email i am supposed to receiver to change it. Its quite a horrible experience to be honest.I had to message the Instagram account just so my release could be sent to stores atleast 2 weeks before release and I found out Ditto only sends in the release to the store 10 days or so to the release date no matter how early you submit it which makes me wonder if they are aware that artists need 2-3 weeks to pitch their music to Spotify. Although my release was sent in early after i complained. It was just an abnormal and unnecessary policy to have knowing fully well that a lot of artist like their songs being sent to stores at least 2-3 weeks prior to the release. Anyways i do like a few ditto features like being able to have multiple primary artists and have add as much credits and contributors you wish to your songs

review_title: DITTO model designed not to care about your release, to deliberately delay releases even
review_content: The DITTO model has no interest in the success of your release or even releasing it at all. It's all about getting subscriptions and add on sales, they do not care if you win or lose.Can you imagine putting something out for release, getting an urgent error the artists needs to fix but locking the release (by mistake or in purpose), then after two weeks and no reply? In the message it said I could 'repair' the release but I can't. Truly awful company displaying it's true agenda.The urgent message they sent me 11th December was intentionally vague, knowing I'd need to ask further questions, I knew they wouldn't reply in a reasonable time, made worse from the fact I couldn't make my own adjustments.How they have made it this far is beyond me but I'll certainly be going elsewhere for the next release

review_title: For the sake of your own sanity PLEASE avoid this company like the plague
review_content: It's only now that I have cut ties with this company I feel I can breathe easy and tell my story of my experience with them over the last 7 years.Ditto are not just bad. They are easily the single worst company (in any field) I have ever had to deal with. Trying to run a label with them as my distribution has been a sheer hell I wouldn't wish on anyone. Idiotic mistakes like spontaneously cancelling my account when I was fully paid up for another 6 months is just one example but, believe me, I could go on forever. The worst thing of all was this nonsense that you can't have text in the release design (other than Artist name and track name) which they will tell you is a rule laid down by the stores. Anyone other that Ditto will tell you this is utter rubbish. If this were so, perhaps they can explain all the releases in all the stores with label logos and release numbers in the design? Perhaps they could also explain why I've just signed up with a distribution company who accepts these things, no problem? Ditto aren't even consistent with this. One time you'll upload a release with these details on the design and it'll get accepted. Another time you'll find out on release day (when you've done a load of promo etc) that it's been rejected on these grounds, forcing you to start from scratch and severely delaying the release. Bear in mind that for every query you'll usually be waiting between 10 days and 2 weeks to even get a reply. Sound like a fun way to run a label? I can assure you this is what you'll be up against, hence I can honestly say without even exaggerating this company have been extremely bad for my mental health and it's no wonder. If you're looking for a company you can work with, who you feel are on your side and can trust with your creations, PLEASE take this onboard and keep looking. There are much better options out there. It's not just me saying it. Unless you want that constant sick feeling in the pit of your stomach like you just can't trust things to go right with your release, I implore you, do NOT go with Ditto Music. I'm about to share my experiences with my (nearly 5000) music industry friends on Facebook to warn them too. It's the least I can do after what they have put me through. One star feels way too generous but zero isn't an option on here. I feel elated and cleansed to have finally got this vile company out of my system.PS (29.02.24) Just need to add this...I see Ditto have written the following underneath my review..."Hi there!We tried to reach out to you and we never heard back. If you would like to discuss anything feel free to open a chat. Our support team are always on hand.Have a wonderful day!"Just to clarify for Ditto and for people reading this, I was not asking for Ditto to get in touch. As I made clear from the outset... I have cut ALL ties with this company. I am now in the beautiful position of NOT trying to get hold of them or want anything from them at all. In keeping with their whole attitude which grated on me so badly for 6 or so years, they are just trying to make themselves look good with this statement and also make me look unreasonable. I gave this company chance after chance to do right to no avail.Here's the cruncher though...They did NOT get in touch. No emails or anything from them. Ditto if you're reading... I didn't get your email, message or whatever and I definitely don't want an email or any contact with you ever again thanks.Back I go to facebook to tell my 4952 music friends about this latest experience with you.I'd leave me alone now if I were you Ditto.Thanks :)

review_title: AN AI can detect if the song belongs to…
review_content: AN AI can detect if the song belongs to someone already.

Where to begin... Honestly, what a terrible experience it has been with Di++o Music, and it still is.. This is my *honest* felt review after 2 years:My releases (even though they are rightfully mine and distributed under my company's name, including the artwork) keep getting rejected. I recently received another email stating an ''urgent problem with my release''. Even though, there isn't, even after retrying 6 TIMES. Yeah, wow. 👏Does the support team care? No. Does simply reaching out to them help? No. Do they even manually review your concern/problem? No. Do they still charge you monthly to use their service even though you're getting horribly treated as a user? Yes. The Ditto Support Team members have surprisingly mastered the art of not giving a crap about their customers. Even though I tried reaching out to them simply asking for assistance, they kept ignoring my emails and declining my release requests. Just uploading your custom-made music to YouTube yourself is more beneficial than relying on distributors like Ditto Music. Trying to release your OWN-MADE track you have put your time and effort into will most likely go to waste by their crappy system. ❗ Please dear stranger, stay away and do NOT use their website to put your hard work on, they take your money and slap you in the face with every bit of hope on a possible revision. I didn't wish to write this review and would have never needed to in the first place if the unnecessary and unfair problems I kept receiving had just been looked into and given the chance to be resolved. 🤷‍♂️💡 I hope that this review has encouraged people to avoid future tragedies by using this incredibly outdated and unloved service, their credibility is highly overrated and has most likely been faked to the extent of baiting people into using it. ✍️ Edit: Forgot to quickly mention that they don't provide the latest music categories as well. So you're also left off by placing your track in the wrong one because you do not have a choice. Their features are old and unclear, as there are no tutorials whatsoever about basic and quite important questions online. Only extremely specific unrelated ones to the music industry, this is verifiable if you look into the socials they run. Thank you for reading and stay safe music composers! Find yourself a better one if you're looking into signing up! 🎶

review_title: My experience has been very great
review_content: My experience has been very great! As an artist who never knew how to put my songs in major streaming platforms, Ditto has been extremely helpful to me and has made my dream of becoming a verified artist in Spotify and in other platforms come true. I guess the only criticism I have is that the smartlink doesn't arrive on time, sometimes it comes a day or two after the release date so it becomes a bit useless if you want to share it during the release date to promote your song/album.

review_title: My experience with Ditto has been great…
review_content: My experience with Ditto has been great since the team was able to assist me with uploading my songs which never reached specific stores on the day of release. I enquired about it and I was properly assisted within the period of 2-4 days until my songs were uploaded. Which really helped, because my fans kept on asking questions I didn't have answers. Quick, efficient and effective.

This is a shame, I could have given them a higher rating but this has really annoyed me.  Should have read the small print early on!  They did a great job a releasing all my music, though I couldn't afford to pay for another year and as I wasn't making much music, so I let the years subscription come to an end.  I thought that they would just continue to collect royalties for me which I could withdraw at a later date when times are hard, well, that's now, and what do I find?  I need to pay them for another subscription just to claim the small amount of royalties my music has earned!  I have £70 in royalties held by them, I initially paid £70 for a years subscription, their lowest priced plan is £20, so I'm not even going to break even to get that money, seems like a total scam.. seriously, eventually artists will have to decide whether taking out another plan is worth it, and there will come a point when they decide it's not, meanwhile this company will still be claiming royalties, accumulating it in their bank account, that is unless you decide to have all your music taken down, which sucks for the artist either way. Think I'll just stick to Bandcamp in the future, ok, so it's just one platform, but at least there's no subscription fees, as Bandcamp take a cut there and then, you know exactly what you're getting.This service would be fairer if they just took a percentage of the sales you make, to cover their admin costs, they could charge a small fee for each release, turns out that Feiyr does exactly that.To make matters worse, I initially had 3 artists set up, in order to take the royalties out, I'm forced to have to take down two of the releases in order to be able to select the lowest priced plan!! It's not a great service for small artists that are struggling to get by, if you're a popular artist then it makes more sense to go with them.It sucks when you do the hard work but someone else makes the profit.

Ditto has helped me release as much music as I want at a cheap yearly price and I'm stoked that now they've finally made an app, still waiting for android version though.But I wish it were more like unitedmasters where they pay you monthly after your first 3 months of release but other than that they've been great!
worst experience; very slow release, royalties have 6 months delay, cant even have text on cover art etc DO NOT USE THIS SERVICECheap price and cheap attitude
I'm very much happy for being with Ditto ,i have learned a lot from the copyrights laws to follow and the consultants are taking enough care so quickly. The updates are healthy too.

review_title: I originally rated them really well
review_content: I originally rated them really well, however as much as their customer support (for the most part) is great, They always leave your songs or ep or album in review until a week at earliest before verifying it & sending it to stores. this means no pre-save link or with only a couple of days, no editorial playlists, & no chance of getting a good algorithm with it. I have complained to them multiple times now & they refused to respond. I gave them over a month, same issue. This is a big issue when it comes to online distribution & I will be changing distributors over this. If there's an error with any of the songs by that point too, the release date has to be delayed because they didn't check it soon enough.

You cannot prove that you are right.  2 days ago they suspended my account even after 2 months of my music release!  My music has 100k+ streams no problem.  But suddenly they suspended my account without any reason.  !!  And they gave an excuse to suspend someone else's account with my account!  Where is my fault!  I messaged a lot of people if I didn't understand something when I heard ditto music new.  Maybe someone recommended my account from the suspend account!  I have all kinds of proofs where my fault is.  However, do not trust them.  Routnote is better than them.

review_title: Learning to communicate with DITTO is key.
review_content: It is almost a year now since I started releasing music with Ditto (got recommended by a friend at the time, have never released anywhere before). After the first release went well I tried to be more systematic and release a track every fortnight (to pitch every other track to playlist etc. But Ditto only sent tracks to stores a few days before release anyway. I got used to the schedules with Ditto by now and communicate with them every time I send a new track - and they respond very kindly and start processing the tracks as soon as they arrive. So, all good now. Thank you.

I then purchased an annual subscription for just £19 which is way cheaper than the competition. I cant sing enough praises! KAYUL

review_title: Avoid at all costs - much better alternatives
review_content: Despite uploading well in advance of the release date for a release of two singles, only one of the two tracks made it to the stores on the release day. It was only uploaded two days before so all windows for editorial playlists on spotify were missed. I had sent multiple contacts in advance of this expressing my concern and received some non-committal responses initially saying that releases were prioritised by proximity to release date, not by upload date. After receiving one response they stopped responding to my emails. It's obvious they haven't got the staffing available to meet the demand they're getting and the quality of the service has fallen through the floor. They've also made it much harder to contact their support team and are unresponsive on their contact channels. I'll be switching to an alternative that actually has the foresight to hire staff to meet demand and the care to support their artists.  Excerpt from an email I sent after the tracks hadn't been uploaded with a week to go til the release date: "to be considered for Spotify Editorial playlists, the tracks need to be uploaded to Spotify at least a week before the release date, and the earlier it's pitched the better. If you guys are only able to stay on top of getting releases uploaded within a few days of their release dates, you need to hire more staff to support this. By only sorting the uploads at the last second, you're depriving artists using your service of opportunities - for editorial playlists and release radar, as the track is only added here if it's been pitched. If artists have the foresight to upload their tracks early, they should be present on the backend early so they have plenty of time for editorial playlist pitching."

review_title: I love it but why can’t I withdraw my…
review_content: I love it but why can’t I withdraw my money?

Low Budget Vanity PublishingI have been with Ditto Music for over 3 months now and I don't think they are for everyone. For small artists, if your passionate about your music then I would say they are not for you. If you just want to put stuff out there to say you have but didn't wish to take it further, then go for it. Below are the pros and cons from my experience with Ditto MusicPros- Affordable. Their pricing is very competitive.- They are quick at getting back to you when you have an issue. (Note: its more than likely you will have an issue)- Does what it says on the tin, uploads music to where it needs to be- Staff are friendly and helpful.Cons- The Review process is pointless. It takes 10 days or so to get your song on the various platforms. For 8/9 days it will usually sit in 'In Review' status. Its worth noting that they don't actually review anything, so if any issues crop up, nothing will happen. - No matter what date you select or how much notice you give Ditto Music before a realise, you will never make New Music Friday on Spotify. This is something that is essential for every single release you will ever make, so for them not to be able to do this makes them unusable, regardless of price. Summery and final thoughtI never felt any passion from them about music at all. It felt like the entire company is probably ran for profit. The people you will speak to will be helpful and friendly, but I have no doubt they will be over worked and under payed, so please don't blame the staff here. Until they are able to get everything set up 7 days+ before your release then there is no point in using them. Overall, if you are a big artist and already have a fan base then Ditto Music will probably be fine, you'll already have enough traction to find new fans anyway. For small artists starting out, although this is cheap, you need to be with a distributor who can make sure you will hit New Music Friday to find new fans. If they can fix this then that'll be a game changer. If you just want your music online as more of a vanity project then this is the perfect place.

Personally, I don't recommend this platform. They take too long to upload, miss deadlines, misclassify music genres on Beatport and Juno – they even label my melodic house tracks as hard techno. It appears that the money you send for promotion is wasted. They don't respond to problems, and it's unclear what they do with the funds.

review_title: Can be great, but very erratic customer help
review_content: In my experience Ditto music is very good as long as you do not run into no issues with using their system. However if there are any irregularities (and because I was uploading my back catalogue there were a few issues) I found them to be extremely erratic in terms of responding to enquiries. There is no telephone number and I've had the experience of not being responded to for weeks at a time and it being impossible to know what to do. However, once something is said here on Trust Pilot, they suddenly are there. It's very odd. I just wish they would tell you that in the first place..... Seems strange, but in the end (thank you Trust Pilot and thank you Ditto music for  answering) my music is now available: Susannah Darling Khan and Be-Attititude....

review_title: There is much to say to be honest
review_content: There is much to say to be honest, Ditto is just a great distribution service. We have never had any issues with our releases. The process is so quick, easy and painless. They have so many tools at had to give you the best help with getting your music out there.

review_title: Dont trust them... profit is priority
review_content: Where to start...while surfing the net, I came across a DITTO slogan that said that DK steals or under-values your royalties...Well, at DITTO it's worse!DITTO doesn't hesitate to rob you of the little you've earned.They always hide behind their crappy FAQ, which explains nothing and leaves everything unclear...Then there's the "suspicious activity" reason, which is used all the time without taking the time to understand the subtlety of each case.I wouldn't recommend DITTO. I don't understand on their sites they say that publications are made between 3 and 5 days when in reality you can count on 10 days at best or if something goes wrong you go back for another 10 days.With other distributors like w_w_w_audiowundr_com, it takes 48 hours and only costs you 11 USD a year. What's more, you can publish as many artists as you like.They take the liberty of denigrating DK, but you should know that DK is light years ahead of your services.DITTO is fine if your aim is simply to upload your tracks passively.Don't make the mistake of promoting yourself or using your own strategy. They'll immediately label you as a "fraudulent activity", a term that's used in all sorts of ways.Finally, even if a user is flagged, only those streams deemed unacceptable should be withdrawn, and you still earn the little you've earned.What other distributors do.In conclusion, I strongly advise against Ditto.Look for other small distributors who cost much less and with whom you'll have a real relationship.

review_title: I like everything about Ditto Music
review_content: I like everything about Ditto Music, I like that everything i wished for is actually happening.

review_title: I am very ok with their smart services…
review_content: I am very ok with their smart services and their customer service response when I need an aid, it has been an Interesting journey.I also enjoy the playlists assistance they provide to artiste. That is absolutely amazing.The only reason I am not giving a 5 star is because, there perform kind of late to submit my songs to stores, as such I don't really meet up with pitching. I usually have to contact support before my release will be sent.I'll appreciate if that can be fixed. Thank you.

We've put a lot of work into developing a communication strategy based on affilitations to gain visibility right from the start.It worked so well that we were suspected of fraudulent activity.The reality is this.DSPs don't like independent artists and handicap them enormously. As soon as you make an audience, they strike you to force you to work with the MAJORs.So we've been the unjust victims of strikes.However, we were paid a share of our royalties, and when the time came to withdraw, it was a disaster.DITTO used the opportunity to keep them and at the same time ban our account.That's what the support told us:"we have decided to close your account because you have continued to engage in fraudulent activity".Please explain how we can continue to communicate on striked content that has become unavailable on the platforms?To conclude. Other known distributors in this kind of situation pay back what has been earned to the artists.This is not the case with DITTO.All this work and effort for nothing is sadly rewarded.For future potential customers. I'd advise against it. This company has no srupule and will do nothing to your advantage.We work with other distributors and it works much better.As far as support is concerned. It's pathetic.20 days to reply and then close a ticket that didn't answer your question.I will update my review if something news.

review_title: Ditto does not respond to messages

It is also a typical crooked distributor who wants to make money with your work and music without involving you or paying you out! Thats why they keep your audio!UPDATE 05.10.2023 :I have already filed my case, your organization will receive official notification about this, every day my audio remains on your platform and online stores, a penalty is demanded, you are unlawfully uploading people's property without permission for your own profit purposes, plus you don't want to remove my property is also against the law! that's why you have a problem with me! you should just accept the law and keep your hands off their property, especially not upload it!

Ditto has been a massive disappointment. I have released 26 songs and also run a music label that has released another 8 songs with other artists and have 3 on deck. I have been using Ditto since 2021. Ditto seems to have a problem with sending your songs to the stores in a reasonable amount of time before the release date. I have submitted songs 8 weeks in advance and the song didn't get sent to stores until the week of the release. I have probably only gotten 4 songs out of 34 that were sent to stores more then a week before the release date. Other than that, all the other songs I don't even have the chance to pitch to Spotify editorial playlist. I have emailed them numerous times about this issue and they never seem to have an answer. Almost two years and this is still a problem today. This tells me they don't care about the artists and/or music labels, it is a shame. I am writing this now because I messaged almost a week ago, since I have a release scheduled with a new artists, I sent it in 6 weeks before the release date and the song has yet to be released to stores and it is now 4 days away from release date and I have yet to get a response, like I mentioned it has almost been 1 week since my message. I have another release two weeks after this, I expect the same. How can anyone run a label if the distributor is M.I.A. and is not easy to work with and doesn't want to improve their service? This just tells me they do not respect any of us, they just don't care.  I am just very disappointed and I hope that anyone that reads this does not waste their time and money using DITTO. Use any distributor but DITTO.UPDATE OCTOBER 15, 2023:Their response to this review is exactly what you will get when you have a concern/issue. They will tell you they do their very best to get releases out in time, but they never do and they just don't care.So, since my review I have had numerous issues and questions, which they aren't responding to anymore (one of my artists from my label, his song attached to wrong artist profile). They just screwed up my most recent release attaching it to my previous release, I don't know why, and they didn't send the song some of the major stores like Apple and iTunes( I always click send to all stores). I tried to see and edit if I could send to other major stores (in my dashboard) but I don't have the option to do so. I just took down my release because of this (song was released on Friday, now it's Sunday). I haven't heard from DITTO in over two weeks (from a previous issue I am having and a couple of questions), I have messaged their chat support and emailed them directly multiple times. Again, I can't say this enough, save the stress and look for a different distributor. I am now researching other options and soon  will be switching to another distributor.

Pretty Good Experience So Far. I've released 2 tracks using Ditto and they have been up on every streaming platform as promised. Very easy to share your music with the world however, I have had some issues in the past where my music had to be held back from release due to my own errors when filling out the meta data. The customer service could be a little better as if you choose to have a standard release (have to wait 10 days) and something goes wrong in publishing on your end, these guys like to give you a one day notice before the scheduled release, and make you wait another 10 days after repair. However this is expected from the cheap annual price. In conclusion it's a bang for the buck, just make sure you fill out the meta data correctly and prove all copyrighted material before release.

Review: I recently had the pleasure of using Ditto Music as my music distributor, and I must say, it has been an outstanding experience from start to finish. Here are five reasons why I highly recommend Ditto Music:Easy and Intuitive Platform: Ditto Music provides a user-friendly platform that makes the music distribution process a breeze. From uploading my tracks to selecting the platforms for release, everything was straightforward and well-organized. I appreciated the intuitive interface, which made managing my music releases a pleasure.Extensive Distribution Network: Ditto Music truly delivers on its promise of reaching a wide audience. The distribution network they offer is vast, ensuring that my music was available on all major streaming platforms and digital stores across the globe. It was incredible to see my music reach listeners worldwide.Prompt and Reliable Service: Throughout the entire process, Ditto Music provided exceptional customer support. Any questions or concerns I had were swiftly addressed, and their team was always responsive and helpful. Their professionalism and dedication to customer satisfaction were truly commendable.Transparency and Analytics: Ditto Music's transparency and analytics tools have been invaluable. I appreciate being able to track the performance of my music, monitor streams, and receive detailed reports on royalties and earnings. This level of insight allows me to make informed decisions and maximize the impact of my releases.Affordable Pricing and Fair Royalties: Ditto Music offers competitive pricing plans that are affordable for independent artists like myself. I found their pricing structure to be fair and transparent, with no hidden fees or surprises. The fact that Ditto Music ensures artists retain 100% of their royalties is a testament to their commitment to supporting independent musicians.Overall, my experience with Ditto Music has been exceptional. Their user-friendly platform, extensive distribution network, prompt service, transparency, and fair pricing make them an outstanding choice for any artist looking to distribute their music. I wholeheartedly give Ditto Music a five-star rating and highly recommend their services to artists seeking a reliable and comprehensive music distribution solution

review_title: Continuing to charge me even though I cancelled (and I need an active subscription to take out my royalties)
review_content: I've been with Ditto for several years now and have had many issues with them, but most recentlyMost recently: 1. I cancelled my subscriptions over a year ago and they are continuing to charge me a yearly fee without the benefits of the subscription. 2. I am unable to take out my royalties unless I have an active subscription (despite them continuing to take out money from my account) so I need to PAY THEM to access money I earned3. If I want to take out my money without paying a subscription then they threatened to remove my music from the stores. Their customer service team simply shrugged and said "these are the rules"4. They refuse to provide VAT receipts (saying they do not supply them) and I had to provide evidence that it was illegal for them to do this until they eventually supplied them.5. They do no support Hi-Res or Lossless audio - all my releases are basic AAC. No support for Dolby Atmos either.I am currently speaking to Trading Standards over this company's malpractice.
Very easy, fast and intuitive.

review_title: Ditto Music Distributor - A Potential Scam Company
review_content: I am writing this review to warn fellow musicians and artists about my deeply disappointing experience with Ditto Music Distributor. My encounter with this company has been nothing short of a nightmare, and I feel compelled to share my story to prevent others from falling into the same trap.From the very beginning, Ditto Music presented itself as a reliable and promising platform for independent artists seeking to distribute their music to various streaming services and online stores. However, my experience with them has been a stark contrast to their claims.First and foremost, their customer service is virtually non-existent. I reached out to them with a few inquiries regarding the distribution process and encountered a prolonged delay in their response. When they did finally get back to me, their answers were vague and unhelpful, leaving me even more confused than before.The real trouble began after I decided to go ahead and distribute my music through Ditto. Their platform seemed user-friendly at first glance, but as I navigated through the process, I encountered numerous glitches and errors that hindered the smooth uploading of my tracks. I attempted to contact their support team once again, but my messages went unanswered, leaving me to struggle with these issues on my own.Worse yet, after my music was supposedly distributed, I noticed a significant delay in its appearance on major streaming platforms. When I inquired about this, I received no response from Ditto's support team, leaving me in the dark about the status of my music's distribution.Perhaps the most alarming aspect of my experience with Ditto Music is their dubious financial practices. Not only did they charge me an exorbitant upfront fee for their services, but I also discovered unauthorized transactions on my credit card linked to Ditto Music. These charges were never explained or resolved, despite my multiple attempts to contact the company.In conclusion, my encounter with Ditto Music Distributor has been a complete disaster. Their lack of effective customer service, technical glitches, and questionable financial practices all point to a company that is either incredibly incompetent or, worse yet, intentionally operating as a scam. I strongly advise any independent artist considering Ditto Music to think twice before entrusting them with your music and hard-earned money. There are countless other legitimate distribution options available that will not subject you to the frustration, stress, and potential financial harm that Ditto Music can inflict.

Compared to other online distributors, I found DITTO to be reasonably priced and very user friendly. I appreciate that they keep track of real time streams, and when I had issues pertaining to one of my releases, I received fairly quick feedback on the chat platform.

review_title: DITTO SO FAR IS THE REASON I STILL…
review_content: I am thrilled to share my wonderful experience with Ditto Music, a game-changer in the music industry that has helped me effectively release and promote my music.From the moment I signed up on Ditto Music, I was blown away by the sheer convenience and user-friendliness of the platform. The registration process was quick and hassle-free, granting me immediate access to their extensive range of services and features. Additionally, their affordable pricing plans made it accessible for artists of all levels to benefit from their comprehensive toolkit.One of the most notable aspects of Ditto Music is their commitment to helping artists retain their creative control and independence. As an artist myself, it was crucial to have a platform that respected my artistic vision and provided me with the necessary resources to manage my music release efficiently. With Ditto Music, I was able to retain 100% of my royalties while having the freedom to set my release date, select preferred platforms, and distribute my music worldwide effortlessly.The distribution process itself was an absolute breeze. Ditto Music offered a wide network of streaming platforms, ensuring my music had maximum reach across the globe. With just a few clicks, I was able to securely upload my tracks, and Ditto Music took care of the rest—including pitching my music to their extensive playlist network and potential radio stations. It was incredibly satisfying to see my music go live across various platforms within days, reaching a wider audience like never before.Besides their distribution services, Ditto Music also provides valuable promotional tools. Their user-friendly promo links and smart URLs allowed me to effectively market my music on social media platforms and track engagement in real-time. It was amazing to witness the audience response and gain insights into my listeners' preferences.What truly sets Ditto Music apart is their exceptional customer support. Anytime I encountered a technical issue or had a question, their dedicated team was always there, promptly responding and resolving any concerns. Their professional guidance and personalized assistance throughout my music release journey were invaluable.To sum it all up, Ditto Music is an absolute powerhouse for independent artists, like myself, seeking a seamless and affordable music release experience. Their well-designed platform, extensive distribution networks, and drum-tight support truly exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend Ditto Music to any artist looking to unlock their musical potential and gain a global presence in the industry. Thank you, Ditto Music, for unleashing the magic of my music!

I recently discovered Ditto Music and I am thrilled to share my exceptional experience with this fantastic platform! As an aspiring musician, I have always struggled with getting my music heard by a wider audience and navigating the complex world of digital distribution. Thankfully, Ditto Music has come to my rescue, and I cannot recommend it enough.First and foremost, the user interface of the website is refreshingly intuitive. From the moment I signed up, I was impressed by the seamless onboarding process. Ditto Music provides a straightforward and easy-to-understand interface, making it a breeze to upload and manage my music. The platform allows you to effortlessly distribute your tracks across various major music platforms, giving your music the exposure it deserves.What sets Ditto Music apart from its competitors is the exceptional customer support. Whenever I faced any challenges or had inquiries, their team was quick to respond and provided expert guidance every step of the way. They truly prioritize their customers, and their dedication to helping artists succeed is palpable.One feature that I absolutely love is the detailed analytics dashboard. It allows me to track my music's performance on different platforms, analyze listener demographics, and make data-driven decisions to enhance my marketing strategies. The insights provided by Ditto Music have proven to be invaluable in growing my fan base and optimizing my music career.Thank you, Ditto Music, for empowering artists like me and helping us realize our dreams!

review_title: The platform is simple to use

review_content: Excellent service. Unfortunately, my song was placed on another artists profile with the same name but Ditto fixed the distribution issue in 1 day instead of 4 weeks! Amazing response!

Hey, you reader. I'm excited to tell you don't doubt Ditto in anyways. This distributor is the preferred one for any artist to use. It's simple and easy to understand, even when it's your first time using Ditto.

DItto music informed me my release had issues 3 days before release and was not perfectly clear or available to tell me what exactly was wrong and instead provided me with a checklist. Not the worst, I went through it to repair my tracks. I then selected expedited release and payed $40 dollars on July 29th. It said I could expect release within a few hours, max 72 hours. I was relieved to think it would get out in time to the date I told everyone July 30th, but instead, it selected august 8th which is over 9 days away. Im furious and just defeated that I can't share a project I worked so hard on, on time. I payed extra for a fast release and did not receive one and I feel like I got robbed. In the height of this emergency there are not operators available, and I get it is the weekend, but how is there no way for me to get emergency help. The past few times I've released with ditto, it always goes wrong, and this was almost like a nail in a coffin for me. Always getting my music put on the wrong pages, and maybe that's the stores fault, but this time ditto really was not here for me as a small independent artist. I really want to have faith but to spend money to have a track to be released ASAP and that becomes 10 days is a terrible feeling. To have everyone wondering where my project is after supporting me and advertising its release feels so awful.

The review process takes forever. Even when you are releasing a track a month out. Then when any issues arise with your release you cannot get any support from customer service. I don't believe they value the clients who use their platform to distribute music.

I had a release that was a bit of a doozy in terms of releasing a run of singles, different artwork versions, I even wanted to change the artwork after uploading, and song title formats that aren't usually accepted by all streaming services. Ditto customer service handled every single one of my issues. I've heard of other companies using AI customer service... that would have been impossible in this case at every turn. They respond quickly, they're able to make small adjustments when needed. This will allow me to have the music release that I wanted. Thanks Ditto!

Started out OK, then I changed my email. Shortly after paying my Subscription, I received an email saying my account will be closed - because of non-payment! I email support, who tell me my new email is wrong!?! Then they asked LOTS of questions - all my releases' names and dates, screenshots of account payments and amounts, proof of address, etc. etc. Then they asked the same questions via email AGAIN, then they stop replying... I never did solve the issue. They never solved their email problem. I never got any money from them. Now I don't exist on their system, have no way to contact them (look on their website for an email or telephone contact - nope - just the AI chat box), and have no idea where/who/how my releases are selling or if they still exist! They really need to sort out Customer Support for people with real issues. But it all feels like communicating with a machine - you ask a simple question and it replies "Can I have more details? A screenshot?".

Writing as of 10th of July of 2023. I have been waiting for 4 days for an answer concerning my payouts, can't get them because of some kind of issue on their end. I'm not told what it is, it just says to contact support on the payout page. Previously, when I opened tickets the response time would vary drastically, sometimes in 2 days, sometimes in 9. With the new chat UI they implemented, it also shows that they usually reply in a set amount of time. When I opened the ticket it said 4 hours, wasn't true. Today it says 3, not true either. Very confusing, very slow. I can imagine this being a total dealbraker for a lot of people

review_title: I made the change to DITTO
review_content: I made the change to DITTO after many years of releasing through a different company, I gotta say im very satisfied with the better prices and the support from the team via the chat has also been great, friendly and efficient, they provide solutions in a timely manner. I have been happily reuploading my old releases since its not costing me hundreds.

review_title: I joined ditto in 2021 and had some
review_content: I joined ditto in 2021 and had some couple of releases with them which was quite successful in every aspect but was displeased with my royalties pending for quite a long time a year actually on the ground of licence clearance, i felt a bit discouraged continuing with renewing my subscription and more releases with them due to this and even took down a whole album from the platform cause i felt helpless. Not untill in 2023 on the 30 of june to be precise, i saw the help feature and out of curiosity i tap on it and to my dismay i realised i could even get to reach out to an active team directly without waiting for eternity. I lay down my complaint and within a few minutes i got a reply in quotes "	Hi there,Thank you for getting in touch.I can confirm that all releases with sales have now been cleared. You can withdraw your overall funds."I was dumbfounded and at the same time pissed with myself for haven't reach out early enough. Am glad and confident in the platform now than ever and hopefully bring back my songs from other distributors and release them with ditto. The help team are really amazing with their swift responses and making sure you get your issues resolved, I attest to that.
So far had no problems, amazing experience and always helped me throughout the journey, really easy to use.

review_title: im 3 years in ditto im loving the…
review_content: im 3 years in ditto im loving the respond when i have a problem quick to solve i gave 4 star because i think and believe they can do better

Online support is terrible. It states it answers in 4 hours or so but for days no response. Issue relates to an album being rejected because of 'copyright' issues, however, all music is original and owned by self. It was released previously and then withdrawn from another provider, to be released on Ditto. Support came back and said "remove samples and re-submit". However, there are no samples, it is all live music that was released back in 2015! I asked 'what sample(s) are you talking about, as there are none' and they responded with 'we don't know and are unable to tell?!?'. So, that is like being charged for murder and you ask who you actually murdered? Then them saying 'we don't know, but your still going to jail lol.I have since re-submitted with all my PPL registration evidence of 100% ownership, yet this was still rejected.
Great service and support, whenever i have a query or request the team get back to me very fast. Highly recommend

review_title: I really dislike the responsive aspect to customers of ditto
review_content: I really dislike the responsive aspect of the company to the customers is too slow. And the company should try and resolve it ASAP, and the company should try and run a little promotion of any kind that could help artist with little or no funds for promo it'll go a long way.

Ditto make music release and distribution a simple process to follow. The website is intuitive and has all the information you need. More importantly if you do have a question and ask or go on the live chat their response time is very prompt. We work with Ditto on an ongoing basis and have now just released our fourth single as a small label. IT has all of the tools you need at your finger tips. I totally recommend Ditto as a platform for anyone looking to release music and music video content.

review_title: you guys took my art work down if you…ri
review_content: you guys took my art work down if you do not fix it i will sue because i have reciptes saying i put in another order the same day mso if my release is not released on the 7th i will sue as i did not get an email stating something was wrong with my release and i am not uploading anthing agian as you guys better fix it immeditly as im tiered of having problems with you guys so now fix my account or be ready for a massive class action lawsuit as i am not the only one going through this

I want to take a moment to express my excitement and anticipation for the service provided by DITTO Music. Although my music distribution is still in progress, I have been thoroughly impressed with the level of professionalism and support they have demonstrated thus far.The process has been smooth and streamlined, thanks to the guidance and assistance of the DITTO Music team. They have been prompt and efficient in handling my inquiries, ensuring that all my questions are answered and concerns are addressed. Their user-friendly platform has made it easy for me to upload my tracks, artwork, and relevant information, setting the stage for a successful music release.I have full confidence in DITTO Music's marketing and promotional campaigns. Their strategic approach to promoting artists and their music has already shown great promise. I eagerly anticipate the results of their efforts, with high hopes of securing features on influential playlists, gaining press coverage, and expanding my audience reach.What truly stands out about DITTO Music is their commitment to artist success. They genuinely care about their clients' aspirations and work diligently to help them achieve their goals. The personalized attention and support I have received thus far have been exceptional, reaffirming my belief that I am in capable hands.Although I cannot provide a final assessment of their service at this time, I have a strong feeling that DITTO Music will deliver outstanding results. Their dedication, professionalism, and genuine care for their clients' success have left a lasting impression on me.I look forward to the completion of my music distribution and the subsequent promotional efforts by DITTO Music. Based on my experience so far, I am confident that they will continue to surpass my expectations and help propel my music career to new heights.Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5 out of 5 stars)Disclaimer: This review is based on my anticipation and early interactions with DITTO Music.

Uploaded an album remaster earlier last year, this album had previously been distributed by them ten years ago. When processing, they kept kicking the album back because the artwork contained text that did not feature in the title and kept trying to blame Apple for this. I think they're just being picky, release went through fine through an alternative distributor. Now trying to upload a live release which is again being pushed back because it didn't state that it was live, despite the word "Live" not appearing on the artwork. Make your bloody mind up, don't tell artists how they should present their artwork because you feel you need to moderate artistic output. Just accept it and move on. Going to try and find a way to move the back catalogue across from Ditto to some other reputable distributor, trying to also find a way to never use Ditto ever again and to warn musician friends to avoid them also. Don't agree with having to wait until there are £25 worth of royalties before a payout. Customer service is also none existent with sometimes very rude replies.

review_title: The reason why I go to 5 stars
review_content: The reason why I go to 5 stars, no dubitating, is because Ditto is very clear with the options, but the Customer Service is a 11 out of 10: fast responses and very colaborative. Thanks for allowing us to step fourward to acconplish our dreams.

review_title: Human customer service in a digital world
