Ditto is a great and affordable service. Their website is easy to use and they are attentive to my requests via chatbox. They may take a few days to respond but they always do and they try their best to understand the issue and assist as best they can.

I needed help to get rid of one of my releases that I accidentally posted. The Ditto support service responded quickly and helped get rid of the release  I needed to delete. They are very reliable and simple to work with!

review_title: I love it here but the only problem i…
review_content: I love it here but the only problem i got with dropping my songs via Ditto is because they take too much time to review a song before sending to stores. Take for instance, If your music is not sent to the stores atleast 7 days before drop your song will never be pitched to SPOTIFY EDITORIAL for playlisting. Because of this i have never made it to spotify editorial playlists as my music is always available on spotify barely 2 or 3 days to drop.

You can't withdraw your royalties. They just showed the pending process but still you can't get payout even though you have reached the £25 balance. I think they trying to scam the artist when it comes to royalties.

I've been releasing music with Ditto, but lately, with my recent programmed releases, there have been many issues when sending them to stores. I receive messages a day before telling me that there's a problem with my track of whatever, that I need to change things, and sometimes the same file I used I re-upload and it magically works. I understand that sometimes files may have some issues and they can get fixed but if I could be notified 2 weeks before o at least a week it could help me reprogram strategies. Having this happen 2 times in less than a week was so upsetting. I want to continue releasing through Ditto but be able to receive any notification within a reasonable time frame, not a day before or the same day. The proper assistance.

review_content: Such a great experience from the DITTO team. Easy to release your own music and easy to see how your music is released around the world.I now use DITTO as my main distributor of my music. 1st class.

This distributor is really annoying in many kind of ways. They don't send the releases to stores until 24h before release date because they have an "express release" offer for 50 EUR they want to force you to. This way it is not possible for you to make successful spotify pitches. Moreover, they reject the release if something is not spelled or on the artwork the way they want it to. They rejected releases because I spelled it "VIP" instead of "V.I.P", "Melissa S." in the metadata and "Melissa" on the artwork, which was ok on a different artwork with the exact same lettering and fonts. This wouldn't be that bad if they would not change the release date to somewhere later if something goes wrong. From previous experiences I can say that other distributors do not have these problems.

review_title: I'm releasing music with Ditto once again…

review_title: my only struggle is my royalties
review_content: my only struggle is my royalties. they do not match my analytics and streams especially spotify streams , and its been over a year since ditto hasn't checked my problem. that Is why I rated it 3 stars...other than that , I'm happy with everything n their services. just my Royalties and streams that I'm worried about.

Long story short.Very bad service if you're moving from another distributor and your music was online previously.Can't cancel recurring subscription, and they insist I do it on my end even though Stripe (their payment processor) told me they can cancel recurring subscriptions from their Stripe dashboard. They're basically trying as hard as possible to re-charge my card in one year from now even though I dropped their service.***UPDATE***They seem to have finally cancelled my subscription from renewing, but still waiting for the refund since I was basically unable to use the service (due to my music being online previously, and not being able to use the same ISRC code for the track)***UPDATE***my order number was #2024974. Only reason I'm posting this is because I got a message saying that dittomusic requested more info and if I don't provide it my review could be removed. They know who I am and what the problem was, there were tons of emails back and forth...***UPDATE***To Dittomusic: I was not ignoring your emails, you were the ones ignoring my refund requests which I sent several times before posting my review here. Anyway, thanks for finally processing it.
I love the Support. It's fast and helped me with everything! I'm happy to release some music over this distributor

review_title: By and large I am very satisfied
review_content: By and large I am very satisfied with the service rendered. I’ve had some minor complications when attempting to upload my songs, but the help that the customer service have provided has thus far been successful.

review_title: Great service, but a little slow on the processing
review_content: Mostly we love using Ditto Music to distribute our music. The biggest flaw, sadly, is the very long processing time for new releases, which gives us virtually no time for pre-subscriptions to playlists, etc.For newcomers like us this is very crucial and we hope Ditto will work on this issue in the near future.

First off, not everyone makes money from music. You have to have songs to make money from music online. Ditto gave me a place to post songs that will be distributed despite no record label, or incredible production. As a result, I am building a residual income through music because of Ditto. This income pays for the membership and then some. Smile - DITTO!

Terrible sorry. They blocked my release of Bella Ciao because they say it is a cover version of “Mondina Workers” and they want a licence xD! That’s so ridiculous guys. Inform yourself about music history. Also they refused a song against racism because there is the word Nazi in it. ftw?! ..and so on..Cancelled my subscription!
The overall process and user friendly dashboard for operating and uploading as an artist is great. Ditto are also amazing at giving advice and helpful articles / tips on releasing and growing.
I've been using Ditto for years and love the ease of releasing my music and the incredible and efficient customer service, when I've needed it.  None better.

I don't regret joining Ditto as they are my second distribution company . Since I joined them ,I have control over everything in my music .They are reliable ,I managed to have a once off beatport account which other distributors don't have .I am able to view stats and see how my songs perform. I'm happy so far
Gets music onto countless platforms, usually great customer support however they can be terribly slow in every way

Excellent Experience and ability to feel safe uploading music that isn't copyrighted. The service is of great help, but I would rather have the less limitations on certain aspects of editing an already uploaded track.

review_title: Album did not release on release day. Many stakeholders involved.
review_content: On 5/12/23 we submitted an album for release to Beatport with a release date of 06/02/23. Come to release day, and the album is not live. The customer service chat widget says replies are within 4 hours but I never received any help. I paid for this release, and have no same day support, or any insight on how to get this live. This is our 18th release and to have the ball dropped for the many involved labels is very concerning. Please advise and contact us so we may get our album live. I'll be happy to adjust the review after.06-04-23There was a an integration issue on Beatport side which was resolved by their team and Ditto team. Review upgraded to 5 stars. Thank you.

review_title: Great place to manage distribution and remain independent.
review_content: Had a independent label with Ditto for about 10 years now. 4 of my own albums, 2 EPs and a handful of singles. as well as used for a few artists (four). My experience has shown that Ditto is one of the best options, to remain independent.  Great statistics reports on every release or artist by year.  Highly recommended .

Been using Ditto Music for about 6 years and it's been consistently awful.First, it's hit or miss whether they actually bother to upload it to the streaming services - the one thing you pay them to do!I've had to notify THEM when releases never made it to Apple Music etc, only for them to check and say it needs different artwork to the other 159 services they distribute to. This is 'apparently' to meet Apple's artwork guidelines, despite quickly finding countless other releases (many major) that are contrary to these.They've also delayed releases to question 'what the language the music was in', or their automatic system errenously thinks a song is a cover etc.Second, the support is shockingly poor - I've often waited 5 days for a response before getting a stock reply sent by somebody who didn't past my first sentence, yet they'll close off your ticket if you don't reply within 24 hoursThe website has always been buggy and a chore to use, especially when requesting payouts! Also been automatically charged, but the subscription not even take effect.They've changed the terms of my subscription unilaterally, wheras I paid for unlimited releases by unlimted artists for a year (up front), they then limited it to 6 artists WITHIN the year I paid for!Whilst I've no experience of the other services, I'd bet they compare flatteringly to Ditto Music.

I have been with Ditto Since September.I distributed my track and got about 800k streams on Boomplay.The first month was the hardest coz I was still building a community.That month is the only Ditto reported streams for 2 months later.I have texted them everywhere. I got continuous automatic messages telling me it will take at worst 6 months, but I am 8 months late and waiting.I can’t eat from 8 months of hard work.And I don’t even get no replies. I can’t recommend something that almost got me depressed.

It would be great if you could ask the artist if the profile that you are linking the songs to is correct, so it doesn't happen what happened to us. Plus, the waiting time is very long, it says 3 hours on average, but it's actually more than a day.

review_title: Ditto could use much improvement in…
review_content: Ditto could use much improvement in their customer service. I tried to release an album, uploaded all the songs, the album cover, lyrics et cetera. Than pressed the release button and we're off to go... open the champagne.... 5 days later, an email... screaming 'Urgent problem with your release'! further saying.. - Your release has been flagged for copyrighted content and is currently live in stores.'Without explaining which song(s) is/are causing the problem... so I email them...asking them to tell me which song(s) is are causing the problem... a response ....'Thanks for reaching out to Ditto support.Upon checking, I have noticed the reason for repairs requirement for your release.It states, that your release has been flagged for copyrighted content and is currently live in stores' So he is basically repeating what the screaming mail said.So I mail back...Thank you for getting back to me that quickly!But again… you don’t mention what song .. you are just repeating the original email … that there is a copyright issue… what I would like to know is, what song is causing the issue… if a copyright issue is there, they probably know what song is causing this issue, else they could not make this claim… so please tell me which song is causing the issue, thanks!The guy answers...'Sorry for misunderstanding!The release I was referring to is 'XXXX' UPC 5063268442581' Hope that explains it.Have a great day! 🤗Duhhh that was the release mentioned in the e-mail! Again I mail and ask which songgggg(s)He sends me an email, saying the issue is closed and if I can rate his support.I am answering that the issue is still there.... he answers backThanks for the feedback, I understand your concern.Looks like this needs a more in-detail expertise. I will redirect this chat to the responsible team to assist you with this request.They will contact you as soon as possible with detailed information on which exact track is causing the issue on your release.We hope on your understanding and consideration.After that it becomes quiet (2 weeks passed). Than suddenly an email from a colleague of the bright mind...She writes...Hello,😊Thank you for reaching out to us.Apologies for the delay as we are receiving a high number of emails which is affecting our response time🙏Upon checking your release here is what it says-Your release has been flagged for copyrighted contentAgain I politely ask her... which song?!I dunno.....Can you find out?No more reply...Sooo... after three weeks of incompetence, I decide to release all the songs of the album one by one... that way I will get an email about a song that is causing the copyright issue...First, I can't remove the album that needs fixing...Than I try to upload a new song... and get the error message:'Oeps! You can't create any more releases until we've processed the music you've already uploaded. Please try again in 7 days'Is my account blocked or limited?That is strange because I have a Plan saying 'Unlimited music releases for two artists'Ditto says.. Ready to get your music out there?We've got you covered....Ditto, You got nothing covered in my case!

review_title: Beware of Ditto Music's Deceptive Practices
review_content: Initially, Ditto Music lured me in with their promise of unlimited releases per artist through an annual subscription. However, it quickly became evident that their claims were nothing more than empty promises. The songs I uploaded for distribution were consistently delayed, leaving me frustrated and unable to effectively promote my music.What's even more alarming is their exploitative tactic of offering an "express release" package for an additional fee. It became apparent that Ditto Music deliberately delayed the standard releases, coercing artists into paying extra to ensure their songs reached streaming platforms on time. This predatory approach demonstrates a complete disregard for the success and well-being of the artists they claim to support.Moreover, their excuse of increased review times due to high upload volumes is nothing but a feeble attempt to mask their deceit. It is clear that their priority lies in extracting additional money from artists rather than providing a reliable and efficient distribution service.I strongly caution fellow artists to stay away from Ditto Music. Their false promises and deceptive practices only serve to hinder artists' careers and exploit their hard work. Look elsewhere for a distribution platform that genuinely values and supports artists' aspirations.

I run an Independent House music label and before we launched I knew we had to find the right Distributor so I did a lot of research checking out various options. There's a lot of decent distribution companies within the industry. There are also alot who masquerade as being decent but when you dig a little deeper you find all is not as it seems. I believe the 2 most important attributes a distribution co needs to have are an efficient release process & good communication. The one name that kept rising to the top of my shortlist was Ditto Music. They fitted all the criteria we were looking for. We are now 6 releases in with Ditto and any time we've needed to communicate with them they've been there for us. Their subscription fees are reasonably priced meaning you don't have to be a millionaire to get your music out there. Their website is super user friendly and really easy to use. If you're looking for a distributor who will help you get your music out there in a really efficient way without breaking the bank then I'd definitely recommend Ditto Music. They work for us.

From the very beginning, Ditto Music impressed me with their user-friendly platform. It was incredibly easy to sign up, and the whole process was streamlined, saving me valuable time. The platform's intuitive design made it a breeze to upload and distribute my music across various streaming platforms, ensuring maximum exposure for my work.What sets Ditto Music apart is their unparalleled customer support. Whenever I had a question or encountered an issue, their team was prompt and attentive in their responses. They went above and beyond to address my concerns and provide solutions tailored to my specific needs. Their support team's knowledge and expertise were evident, making me feel confident that my music was in good hands.The distribution process itself was seamless, and I was amazed by the speed at which my music became available on major platforms. Within a few days, my tracks were live on Spotify, Apple Music, and many more. Ditto Music's extensive network and partnerships ensured my music reached a global audience, giving me the exposure I had always dreamed of.Another aspect that truly impressed me was Ditto Music's transparency and fairness when it came to royalties and payments. Their clear reporting system allowed me to track my earnings and see how my music was performing across different platforms. It gave me peace of mind, knowing that I was receiving fair compensation for my hard work.Ditto Music is more than just a distribution platform; they offer a wide range of additional services that artists can benefit from. Their promotional tools, playlist pitching, and marketing strategies helped me expand my reach and connect with a broader fanbase. It's refreshing to see a company that genuinely cares about the success of independent artists and provides the resources needed to thrive in the industry.In conclusion, Ditto Music is a game-changer for independent musicians. Their user-friendly platform, outstanding customer support, efficient distribution process, and additional services make them an invaluable asset to any artist. I wholeheartedly recommend Ditto Music to anyone looking for a reliable and empowering partner in their music journey. Thank you, Ditto Music, for revolutionizing the way independent artists distribute and promote their music!
Ditto Music, One of the best music distributor

There are all these other services which they provide whether its taking up the promotional services to music licensing to name a few you are covered there is no other distribution company out there who keeps everything under the same umbrella to help you on this journey if you are looking to distribute your music as an independent artist choose ditto you won't be disappointed!

review_title: I loved the choice of words
review_content: I loved the choice of words, she understood the sense of urgency

review_title: Brilliant service. Reliable, cost-effective, relatively efficient!
review_content: I've never had any proper issues with the site so far. The only experience I've had that came close was when uploading my album 'Curiosity Killed The Cat'. As it turned out, the sound of birdsong in the title track (which I had pulled over from Apple Loops on Garageband) was copyrighted and therefore the entire album's release had to be postponed to a week later. This wasn't a problem or anything, but although I had uploaded the music for review in the middle of February, I received the email (stating that something was wrong) the day before the scheduled release (1st March). I felt that the system could have been a little more efficient, but it wasn't a problem. After all, I had made the mistake of using the loop in the first place. Other than that, Ditto has been very reliable and helpful. My music always releases on the correct date, and seeing the numbers go up for various different streaming services makes me very happy. As a teenage musician trying to get better at using studio techniques, I'm very happy with the way the service works, and therefore I'd give it five stars.

As a queer woman myself they thought I was misusing language that I certainly can use but I appreciate their perceived diligence

review_title: Ridiculously long delays in submission times
review_content: The ridiculously long time-frame from submission to tracks being sent to stores means you have no chance of playlisting if you release your music through Ditto. It’s taken 28 days from my last track submission and it still hasn’t been sent to Spotify etc. Communication with them is basically impossible and they told me afterwards that if I wanted it playlisted, I should’ve told him at the time by email, but this is not outlined anywhere on the website or during the submission process. Definitely go with a different distributor.

One of the worst companies I have ever dealt with and I believe in giving a chance and understand things happen. There is no way the great reviews are real here. Every release I have done with them had an issue that needed to be addressed, when I asked them to take my music down they didn't, I had to sign up for another release service that took them over. When I ask ditto for my payout more than 5 request now, they have ignored me. Yet they reply to other issues I would have. Funny they claim they started by musicians for musicians. Yet getting your payout is impossible. Say your money do YOUR research first. There are plenty of legit reviews out there about this company blogs and Youtube post. I will add that when they first started they had an actual contact numbers one was based in Tenn. and you could talk to a physical person, they ditch that and now good luck getting all your issues addressed especially when it comes to you wanting YOUR money.Update:  You have not tried to contact me as your reply says, that is a 100% false statement.

Among others, I would've given a 5-star review, but recent encounters with their customer service seem to have changed. In the past year, they are all eager to help you out and have a decent conversation even if it takes hours or days before they can get back to you. Now, it feels like they just want to get out of your case as soon as possible. Overall, the service is still great for what it is. Been with Ditto since 2021 and have to say that I've had a great experience so far. Yeah, I've had a couple of issues; like art work not being approved, but always worked out in the end. I do like the new online chat with support option compared to what there was  before.Would be great to get music approved sooner rather than closer to release date and not having enough time to plug to playlist creators. But I found that you need to be a bit proactive and give them a nudge at least a a few days after you submitted. The platform is easy to navigate, easy to upload your music and gives you the option to select where you want your music to go to. Royalty splits are easy andthe analytics sections is pretty decent to digest. At the end of the day, Ditto gets the music out there. Would be awesome if in the future they submit for chart release for free and an option to leave a legacy for a one time fee.

Ditto is Simply awesome, l really wished l met ditto earlier than now, i have a young friend having amazing rewards with Ditto music, am also looking at a good outing with Ditto..thumbs up for you guys for your simplicity and transperency...See you at the top as l start my campaign shortly...cheers

This service is absolutely shocking. I put my song in a month before the intended release date as ditto advised. Then, Ditto did not approve my song until a week before the release date, not giving me enough time to pitch to Spotify playlists or do any prerelease campaign (they didn't give a presave link until 2 days before either).  I wrote to support and asked them to move the release date further in the future to give me a month to pitch to playlists (as spotify doesn't receive the song until it's been approved by Ditto).Ditto advised me they had changed the release date after approval, but then their change didn't work and the SONG CAME OUT ANYWAY. After a hurried release campaign, they have now advised me they're taking the song down and making it available on the new release date in the future - after I've announced it and promoted it today to all my followers and friends. Like what?? DITTO has made me look like a fool and destroyed my release campaign and any chance of the song getting any streaming numbers by messing me around and not communicating. This service disgusts me and destroys all of the years of work I have put into this song.

review_title: This company can not improve at all
review_content: This company can not improve at all. I tell you all this once. Don't use this company! Ever. You have been warned. 1. Ditto charge you for 12 months subscription and during that period "decided" to let you know that you don't have any subscription. I still have one month left as of this writing. But according to them not. ( I have screenshots and recepie to prove this statement. )2. In order for you to get your royalty you MUST have a subscription. ( I have screen shots to prove this statement)3. They never get back to you in mail. And if they do it's with a "smiley" and "sorry for your inconvenience".  ( I have several screen shots to prove this statement) 4. Only if you contact them on social media (such as their Facebook page, Twitter, will they act - and almost on all occasions with, please PM'us or we have PM'd you.  ( I have screen shots and PM's to prove this statement)5. If you write anything critical on their FB page they delete your post or comment.  ( I have screen shots to prove this statement)6. I encourage you to use YOUR Twitter, Insta, FB, Tik-Tok not in order to sabotage their successful business of taking your hard earned royalties - but in order to warn other artist to use this "company".7. Yes they don't pay out your full royalty - I have more than 500K stream only from Spotify and got less than €170 from Ditto. With my other acts that are on CD-Baby I have been payed more then €1200 for less than 200K streams. I have asked and got no answer.  ( I have screen shots to prove this statement)8. No transparency at all for the money transaction.9. From out of the blue they decided to change  payout method to only bank transfer ( and thus let the banktransfer fee €3.50 eat some of your royalty)10. They withheld your royalty until you reach €25I'm trying to be polite and write nicely - but this company is exactly not the company you want to handle your carrier. More then once have they failed to upload songs on release dates in less than one year ( not once have CD-Baby, Tunecore or other I have used failed to miss a release date) .So don't use this company. You have been warned!

review_title: I've released an album with you last…
review_content: I've released an album with you last year "Connection"But I didn't have a record label, so I couldn't release it on Beatport. I've now got a label, and I've asked if could be possible now after nearly a year from the release,  to be release on beatport, someone contact me and 2 days later I've got the good news that my album is going to be release on Beatport and on my new record label. thanks to you. And you always respond to questions very quickly.

review_title: Terrible customer service at the moment…
review_content: Terrible customer service at the moment - I now have two issues that are unresolved and they are not complicated.I have in the past recommended Ditto - I cannot do so right now.UPDATE: After my poor review - several emails and some social media activity my issues have now been resolved. But I still currently have less than adequate confidence in Ditto.Which is a shame
hello, my experience in Ditto has been quite helpful on behalf of the team since they have given a very immediate response to my doubts and a very quick solution to any inconvenience

review_title: I am happy to share my amazing…
review_content: I am happy to share my amazing experience with Ditto Music, one of the most innovative and reliable music distribution platforms out there. As an independent artist, I was looking for a service that could help me get my music out to a wider audience and offer me a range of tools to help me grow my career, and Ditto Music delivered on all fronts.From the moment I signed up, I was impressed with the ease of use and the comprehensive range of features on offer. Uploading my music to the platform was a breeze, and the team at Ditto Music were always on hand to offer advice and support if I needed it.What really sets Ditto Music apart, though, is their commitment to helping artists build their careers. They offer a range of services to help with everything from marketing and promotion to sync licensing and YouTube monetization, giving me the tools I need to take my music to the next level.What's more, the team at Ditto Music are genuinely passionate about music and are always looking for new and innovative ways to support independent artists. They are constantly evolving their platform to meet the changing needs of the music industry, and I feel confident that they have my best interests at heart.Overall, I cannot recommend Ditto Music highly enough. They are a game-changer for independent musicians, offering a comprehensive suite of services, unbeatable value for money, and a team that genuinely cares about your success. If you're looking for a music distribution platform that delivers results, Ditto Music is the way to go!
I do like Ditto Music, the format could be a bit more 'user-friendly', i.e. more simplified.  Save that, I'm happy to continue to release music via Ditto.

0/10 Support & 8/10 Distro.A great distro all around, intuitive, etc. Their support, however, is 0/10. Took me 10 days, numerous Tweets, numerous email follow-ups, ticket/chat follow-ups, etc. I've never seen such horrible support.My new album was rejected from stores for breach of guidelines, but they won't tell me where or what to amend to fix this and their support takes forever to respond. Totally messes up our timeline and editorial pitches. The music industry is gray and needs human touch sometimes, and you won't be able to expect that from Ditto. Very hands-off.

I've been using Ditto Music to release music for a few years now and I have to send big love to the whole Ditto's team for a gigantic improvement to all their services over the last 2 years! At first I was a solo artist releasing my own music but it became a whole label now with half a dozen artists and it is a breeze to manage everything with Ditto! Releasing is easy .. .. customer service is now 5 stars and the prices are fair. I love the new payout system, it is so fast to withdraw royalties now! Ditto's team is clearly working hard for us now and I would be crazy not to congratulate the whole team for it! Thank you Ditto, you make it happen!

I uploaded a track 5 weeks in advance of the release date so that I'd have time to pitch it to Spotify Playlist editors. After 3 weeks Ditto still hadn't sent the track to music stores, so I contacted customer support and asked when it would be sent. From there, I got generic canned responses that didn't give me any clarity, so 10 days out from the release date (when it still hadn't been sent to stores), I asked them to cancel the release. No response. I emailed 2-3 more times with no reply, and then they went ahead and released the track, and finally replied on the day of the release saying sorry about it it's too late for you to cancel. I won't be using Ditto again.The only reason I'm not giving them 1 star is that the user interface is reasonably smooth and fluid to use.

review_title: A few years ago I read some bad reviews…
review_content: A few years ago I read some bad reviews about Dittos communication so I decided to distribute through Distrokid. From Distrokid I wasn't able to receive any of my streaming revenue due to USA tax laws and when I tried to contact the customer service it was impossible. I ended up cancelling my distokid account and was still charged and unable to contact anyone for a refund, still to this day and it was months ago!! Anyway, since being with Ditto over the past month I've had to contact the customer service several times with questions about my upcoming releases and they respond really soon and the customer service has been really helpful! I haven't had my releases out yet so I'm not sure how good the revenue system is but I am really pleased with the customer service :) And I feel at ease that I can contact people through the chat with any problems I encounter.
Fast response! :)
Amazing customer support, they reply fast, easy to release, free trial if you want to test it out first, legit, best distribution service for independent artists out there.

Would love to give more stars because it is a cheap option that does eventually get your music out there, but the customer service is terrible. It takes a week or more for them to get back to you, and if you submit music months in advance, they won't get it reviewed and sent to stores until days before release day, which means no submitting to playlists. If you are an artist starting out they aren't great for getting exposure, unless of course you are willing to shill out another $500 for their promotion package. My biggest complaint is that they have a bad system for reviewing music and answering customer questions. Most of the faq is vague, and like I said, customer service will take their time getting back to you. There is no number to call, just their inefficient ticket system. I have had bad experience after bad experience every time I have tried to release music. Not once has a release gone off without me having to pull teeth from the customer service team to get them to help me. If it didn't only cost $20 for a full year, I would have already switched over. You can bet I will as soon as this year is up.

review_title: Ditto Music is one of Great…
review_content: Ditto Music is one of Great distribution service.I work with 2 distributions services. Both are great and Ditto Music is one of great distribution service. Every musician and music artist might learn a lot by the support and knowledge of Ditto Music.

I went ahead last year and purchased a Ditto Music subscription. As soon as I wanted to launch music the nightmare started.If you try to search for help, they direct you to a “live chat”, where you can see agents are connected but they do not respond. Best scenario you get a short reply after 24 H saying either an automatic message or “we will ask our team and get back to you”.In some cases the waiting was way over a week for pretty standard questions. 90% of the time the reply did not help and certain questions unresolved.Once you get a response, it is impossible to reply back and since there are no visible support tickets this becomes absolutely impossible.I have written emails commenting about my issues and still waiting for replies.I do not recommend this company at all.
It was a nice quick response and answered my question exactly.

review_title: Ditto, a great way to get heard.
review_content: Ditto, reasonably easy to signup.  Making your first release, requires that you know a little about how the industry works.  How to format your sound files, create track art-work and add Artists and Contributors to your music.One big advantage of Ditto is access to Professional DJ Download sites, such as Beatport and Juno, on top of all the other streaming platforms that your music is sent to.  The cost to access Ditto, is most reasonable.On the downside, Ditto assumes that you know what you are doing, help & support can be rather slow and unhelpful.  In addition, the commission to earn royalties is excessive.PROS.  Easy, cheap, will get your music everywhere.CONS. Slow, insubstantial support, expensive royalty commissions.

review_title: Scam distributor , Suspended my ditto account ,
review_content: Scam distributor, please beware.Ditto refuse to pay us our sales revenue, and instead shut down our account. 12 months of hard work, down the drain. Our content is sleep/meditation music that is designed to be played on repeat by users during long listening sessions, attracting high stream counts per listener.Ditto refuse to acknowledge this. Instead they baselessly claim there is artificial streaming taking place, and they won't pay us!

Customer service became even slower, since the Ticket service has been suspended and only the chat is available, I am waiting for over a week to get reply from customer service. And I am going to be too late again because of them to pitch my single to the playlists, again.

Ditto Music is the best distributor for independent artists. My favorite feature is that you are able to set a same day release date, which is something that I haven't seen from any other distributor. If you want a high quality experience for yourself or your artists, choose Ditto!

THEY ARE BAD, DON'T REGISTER! I have a small label whose catalog I tried to put on DITTO, well, I started with a basic plan for labels because I wanted to test it since in the forums you hear a lot of bad things about this company but I, as I am stubborn, went to test it, the biggest mistake that I did, in addition to being expensive, they are cold, slow to respond and inefficient to solve problems, I have 75 pounds stuck there, which doesn't seem like much, but when it comes to artist royalties, it is something and it doesn't matter the amount, it's MY money that they are keeping it with the following excuse: You have another account with us, send us your email, and yes I have another account, because in addition to managing the Label I am a member of one of the bands, so I have the registration as an artist and as a record label, which is to be acceptable, however none of the emails I showed them were enough, I sent several documents of who I am and they continue to block, I already spoke with another artist who had his problem solved quickly but look there and he is european and i am brazilian of brown color, does my appearance and nationality have anything to do with that? I'm being treated like a thug since I just wanted to have a safe place to release my artists' music and I finally found a reliable place far away from DITTO, so my advice to everyone is to stay away from this company that treats citizens according to their appearance, nationality and purchasing power, this is very beautiful in current times!

review_title: Don't sign off all your copyrights to Ditto Music
review_content: We were (!) interested in releasing some music with Ditto Music after an advertisement on Youtube Shorts. Then we came across clauses in their terms and conditions - see link here: (Find their home page and go to subfolder en and terms - where they write :B) a royalty free, world-wide exclusive licence of the following rights as these rights are defined in the 1988 Copyright, Designs and Patents Act:The Performing RightThe Dubbing RightThe New Media Communication RightThe New Media Dubbing RightThe Foreign Rights Management RightThe International New Media Communication RightThe International New Media Dubbing Right- And one of us have now asked them what this is about. The occurrence of the word "Exclusive" and "Royalty free" in the same sentence where our prospect copyrights are concerned is concerning to say the least. One literally signs off all one's rights with that clause. There are further clauses in the same "agreement" which could make the small hairs in the neck rise.We are living in a free world, and any musician, however desperat he or she is, should indeed be free to act with a distributor like Ditto Music who are indeed free to design their clauses like above. It is however so, that this means that a hopeful musician may sign over his rights without any guarantee for any return. There are no calculations what so ever of royalties - only very vague descriptions of what Ditto Music intend to pay. Well. We lost interest. This legalese can be done much better, to the benefit of both musicians and Ditto Music themselves.===== 10 Feb 2022 =====The above stands. They say they tried to reach out. That is not true. I do not have any emails or anything else from Ditto. In fact they do not need to respond to me. Respond by creating new terms and conditions which do not look like the conmen of former decades, trying to net in musicians by sweet talk, and nauseating contracts. Well. No ditto, here. They can keep it.
Ditto's customer service is top-notch!The support staff are very helpful

review_title: Not the best, not the worst
review_content: I am using Ditto for a while now with my Label Vier Sterne Deluxe Records. I do like that easy setup and that you also can create your own cover out of a few pre selected pictures. The promo package is neat but for people that are longer in the buissnes not that good of a deal. Support is quick and even with payments I dont have any problems so far. - But why than 3 Stars?I do have one big thing to bring back on the tabel that leftt a bad taste. Back in 2020 I set up my best of album with Ditto for 2021. It took more than half of a year to check the album by ditto staff. When they checked it was rejected, every time for another reason. The funny thing: Nearly every song on that album was acsepted as a standalone single by Ditto months before. After a bit I did contacted our CD Distributor CDBaby and told them what happened to me and they helped me out activate that album also for digital distribution and went right away with it getting it out, do to beeing cleared before that. So to bad. For Singles & EPs they are good, for albums questionable do to my experiance.

review_title: Kafkaesque Chat Robot Prevents our Release
review_content: Sixteen days ago, we tried to release our music under a new name through Ditto, who'd released it the first time round under our old name. We waited and waited, our release didn't happen. A couple of days after asking their chat robot why (they don't do telephone support), we were told the old release was still active and needing deleting before we could "re-upload" our tracks under our new name. Did we want to delete the old release? Yes, we did. We were then told this had been done and that our tracks would be released under our new name within 48 hours. Days later this still hasn't happened, but our old release is still on Spotify. We message their chat robot again, to be told: "your release is inactive because your old release is still active. If you have requested this to be deleted, you may re-upload your tracks under your new name." So when the previous chat robot had told us our tracks would be released under the new name within 48 hours, it was lying? And despite our old release still being on Spotify, and despite multiple requests to remove it, and despite Ditto stating clearly that we can't release our music under a new name until the old release has been deleted, we're still being asked to re-upload our tracks, only to have the same kafka-esque cycle repeat itself?? All they have to do is delete our old release. It's been 16 days. JUST DO IT. DELETE OUR OLD RELEASE SO IT NO LONGER APPEARS ON SPOTIFY. And let us know when it's done. And respond to our messages. And pay for telephone support staff!
Just a great platform. Good overview, good support with quick answers. Nothing I can complain about.

Be very careful because they are hella fastidious when it comes to cover art. -TEARY-LOCO-MUSIC

We've distributed through Ditto for nearly 13 years and despite early startup teething problems (from both them and myself), with patience, they always resolved things to my satisfaction. They are by far, the best music distribution site. And I have tried others but Ditto is the best on ease of use and support. Great info and updates. All you need is clearly marked out along the way - but do READ it as music distribution is a complex world! Other sites control how and when you get paid. Ditto don't, there is no limit on income before payment or time constrictions on when you get your money. They recognise it as your money, not theirs. Their experience in music distribution and all its pitfalls has made what they do seem simple and seemless. Importantly, the way they charge shows they make no difference between high flyers and small independents earning little, they treat all the same - as they understand how quickly that can change. One of the few who are there to help musicians as well as themselves and understand the industry.I'm trying to think of any down sides to give as much help as possible, but to be honest, I've had no problems for so long that I'm happy to say go with them.Highly recommend.

review_title: Don't use Ditto. They're the worst
review_content: Stay away from ditto. They'll stuff your release. They took weeks to review my track then sent it to the stores a day before the release, which means i couldnt pitch the track. Sent them messages, via their help desk, chat and email, and got not response. There was no way what was happening. Eventually messaged them on their insta, publicly and they said they'd DM me. But it's just scripted call centre responses. They completely stuffed my release.

review_title: I have paid additional money for a…
review_content: I have paid additional money for a express publishing on my music to streaming platforms. For it not to be published in under 5days I'm now past the titled release date of 13th still no upload. I have raised tickets and still no response how do I call someone !

Avoid DITTO MUSIC!Avoid this company like the VIRUS ! They are yet another online trick operation (as if we didn't have enough of them). support -they ignored  I threatened them with court action , I didn't  get a response-I INVITE YOU HERE NOW WHO HAD BIG PROBLEMS WITH THIS COMPANY LETS SUE THEM TOGETHER-UNITED STRONG AND BETTER RESULTSTheir ........079 phone number has been disconnected too. According to UK Companies House they're a 'dormant' company, so goodness knows how they are allowed to operate a UK bank account.Their founders, Matthew and  Parsons are no where to be found either. PLEASE MY FRIENDS LETS TAKE IT DOWN THIS  COMPANYUPDATE:NOW THIS COMPANY WANTS EXPLICIT EXPLENATION ABOUT OUR REVIEW ,IF YOU PUSH THAT WAY WE GONNA ASK ALL (OUR) ARTIST TO GIVE YOU NEGATIVE FEEDBACK...OUR EXPLENATION IS :LAST SUBSCRIBTION WE ASK FOR REFUND BECAUSE WE ARE NOT HAPPY FROM THE START  YOU IGNORED THEN YOU START WITH PUNISHMENT DELAY OR REJECT OUR RELEASES DO YOU WANT MORE ???FALSE CLAIM ,DO YOU WANT ALL TRANSCRIPTION OF OUR COMUNICATION,WAY HOW YOU COMUNICATE WITH US.IF YOU WANT THIS FEEDBACK TO REMOVE FROM HERE REFUND ME FOR LAST YEAR SUBSCRIPTION (ONE WASTE YEAR OF ARGUMENT AND UNHAPPY CUSTOMER)

review_title: Ditto takes alot of (%) from your earnings!
review_content: Ditto says they don't take anything from their artists. Their artists keeps (100%) of their earnings. This is not true at all. For example I got 640$ out of 57K streams from Tidal on Tunecore. With Ditto I got £296 out of 58K streams... Ditto says it depends on where the streams comes from on Tidal, but in this case my streams came from the US from both Tunecore and Ditto. Tunecore pays the right price and Ditto takes alot of (%) from your earnings and pays the rest to you. I don't know if they do this with all other stores, but one thing I do know is that I don't recommend Ditto Music. They are also very slow to deliver your songs to stores. With Tunecore it only takes 2-3 days. With Ditto it can take up to 2-3 weeks before they send it to stores. Ditto is also very slow to reply back! Don't use Ditto Music!
Having assistance on hand to aid our album release is essential. Friendly (happy to help) staff offering professional and helpful advice made any alterations very easy to do.
I love ditto music services and I plan to keep releasing out here. One thing I would love to suggest is if you could provide playlist pitching services and bespoke for artists. Thank you

Avoid like the plague. I done 3 songs changed art work and file type on first one then obviously done as they asked on the other 2. None were approved now they say repair problem when they don't specify what the problem is. Customer service is non existent. Iv gone to distrokid already 10x better communication..

review_title: Support was efficient and resolved in a…

Everything is new and overwhelming for me, it's really a great experience to have someone supporting you from the support team. Changing the release date for my single to have more time for marketing and promoting is quite easy since a step by step guide can be seen right away in the messaging platform. Awesome assistance experience from Anastasiia and Raryna. So glad to be with Ditto Music. 🫶🧡

Ditto Music is quite dynamic once you get the hang of it without much effort, but it has 2 things that we have a record label package with them, it is the wrong thing they do with YouTube content ID, also for customer service they take too long to respond and most of the cases in which our staff has written to them for a problem they do not solve them, in It is true that the only thing that interests us about this platform is the specification of electronic music releases, for the rest we do not recommend this platform.

review_title: best distributor i've used so far (out of 5 i've tried))
review_content: customer service: really fast reply times (max wait only a few hours, and often within 5/10 minutes), and all done through live chat on the website rather than emails, so it's a lot more accessible. also solved my issues straight away (which with other distributors has usually taken at least a day).hope the service remains just as great - will update my reviews if anything changes and will remain honest, been great so far

review_title: Great prices, some bugs, lack of clarity in infos
review_content: Great prices of release plans.Fast answer support tickets.Unfortunentelly, there are some bugs across the platform, like if I want to change the name of an artist.Also there is lack of clarity/praticity if I want to take an artist down.Some erros don't seem to make sense to me, like: "needing the featured artist to have released at least 4 song to sign with". In case of new artists, it's an impeditive.Also, there are some bugs in lyrics. For example, my track 3 Pyramids and my album Mindstorm got lyrics that are not of my music.
Ditto is a reliable distributor and any minor problems that occur from time to time are dealt with swiftly and competently. Their SmartLink is brilliant and a must. Well done guys 👍

you guys are really awwsome with great chat support.Today i got my official youtube artist channel because of you guys thank you for everything.

review_title: Ditto Music is One of One!

Andrii is a customer service representative that i've dealt with who's helped me get a song that wasn't mine off of my Apple Music profile it meant so much to me that I had to come leave a review for Ditto and Andrii both! I'd love to meet the owner one day!

review_title: superb service and love ditto as a…

The rates are great, the analytics are great, the user interface is great! all in all I recommend ditto to everyone I meet in the industry. I'm happy I use them for my label, and I'm happy that I've turned others onto them as well. The only thing I'd say they need to work on is quicker album reviewing. However,  I have noticed them getting quicker and I suspect it was just simply a really busy time of year for them. No harm!

Straightforward, clear answer.

Scam distributor, please beware.  Ditto refuse to pay us our sales revenue, and instead shut down our account. 12 months of hard work, advertising costs, down the drain. Our content is sleep/meditation music that is designed to be played on repeat by users during long listening sessions, attracting high stream counts per listener.   Ditto refuse to acknowledge this.  Instead they baselessly claim there is artificial streaming taking place, and they won't pay us!   They also won't take down our recordings, despite takedown requests made in December.  They are continuing to collect our sales, and not pay us.   Please be warned.

Ditto genuinely cares and works extremely hard for its artist. Thank you so much, guys!
Pretty good mate no issues, they solve problems, respond quickly and get my music released on time, what more can I say apart from... check out my new tape, streaming on all platforms ;)

review_title: They don’t care about you or your music
review_content: I had put a song up with them and signed to get myself a Beatport label, accidentally has this charge disputed in my card (it was confused with another charge), they banned me, I told them that I could pay even double of the amount that was disputed, they told me to take the dispute down, I tried it 3 times and apple did not do anything, I asked them to please consider just getting my payment and getting me back in the platform for me to release more songs, they actually charged me for another year of they subscription and didn’t put me back in the platform, today is thanks giving 2 months after they told me to wait for a answer, today the emailed me saying that they just wouldn’t be able to ban me and that they are gonna be taking all of my tracks down (on thanksgiving sude, really?) you guys wont answer me the whole 2 months but you can manage to be working on thanksgiving and email me this🤦🏻‍♂️🤦🏻‍♂️. anyway, just bad experience, release you art with a company you trust.

review_title: Very good I have no problems but one
review_content: Very good I have no problems but one ! Sometimes we have art that is not copyrighted that gets the old Ditto music computer says no

review_title: Scam company avoid uploading music there

review_content: Don't bother uploading your track 2 months before intended release and coordinate your marketing activities accordingly. Ditto will check your release a week before and find problems that no other distributor has, such as generic wording in the song title and other made up crap. I have released rejected tracks with other distributors and there's never been an issue. Also, if you decide to "repair" the release by for example adjusting the title, a new release date is set, which means you miss the intended one. I've sent numerous emails to the support dating 3 weeks back in time and I still haven't received a single response. I can pretty much guarantee they'll be out of business and it is by far the worst service I've ever experienced. Take my advice - run the other way...

Cant imagine releasing my music with anyone else, everything is easy to use and even when you have a problem they have the best team to answer any questions with the live chat. Always super helpful and have sorted my only problem without any issues. So happy to have a distributor i can trust with releasing my music

Ive been using ditto for over a year now so your going to get a honest review. Everytime i release something they map it to the wrong artist profile. The ditto promo is not worth it i was robbed for £400  was promised playlists and real streams and fans and i did not gain one real extra follower or my streams did not even change i just got given press releases from veryyy low magazines and a few graphics. And was also told i can not get a refund so i suggest not using that promo as it will leave you devostated. You will randomly find other artist music on your profile. Royalties take forever to come in ive been using ditto about a year and a half now and ive still not recieved my napster royalties and most of my youtube, spotify etc. but apart from all that the ditto team are very helpful they will resolve issues within a few days or on the same day if you message them early. Its easy to use the website and upload music and videos etc. you can release as many tracks as you like for only £19.99 a year fee. They have their own blog that covers everything in music plus their own youtube channel showing you how to do stuff. Ive not seen any other distributor doing this. When i started music i reasearched distributors and i can honstly say i am happy with my choice i made. As i said ill be giving a honest review not all music distributors are gunna be perfect you will have issues just depends how those issues are resolved and ditto have a great team. Granted my promo was not refunded but in there defence it does say its not refundable. But in summary i feel ditto is the best distributor to go for

review_title: Focus on your Art and Let Ditto do the rest ...

review_title: Ditto is Amazing for Record Labels
review_content: I Run  a small Record Label in Canada and because of Ditto it has allowed me to start my company at low cost and push out tons of music to the masses. We have over 20 artists we currently work with and Ditto has been amazing. Early on I did have a issue getting a hold of customer service when issues occurred but since then Ditto's customer service over the years has gotten mush better and releases have gone much smoother. Overall I give Ditto 5 stars because its affordable and is honestly the best option out there if your a small label and cant afford white label distribution or an artists.
Terrible distribution service. Every single release has had an issue, wish I never made the switch from Distrokid,

Good afternoon,I have had a horrible experience with Ditto, I published an album and someone complained about one of my songs, of course, I immediately replied to the Ditto distributor that the album was mine and I even showed the contract that proves it.I thought everything was resolved when I suddenly have my entire album removed from music platforms.When I asked the distributor what happened, they replied that I also had to respond to Spotify (when in the email they sent me of the complaint they didn't give me any Spotify contact to answer, so I didn't know) about this complaint and as I didn't respond in 5 days not only the song was banned but the whole album.However, I've already talked to Spotify who says they understands my situation and is available to help me but for that they needs Ditto to be available to help too, I've been sending emails for 3 months and I still haven't gotten help, I hope that one day this situation be resolved but I begin to lose hope.

review_title: Ditto Music is unfair, don't use
review_content: I have a subscription with Ditto and I was releasing music a few months ago but I made a lot of streams so I would log in from time to time to collect my pay. My email got hacked and I guess the hacker started uploading all this stuff to my account, copyrighted music basically, and my account got suspended for it. I contacted Ditto support and they said they won't release the hold on my account. This is unfair. I didn't do this. I didn't even want to make a bad review but i'm being blamed for this, something I didn't do. No sympathy for me? if you're reading this Ditto Music, just give me another chance

I have already distributed my music to other aggregators and Ditto is my favorite. Since my first release, every question I have, the Ditto team answers me and solves my problems in the best way, helping me, in Brazilian Portuguese.Every report presented is very easy to understand, and releasing songs through Ditto is super intuitive and easy.The downside is that the email service is a bit long, I'm from Brazil, and sometimes it takes a while for me to get an answer.A suggestion, invest in Brazilian playlists and gospel playlists, the Christian market and Brazilian music in general is very large, it would attract many more people to Ditto.
Ditto is a life saver, now I can release my music to all digital music platforms from the tip of my hands. The service is just great and the pricing is reasonable. I love DITTO❤!!

I released my first tracks through Ditto a number of years ago and have never wanted to, or been tempted to use another provider. The service is excellent and I have always had help on hand for any issues I have had, although only a few and mostly due to my own mistakes :-) Ditto are a quality company and always evolving with new packages to help Artists who perhaps would not have this ability through normal channels. The pricing has always stayed on point, and I probably shouldn't say this, but extremely reasonable considering what you get out of it. Anyway, keep up the great work Ditto.

review_title: A hard to reach company with little…
review_content: A hard to reach company with little transparency. Also with "policies" that they apply when ever they feel like it. I do not recommend this company. CD-Baby, TuneCore etc are more serious, reliable and customer oriented. I suspect that royalties is withheld/reduced. The data they show for streams from Spotify doesn't match the data from Spotify artist dashboard at all (compared to other aggregators I use). The difference between the data that Spotify dashboard reports and the streams Ditto report is up to the several hundreds thousands of streams. I have asked about this but got no answer. And there's no way to get hold of them either - if you don't shout out in social media...then they act and respond. On top of all this, Ditto have several times missed the publishing dates (witch of course sabotages the PR connected to releasedates, events, clips etc)  - even if you give them more than months to upload songs to the streaming services. They also hold back your money for weeks so their "staff" can clear the payment. Not recommend!

review_title: I moved from DK and I regret it
review_content: I moved from DK and I am honestly regretting it now. I only wanted to change distributors to distribute on Beatport. When I contacted them prior to me paying for everything they assured me that it wouldn't be an issue moving my music across distributors but it has honestly been a living hell.Don't even think about using this service if you want to include anything on your artwork other than an image. They must just rely on bots to do everything because I have been trying to release one of my EPs for almost over two months now but it keeps getting rejected.The EP along with the whole catalog to date has already been successfully released on all major stores including Apple Music and Spotify. They made me change the artwork that only text relating to the music title artist and record label. They made me take catalog numbers and production credits off even though it was barely legible (micro you couldn't read it) and part of the actual record label sticker. I won't bore you with the back and forth but the customer care person I spoke to was terrible and even back tracked on what was allowed when I quoted their own requirements. It's a joke.I am disgraced by the almost non existent customer service. Takes about two weeks to get a response. They don't resolve your issue and close the ticket again!I have read comments about customers not getting paid royalties and honestly I thought it might be just a few one-off cases but now I am starting to worry about that too.

I am still a fresh ditto user, but my experience so far has been okay. For the amount that they are charging me for my subscription, the features I can utilize are very lackluster but also good enough. Either way, any online distro is genuinely a cash grab because that is how the music business works. There is always a catch. It just depends on if that catch is favorable to you or not. Genuinely recommend it as a start-up to your career but as soon as you are not benefiting from Ditto, leave.
So far everything has been smooth, the services are top notch and the support team responds very quickly. Honestly, I'm glad and satisfied with the services here

I have been using Ditto Music for a while. the simplicity of the site is absolutely awesome. I love how fast the support team responds to queries. I once had an issue with a pending release which was dealt with swiftly by the support team. Also, the fees are very affordable!

I wrote a review about Ditto on 16 August 2022 and gave them a 1 star rating based on my disappointment at the fact that they advertise that artists get paid 100% of their royalty payments while in reality Ditto allocate payments to be paid through Payoneer and Payoneer charge various fees to manage your account which dip heavily into your payments particularly if they are small ones like mine. However, one of their representatives called Morgan contacted me and acknowledged my frustration instead of taking the robotic and 'broken record' line of repeating 'Ditto pay artists 100% of their royalty payments' which another representative did over and over despite this statement being clearly wrong. Due to Morgan's intervention I have changed the rating to 3 but it will never be higher until the payment system is fairer than it is presently.Bruce Neilsen aka The Immaculate Crows

review_title: I have had such poor customer service…
review_content: I have had such poor customer service from Ditto. Repeatedly royalties have been 'withheld' without explanation or notification. When I've queried it (sometimes through multiple emails) the money has been released... why did it take me asking about it??I've had various problems with releases. Issues that they decide not to tell me about until the day the album is meant to be released. Why am I not informed in enough time to fix it so it can be released on time?For my latest album release it was not released on the date, and no notification or explanation was given. I had to ask... and ask... and ask... finally the 'problem' was fixed (I still don't know what the problem was).Why?!I sent this email a month ago... and have received no reply..."I’m glad to see the album has finally been sent to stores.Please can you explain:1. What was the problem that caused the delay?2. Why I was not informed that there would be a delay and had to spend so much time chasing?3. Whether or not you would have actually fixed it if I hadn’t chased it?4. What you’re doing to improve communication?5. What kind of compensation I can expect due to all these problems?"UPDATE: I've now moved to a 1 star review. I did get a reply back from Ditto... answering nothing that I asked. All they told me is that they cared (cheap words) and that they are very busy.
My experience with Ditto has been incredible, as I have been able to make my releases in a simple and fast way. Thank you for all!

Worst distribution company ever stole all my money I have over 2million streams and they only paid me 15 dollars then want even give me that expect me to pay for another subscription before I can even get that 15 they are a scam and the worst distribution company ever

review_title: Excellent Platform for Distribution and Promo campaigns
review_content: I started using Ditto a few months ago, and have already released 3 albums/EPs with them, with the 4th one already scheduled for next month. The platform and interface is very intuitive, easy to use and well presented. Their wide access to streaming and DJ platforms is excellent for independent musicians.I also worked with Ditto on a PROMO campaign for my most recent release (Assigned Galaxy - Dajals), which gave me a lot of useful insights and lessons on how to promote my music as an independent electronic music producer. The campaign has to be prepared with time for a successful reach to the audience, and I would only recommend that actually more time is spent at the beginning on the materials that the artist should prepare before the campaign is launched.

Ditto is a great way to start your music career, staff takes a long time to respond but is always very friendly. It does take a long time to get your song sent to the stores (which makes it very hard to market properly), but for the price you pay (+- 20 euro's a year), you can not expect much more.
They respond in time. Timely releases which is convenient for my brandGlad to be part of you guys

review_title: One of the best music distributors in…
review_content: One of the best music distributors in the market nowadays.The experience of releasing albums is way easier with Ditto; the ability to create a Label is also simple and gives us the chance to manage multiple artists with ease.Prices are 100% reasonable, and I recommend Ditto as your music release platform.

review_title: my experience with your services is good.
review_content: my experience with your services is great, I'm just challenged with the Vevo fees and prices of promotion packages that for me as an independent artist may find difficulties purchasing one yet i need it. thank you.

review_title: Ditto Music Can Do it All!
review_content: I have been very happy with Ditto Music and I am glad that I chose them to be my music distributor. My stage name is JB Elwood and I am a new artist and I love how easy their system is to use. I have been able to get my music videos onto VEVO, which is an incredible feature. I have used their promotional services. Now, I am going to look into their publishing services. I am super impressed with all of their features through their system, and I look forward to future releases with them. Thanks for everything!

Good Day ! I love working with Ditto Music I've released My Song but I'm happy working with you. The only problem I have with you Guys is that the other album dons'nt go through can you please do something about itI'm genuinely interested working with you 😃

review_title: Love to be part of Ditto music!
review_content: Love to be part of Ditto music!! All these years its been fun sharing my music with you!! Very happy working with Ditto Music!!

review_title: I am getting tired of DITTO
review_content: I am getting tired of DITTO.Constantly having issues with artwork. Any little text or image is considered “Additional Text”, even if its part of the aesthetic of the artwork or your own artists branding. It’ll subsequently be declined from being released. When the artwork is replaced, you will then unfortunately miss your original release date that you’ve set as you editing your artwork is then classed as a new upload, which then takes a further 10 days to process before being released. However, after 5 days of the artwork being reviewed (and changes made) another upload error email stating there is the another issue with the artwork, which happens to be the same issue as before. Constantly pushing your release date back, no way to efficiently change it without costing you your campaign… Not sure about Ditto honestly….

Genuinely the worst customer support I’ve ever seen from a company, have been emailing trying to get my account PAID for the past 9 months. Every time they say they’re looking into the problem the automated service closes my ticket because it’s been over 5 days. They have said that I haven’t responded, but I have screen shots proving I have. Don’t go near this company with a 10ft barge pole.

review_title: I've been using Ditto for 6 months, so far I'm satisfied
review_content: With Ditto my music is always released as scheduled and they're pretty quick to respond when you have a problem. So I'm very satisfied with their services right now. Plus they register my songs for free (when other services ask you as much as 2 $ per song !) The only issues I had was because of the legal music platforms' rules not with ditto (they don't want long spaces at the start or at the end of songs, on the cover of the records they only want the name of the artist and the name of the album and nothing else where mainstream artists can do whaterver the hell they want I'm pretty sure they don't bother Madonna or Adele in the same way with these dumb rules : these double-standards are odd but so be it) so when you learn these annoying rules, everything goes much more smoothly.So personnally I'd recommend Ditto anytime and to anyone. Plus they're cheaper than the competition. So what's not to like ? They're great.

review_title: few hiccups but all in all ditto is well put together
review_content: i have had ditto for a few years and have only had a few issues, one was when i paid twice for chart registration on a song release, they couldnt see that i paid 2 times. even after i sent the receipts multiple times. the problem was never resolved, i got sick of sending the same thing over and over and getting nowhere. 2nd was when i purchased my 1st PR\social media song campaign package ( ive done 2 campaigns) it took weeks for them to finally see my purchase i had the same issue of not being able to get through to anyone who knew what was going on efter i sent the recipts so many times i finally showed them that if an email with an attatchment goes to junk u must click NOT JUNK to bring the email to your inbox and be able to view the attachment ! other then these mishaps they are very thorough with their song campaigns, i had to give a lot of detail about the songs and they did everything they said they would like getting features, interviews , placements in influencers blogs n tik toks ect.ditto is inexpensive and they show me where every cent comes from and where every fan is located its just like cd baby or tune core. i will continue to use ditto

I have also switched from TuneCore to Ditto Music, and I would say I am very grateful for the switch. Ditto Music is affordable and gives you more freedom with your music.

review_title: Slow, poor comms, waste of money
review_content: I purchased a promo package and tried to use it with a single I uploaded 5 weeks ago.  When I asked for a progress update I was told that due to a high volume of releases that my release won't be looked at until 2 weeks before my release date.  This wasn't great seeing as I was hoping to have the promo campaign in the build up.  After expressing this it was moved up and looked at.  There was an issue with one of my tracks having too much silence at the end, so I rectified it and heard nothing for another week.  When I chased I was told that the other track had an issue, but I was only told because I had chased.  I responded 3 days ago to say I have fixed it, but today got an automated email saying I haven't yet responded!  As an experiment I submitted a track through Landr 4 days ago.  It's been sent to stores today, that was a cover song so was told would take longer than usual due to the extra time involved obtaining a licence.  I would take Landr's 4 days over Ditto's 5 weeks any time.  If I hadn't paid already for the promo campaign I would have moved all my music to Landr and cancelled my Ditto subscription.
Yeah Great services, but some services I wish could be included.

review_title: We love Ditto and the amazing Promo campaign team, we will be back :)
review_content: Second time around :) like everything else, with a bit more knowledge of the process, things get much easier. Customer service is always amazing, theyve always addressed our concerns,not that there were many, and if anything they were more to do with me sharing the incorrect assets file with them. Super helpful team and were very amenable to redoing all the work despite all the hard work they had put in to it already, thank you.  The time difference   works well for us, i send an email out last thing in the evening and i wake up in the early morn to a response from them, any further enquiries during the day are answered in a superquick fashion. Ditto has truly exceeded our expectations with our promo campaign, am really happy with the service and the outcome of their services. We are still learning alot and I must say it helps a great deal to be guided and nudged along by a dedicated team of professionals and music lovers.Thank you so much Ditto, your amazing staff, Ash, Olivia and the rest of the Ditto team. We will be back soon :) Warmest Regards,.

review_title: Wont pay my streaming earnings, wont respond
review_content: The service is fine until you want to take your money. I requested my music to be taken down in August 2021 and to be paid my streaming earnings. I have been periodically prompting with emails to no avail. My music is down and I haven't received my earnings. Where are they? Need answers. In a weird way its a bit of a relief to find out that others are experiencing the same stone walling but its terrible business. Do not use.Update 31 5 22Following Dittos (bogus) replyTotal bs have had no contact from them. They are merely replying to this review to seem as though they are working through the issue with me. Total bs. Lies on top of lies. I even went as far as to email them to keep the money they have stolen as I have left a frank review on trust pilot. Instead of answering my email they have opted to lie about attempting to contact me via this pathetic and clearly template response on trust pilot. Its actually laughable. Had no contact or correspondence from them since Nov 2021. Stay well clear complete bs merchant who dont payout.

I almost leave music.  Because Di++o wasn't paying me !!!! They say my music has only 1 stream from spotify.  Ohk.  But when i look on my Ytmusic it's been written that my music has 200 stream . I WANT MY MONEY !!!! They even deleted my subscription plan i don't know why . I'll also report this at RISA !!!!

I was very frustrated but I can say the support team was helpful. They were able to resolve the issue and my album was finally released. I'd say the only downside to Ditto Music is that if you are an American Artist the royalties are in pounds and the way to get them I yet to know. Overall, it's a solid platform.

review_title: For the price, you can’t beat this service
review_content: I want to say that this site is a poor man’s dream.  A great price to be able to copywrite and release your music.  Some of my releases had a bit of a pain releasing them where I was unsure at first of exactly what I need to do.  But the customer service did get back to me and we worked together until the release was perfected.  Some of the customer responses did take a little time, but for the price this service can’t be beat.

review_title: No customer service to be found
review_content: Horrible and really slow customer service. I wanted to try Ditto to see if they would have improved over the last years. Sadly, it seems like it is the same or worse.

Avoid this company like the PLAGUE! They are yet another online scam operation (as if we didn't have enough of them). In April 2022 I paid them £399.00 to 'promote' my band's new album. Yet, nothing has been done in some three weeks. and when I raised a support ticket, they ignored the first two. When I threatened them with court action in the third, I did get a response saying how 'sorry' they were about my 'frustration' but that they were 'experiencing high volumes of calls' so not to expect a quick response. Honestly, it's sickening. Their 0151 708 7079 phone number has been disconnected too. According to UK Companies House they're a 'dormant' company, so goodness knows how they are allowed to operate a UK bank account. Their founders, Matthew and Lee Parsons are nowhere to be found either. So I am making a trip to their Liverpool address this week (29-31 Parliament Street, Liverpool, England, L8 5RN) to see who (if anyone) still works there.
I really appreciate the opportunity that ditto gave me, they will never be a platform like this one.

I'm an independent artist and I was looking for a VEVO partner to distribute my music videos. I found Ditto Music 4 years ago, and since then, I've had great experiences on a complete and constantly improving platform. Thank you Ditto!
