review_title: Thank you for a good service
review_content: Hi. I joined Ditto one month ago. I really liked the experience I had. I used 3 different distributors before to release my music but your service I liked the most. There’s only 2 thinks what I think you can fix a little bit. 1, please let us add content ID to our music while uploading it. For example add one button to apply for Content ID. Because it’s not easy to contact you every time asking to get this feature. And it will be easier for your costumers support. 2. I would like to release classical songs to my piano artist, but it said that I’m not able to do it. I don’t know what is the problem but if I’d be able to do it via your service it would be just awesome.And also would be great to have mobile app to see the analytics and other stuff :)I love your distributor so far. Thank you 🖤

review_title: Nice and easy no problem at all with it.

review_content: Again, missed the deadline for pitching to Spotify playlists because Ditto has not sent off to the sites in time.Use Distrokid - it gets sent almost instantly every time with no issues.Thought I would use Ditto again as it seemed easier for an album release to use previously generated IRSC codes. Submitted several weeks ago to ensure lead time, and yet again it has not been processed.Highly recommend avoiding at all costs and use Distrokid.

review_title: Most enormous headache to release anything
review_content: Releasing music via Ditto is the most frustrating experience imaginable.I have now released two albums, both of which caused massive headaches, with a third having been sent to them over a month ago but still not being able to be released.It seems that every time you send off a release, they will find some way to block the release, without giving a reason.Instead, you will receive a generic email about how song titles and album titles 'can't contain generic words and word groupings or titles intended for search optimisation'.This seems to happen every time, whether any of your songs have generic, search-optimised titles or not, but they won't tell you which of the songs on the album has triggered the oversensitive filters.This means that, if you want to resolve the issue, you have to send them a support ticket, which will take a number of days to finally reach them, before someone eventually tells you what's supposedly wrong with the  release.But sometimes, even if you then change something and send off for release, it will just come back blocked again. I tried so many different non-generic titles for my first album, and had to wait multiple days for them to process it and then block it each time, before eventually getting it released.On this occasion, in addition to this issue, I've been flagged for copyrighted content. This seems to be due to the use of royalty-free Apple loops that come with Logic. (I've checked the license agreement, and the material is free for commercial use.)Of course, because I have used various Apple loops in a few of the different tracks I've uploaded, I have no idea which one is actually getting flagged, so I again have to wait for them to get back to my support ticket to work out which one, and I still don't know what I'm actually supposed to do to just get this thing finally released.The amount of time and effort that you will have to waste to get something released on Ditto is not worth the hassle. Look elsewhere.
Ditto is great to use, been releasing tracks using Ditto for a year now and it's never been better.

It has been a month since I cannot use the subscription I have paid for, they are trying to downgrade my account from 2 artists to 1 with success, I cannot use my account to upload other tracks this is unbelievable, why not allow me to upload tracks while they are doing it, this is cheap costumer support and attentionUpdate for ditto: I have replied back with the case number I have for a month now

Then Ditto need to have a very active customer service support.My Point:1- Effective lyrics distribution and synchronisation2- Early Song Delivery to avoid change of release date3- Customer Service Support.

review_title: Enabling all the hidden artistry to be heard
review_content: Ditto Music enables all the hidden artists to show their artistry and musicianship which otherwise they cannot.We live in 2022 where many unsigned artists are given opportunity to show express their talents by the means of using Ditto Music as an aggregator to send music to multiple different platforms. This is rather revolutionary in that people can still release music without the aid of record labels.I've been using Ditto Music since the UK lockdown 1.0 in 2020, and I'd heard about multiple different aggregators that do this job but back then I was still unsure which one I should work with. I decided it had to be Ditto Music based on hearing other's experience in working with Ditto Music, and I don't really regret a thing. Ditto Music has always been responsive to the problems or technical difficulties that sometimes occur, including adding contributors and artist name not being linked to music that was uploaded. The members of staff have always been very positive and helpful, and I never had any problem with how they answered my questions or how they resolved the issues I had.If anyone's been debating which aggregator, I will say choose ditto music, because it's arguably the best one.

review_title: I had just started life as a label and…
review_content: I had just started life as a label and the first distribution company I signed up to expected all the answers to be in just a handful of FAQ online. No humans around ever! How scary was that! Fast to take my money .. and, well. non existent support! I did yet another search..  for a replacement distributor. And one that  had real humans to help me in every step I was to make in ensuring my artists had their tracks released to the world. I could not let them down.I had to place trust in a company. DITTO was showing You Tube videos  on how to do things.. and more. so I took a chance.I admit I am no newbie.. quite computer literate, an ex ghost songwriter and now a label owner.. but this distribution  was like an alien language! However Support IS THERE.. and despite an auto email after my support request, informing me  a response may be slow.. I have always had my problem resolved within 48 hours. and the DITTO staff must all know me very well by now - because even though I have design AI (Application Interfaces) with Usability in mind..experience, I do find some of the distribution interface confusing. But If I do something and I realise Ive done it wrong- those friendly professional and knowledgeable support staff are on hand and even explain things to me. ( I write the solutions  into a notepad  should I need to refer to them another time). Apart from this,  I have found DITTO friendly, have a great range of online stores, and offer other services which I may try out later on this year ( Promotion). Their SUPPORT is second to none and yes! they DO have real humans ! and a lovely team they are too! -You know who you are! - Angela H EvansI have given DITTO 4 out of 5 stars. Thats for the customer support staff! The missing star is due to the electronic music distribution interface which could be more  accessible / usable and the fact all the wording  YouTube videos   etc  state "artist" and no acknowledgement of LABELS. We do play a very important role for artists and fans and to be ignored  makes me feel as if I am invisible, which I know I am not!! PLEASE! Im sure I'm not the only  indie label  you have here!Overall Yes I do like and trust DITTO as my distributor  of digital music and I see no reason to change. NO -I have NOT been given ANY incentives to write a fully positive review of DITTO. I used to be a professional music reviewer (taste-maker) and was always blatantly honest then and see no reason why that honesty should change here in this review.

Your live chat gets 5 stars it was a very quick and helpful experience but it had been 19 hours and I was stuck with a ticket that says it is still being processed!! Please allow me to use my PayPal as an option to pay with!!

review_title: HIGH PRIORITY : DITTO REFUSAL TO TAKE DOWN ISSUES FOR YEARS.
review_content: Since 2019, I have requested for my song to be taken down and I was told it was taken down by their  Content Team, now that was 2 and half years  ago. Fast forward 2022 march,  I realised that my song was still powered by ditto with someone elses face on the account powered by ditto. I have complained about this issues several times via countless emails  but they just refused to listen to my request telling me they will contact the content manager and that it will take a while . its been 2 and half years with relatively the same email "it will take while" with no time frame on sight. i have spent money and time on my music video attahched to the song for years, but cant promote my video due to this issue. i feel so strong armed by ditto. i have exhausted all my options for years now which has caused me so much truama and it's so torturing. i dont even know the artist they assigned my song to, i dont have any subscriptions with them for years. i just need help by any means necessary here to get my song taken down from the clutches and jaws of ditto music. any help will be welcomed here .

review_title: It is good but loses in several aspects to other distributors.
review_content: I think Ditto Music is a great distributor, but it doesn't have some basic things that other distributors have and that's why I think it loses a lot of customers. When you release a song and confirm it, you can only edit it by sending a ticket, I think this is very bad for the platform because support takes 7 to 12 days and if the musician wants to release the song quickly. Another thing that several distributors have that is super interesting that Ditto doesn't have is the Pitch in the launch itself or for the distributor's own playlists or Apple/Spotify etc, most distributors have a pitch or partnership with streaming companies, in my view I think Ditto is good, but very vague.
Ditto is truly the best, I was very happy to hear about it and actually try it out. I'm happy to be a Ditto Member.

review_title: so far I'm impressed with the services…

review_title: So my only complaint is having to pay…
review_content: So my only complaint is having to pay for this music chart access , I feel that as an isrc code is provided then we have the right automatically to hit billboards

I am very disappointed with Dittos customer service team and the overall experience that we have had from the service. As a label we rely on our distributor (DITTO) to ensure that our music is released by the date quested and is linked to the correct profiles on streaming platforms. We have had three occasions where our music has been uploaded and linked to incorrect profiles on Spotify and Apple which has impacted our artist in marketing and advertising their music. It is very unprofessional and gives our label a bad reputation. Frankly it is an embarrassment! Dittos's ticket system for support is lengthy and vague and on this third occasion has still not been able to resolve our issue. An artist account has now been created on Spotify and Apple however the release is now not linked to their profile/ catalogue. It would be much easier to speak with a real human being in order to resolve these issues. Sadly we will not be renewing our subscription with Ditto and will be going with a new distributor for our next release and artist re-release. Such a shame. I would not recommend their services to anyone unfortunately.

review_title: Most simple, yet powerful producing company.
review_content: I don't live in europe, so I'm not their employee. I am an American Singer/Producer named SteelFusion. I'm not impatient, and I don't personally believe that a good artist is impatient either. Ditto music was the most smooth transition for me EVER! I have all my old music on Soundcloud, but I wanted to take it further. I have been working with ditto for at least 2 to 4 years now. I don't mind that I can't bring my soundcloud stuff to ditto music really. I am truly excited for the end of march 2022 because that's when the world will get to see my first album. If you are new to music or a veteran, my opinion is still the same: this is the most streamline producing company in the world. Give it a try!!

review_title: Ditto's Dashboard makes it one of the…
review_content: Ditto's Dashboard makes it one of the easiest platforms to upload your music for distribution. From there everything goes downhill! The number of errors and the nightmare to get them sorted is what knocks this service right down to the bottom of the list. I feel for the staff that has to reply to what I assume must be millions of complaints and emails every week, I must add that though they make every attempt to respond as promptly as possible I have had on many occasions found myself with no option but to call them out on public platforms. It must also be said that even though a majority of the problems I have had may have arisen from my errors in uploading, the errors that Ditto has created are often irreparable! The staff I have dealt with have been brilliant and I would never apportion the whole blame to them however it does raise the question, more than often, who is to blame for some of the mistakes. I don't know what operational difficulties are faced by Ditto, but I would certainly give serious consideration before renewing any subscription furthermore I am cautious referring their service to anyone without regaling my experiences first.

review_title: I have been using Ditto for over a year…
review_content: I have been using Ditto for over a year i think and i've not had any issues with them they are great!

Very bad experience with their licensing team and supportSo i did buy a very expensive plan on their website and uploaded my music. Their explenation for that was that friends of me had listen to my music for over 1,2k times in  one month. That basically means they did jam my music for about a night from the streamcount perspective...All in all I had a very bad experience and I wouldn't recoommend this service to any new artist!- As I told you it has to do NOTHING with streaming from Bots or people who don't listen to my music. Ignorant streaming service!

review_title: good for a starting DIY musician
review_content: My experience with ditto music over the last 2 years has been so far a net positive. It's quick and simple to submit releases and is clear with what is required. there is a set price for a yearly charge to be able to submit as much music as you want each year, no hidden fees and no charge for individual submissions. you also have access to royalties and you can get yourself a vevo channel through ditto too. the only negative experience I have had with ditto is sudden issues with my release just before I planned on releasing something, making my release date go further back. However ditto has became alot more clearer with what I specifically need to change with a release before I can have it sent to stores. Last time I had this problem I got a ticket sent with a very detailed list of things that had to be changed and ditto actually automatically made these changes themselves, something that never used to be a thing when I first joined ditto, so it is nice to see them actively making releasing music more streamlined and simple for users.
Ditto has been the essential distribution channel for my music, so I'm on 5 star as I continue with my plan for the year, with this being said I still apprehend ditto

review_title: Horrible Customer Service, Even Worse For Public Domain Samplers
review_content: The service does what it’s supposed to, when it works. When it doesn’t work, good luck getting any help. Example: I have to reach out to Customer Service for some reason or another, so I send an e-mail. I wait several days for a response that does not help me, and if I reply to that e-mail, I simply dont get a response. So I have to copy and paste the first correspondence into a brand new e-mail, send it off and wait a few more days for another response and then repeat the whole process if I have to reply again. This has happened many times, whether it being due to them billing me twice for a single year, or other issues. Which brings me to my biggest complaint…i use public domain samples in a few of my songs, and they claim they have no way of releasing these songs due to the samples. You have the option of saying I’m not using any copyrighted works or I am using copyrighted works and here are the documents allowing me to use them. There is no in between, such as with public domain materials. I’ve explained that the materials used are indeed public domain, and they say they cannot help me. This has been going on for 2 years, and in that time I’ve seen multiple other sites who do the exact same thing that Ditto does make numerous improvements. Meanwhile, Ditto is still the same barely-functional service it was when I signed up. I’ll absolutely not be renewing my subscription when it’s up for renewal at the end of next month. It’s a shame too, as I think that the actual act of posting a new album is pretty seamless and easy to navigate (unless the page crashes during the upload process, which has happened many times for me).

Awful. Three releases and all went full of problems, every next being worst than the previous. I must admit support officers do really try to help, but it feels like they are struggling with their own company as much as I did.At all times my release date where screwed, my metadata was broken, I had to take down releases and re-submit them. It always meant broken release dates, broken PR-activities, extra-charges for re-submission, as every time I had to pay again. In one case - three times. So instead of 140€ the album did cost me 420€. That’s before I’ve dived into their ‘label in a box’ thing, which turned out to be just a box and a subscription plan, as by end of the day they did not open company and bank account for me (as promised when you purchase) and I’ve ended up doing that myself. But I’ve got the branded pen! Which by the way dried out pretty quickly, as if it spent couple of years in the storage before getting to me.Moral: do not run for cheapest guys, there are plenty of services out there. Even if you google ditto, one of the first things you’d see would be stories of their unreliability and problems. Great as idea, but the realization and the outcome are simply horrible, costing time, money and nerve cells. Not worth it at all. Skip for any other service and it will be better for sure. As soon as I’m finished with current releases I’m leaving them for sure and would be happy to never look back and forget about this service as soon as possible.

Not to mention I actually won one of their competitions and still get treated worse than a Southampton fan In a Portsmouth bar. I truly believe that if the CEO wasn't so busy playing with make believe money and pictures that you keep on your phone, he'd be able to sort this mess out. Here's something you can store in your crypto wallet, yourself, you non fungible t***!I wanted to stick with a UK distributor, Someone who bats for the little guy. Supports growth and represents independence. However, Ditto supports their own growth and steps on anyone they possibly can. Waste of time and money, stay well clear and go somewhere with better service.

review_title: Worst company I've ever dealt with, and that's an achievement.
review_content: Ok. My experience with Ditto in the five years I've been running a label (using Ditto as the distribution agent) has been so bad I don't even know where to begin (I honestly could write a whole book on it) but let's just start with the final straw shall we....I paid for a full subscription with them on 5th July 2021. Towards the end of October 2021 I went on the site to look at my royalties, apparently I do not have an active subscription, so don't have access to royalty funds, can't release anything etc. I queried this on 30th Oct [#476514]. I am STILL waiting to hear back about this matter! More than 3 weeks later!It used to be that you could talk to someone more quickly on Twitter. Not now it seems. I am getting no responses from anywhere about this.If this was a one off I could sort of let it slide but it's not. Things like this happen constantly with Ditto.I want my £69 back asap or I will start talking about my experiences with Ditto on Facebook where I have nearly 5000 music business related friends.My advice?...Unless you want that sick feeling in the pit of your stomach that your music is in the hands of a company who you simply cannot trust to get even the simplest thing right 24/7, I implore you not to put yourself through the utter hell I have experienced at the hands of this vile company.

If you're reading this, STAY AWAY FROM THEM.They charge you for services but don't deliver. They shouldn't be in business.

review_title: Abysmal customer service. One year on and still no royalties. Get your act together Ditto!
review_content: Just for some context - this is the first negative review I’ve ever written! But Ditto’s customer service is a joke - I’m fed up, and I want the royalties I’m owed.It seems that Ditto are good at digital distribution, but terrible at dealing with any hiccups along the way.I logged on to my account to see a withdrawal for £79. There was a notice next to it saying that Ditto no longer used BACS to transfer funds, but now used Payoneer, and this £79 had been sent to my Payoneer account. But there was also a red box on my dashboard saying that Ditto were unable to set up a Payoneer account for me?! So I got in touch and asked for the money to be added back on to my Ditto account balance so I could set up Payoneer myself/verify my identity which I thought was the issue. The employee I dealt with said this was not a problem and she’d let me know when this had been done.A year later I remembered I was owed some royalties and checked back to find it still hadn’t been added on to my Ditto balance. I opened a support ticket and after a week of waiting for a reply they closed my support ticket with no response. After that I wrote again and asked for some help getting the money I was owed, and they said they’d talk to Payoneer. Payoneer have now said the money was withdrawn last year - during the time I was told by Ditto that I wasn’t able to set up a Payoneer account! I don’t understand why the previous employee understood the issue but didn’t reinstate the balance. It feels like the person I’m dealing with now doesn’t grasp what has happened, and the response time is slow. I’ve been actively trying to sort this for over a month now, and I know it’s not a vast amount of money, but every little helps, and it’s the principle.All in all - avoid! It’s not worth the risk and frustration. You’ll probably be fine if everything goes smoothly, but if there are any admin/tech issues you might not see your hard earned money.

Just a reminder , Ditto do NOT pay you all your Royalties . If you complain too much they will shut your account . 100% true as I know . The reply from Ditto below , is a typical one , all lies . They wiped 7 years of work from all the stores . Good one Ditto .

review_title: Great Price. Great Service. Enticing Extras!
review_content: Great price and service but Ditto has a bunch of extra applications and packages which seperates them from their competition.Everyone who works there (from my own experience is very helpful).IF the service is ever slow they always give you reasons as to why so your not left in dark & they do always deliver.Also. They seem to be one of the only companies that understand that you don't need a mechanical liscense for streaming services and don't try to pull the wool over your eyes so you can buy one of theirs (unlike so many others)Ditto has high standards when it comes to music and artwork. This in turn makes you work harder. I've learned a lot from this company simply by uploading.

review_title: I'm a very simple person I can be upset…
review_content: I'm a very simple person I can be upset and still pray for God to bless you.. And for you Ditto I love you and pray for your tremendous growth and improvement. When people pay $459 dollars for 4week campaign try to promote their content it's hard for me to say I paid you $459 US dollars and this Campaign got me nothing much than photographs designs you made me with my photos I sent to you guys.. I'm not happy for the result I got from this campaign I bought.comig from me to you guys Honestly. But yet I pray for God to bless you and increase you with strategies and concern for the indie artist's interests.. Everyone wants streams not photographs to post & guidance on how to post I can handle that on my own.. I'm truly not happy but yet thank you.. Do better please Ditto music.. You're an amazing recognized company and highly respected but put the independents artist interest first please because you guys gave them hope to work with you independently and they trusted you with their money to buy your campaigns. My name remains Officialsiino across all social media platforms. IG / Facebook/ Twitter.. God bless Ditto God bless me God bless all independent artists trying their very bests out there.. And lastly God bless all signed artists nations wide I'm happy for you guys enjoy❤❤❤.. Peace and God's love from West Africa, Nigeria...

review_title: I have had great experiences with Ditto…
review_content: I have had great experiences with Ditto Music, with the exception of two duplicate charges in the last two years, both of which have been resolved, the last one being more difficult and time consuming.

Ditto Music is one of the best distributors out there. They have direct contact with the YouTube Partner program, which allows you to get an official artist account in a matter of days or weeks. Their distribution system is also pretty easy to use, and, they distribute music to ALL stores. Their customer support is amazing and I have never complained about them. It's worth paying for.

review_title: User Beware. Been with ditto for around 12 months
review_content: Been with ditto for around 12 months. Accumulated a piddling $120 in royalties and requested a payout. Their process of Proof of Identity beggers belief. First you have upload a document, say drivers licence, then they demand you take a cheesy selfy video to prove your Identity. Don't forget in the 12 months previous I've logged on to my account and paid through PayPal a number of fees and charges. I have tried several times to be paid out but their system keeps rejecting my request due to poor quality of ID photo upload or whatever. You would think my credentials were in order via PayPal.Their system is flawed and I believe breaches privacy laws. If you are looking for a promoter use Record Union. Happy to discuss with anyone. Cheers Brett

Ditto Music has redefined the way I reach new fans with my band's music. Dittos ability to distribute our music to so many outlets at once for a low price is unmatched. We are 4 years into our relationship with Ditto and couldn't be happier with how much they have helped us grow.

One of my albums has Nepali font on its cover but they only wanted English on the cover. All they want is my name and album name in English. They didn't listen to me when it is essential to have a Nepali font for my nepali album. Pricing is good but this platform is not good for everybody. I am planning to go back to Tunecore if the issue is not resolve.

review_title: My Spotify profile was linked to an…

review_title: Too long to review, terrible support
review_content: "Edit"So things got worse - if you can imagine. On release day, just sent out the smart link for people to stream the song and it is still showing "presave" not only that, but it shows the old release date (13th August instead of 20th August) which we had to change as we had to push the single back a week due to how long Ditto took to process it. This is 5 weeks ahead of release date we submitted this song.This is the final straw so we will be using someone else moving forwards.If you want to pitch your song to Spotify editors, you really need at least 3-4 weeks lead time - I know it says 7 days, but in reality, the longer the better.For this reason, it is good to get your songs to your distributor way ahead of time.Unfortunately, it seems with Ditto that the longer ahead of time you send it to them, the longer they take to review it.My most recent release has been in review for nearly 2 weeks - and it gets longer the further away from release date I send it to them - for example, when I sent to them a couple of weeks before release, it was reviewed within a couple of days.And regarding their support - you can be waiting many days for a response.Finally, when trying to actually release a song it constantly says "your cart is empty" an issue with their site which they never give a reason for and never seem to fix.Getting worried about royalties now reading some of the comments below...Now looking at alternative distributors so I would advise to avoid them.

review_title: We are happy to work with Ditto
review_content: We are happy to work with Ditto. The system is good and the support via chat is always first rate. We only have one observation to make that you could have the option of having more than three main artists per song. We know you have the Multiple Artists option, but that option doesn't fit the bill. We ask you to rethink this and put the option of having as many main artists as we want and can have per song. Other than that, we just have to be thankful.
I've released 3 EP`S with ditto and really nothing bad to say all GOOD thumbs up..
As an independent artist (band). Ditto helps us to keep up to date with bigger artists. We have had nothing but great experiences with them and will continue to uses them for all our future releases.
Very satisfied with how easy it is to navigate and upload new music.

Ditto Label Service (RLIAB) has proved very good for us, we have quick responses as an independent label, usually within 24 hours for any queries we may have. The RLIAB pack you receive with certificates, journal and USB pen are nice quality and make you feel a valued part of the Ditto family. Label set up process is straightforward as Ditto staff guide you all the way, doing much of the paperwork on your behalf, All in all, highly recommended !!

Amazing everything, Dittomusic is no doubt the best online distributor you can find anywhere in the world you can @ me on that. Smooth process overall, amazing amateur relate-able  dashboard. Give it a trial 😉

Today's chat - a great prompt service and happy to have someone on the end of the chat to help! review_title: I found it very good....according to me…
review_content: I found it very good....according to me it is best. it solves our problems immediately.

This company is an absolute scam! -they say it takes up to 3 months to get your royalties from different stores-when I reached out after 3 months they then told me it was going to take 6.-6 months later and they say we're still waiting on Spotify to send us your reports.....(Falsely lead you to think that you're getting your royalties in 3 months as states on their website)-I've read through every single page on their terms and conditions and nowhere does it say anything about royalties taking longer than 6 months.-GOING ON MONTH 7 STILL NO ROYALTIES-I have asked to speak to multiple supervisors and get no response back-This company holds your streaming royalties in some sort of high interest account then pays you whenever they feel like it or if they pay you at all!AVOID AT ALL COSTS!CHOSE A DIFFERENT DISTRIBUTOR

review_title: Amazing Chat support but something broken in the backend
review_content: First, let me state the pros - Very Easy Site , Their Chat support is Outstanding and their release cycle is quick. However, everything turned topsy turvy last week when they contacted me saying that I have too many streams in Spotify and after I followed up, they said my covers had too many copyright claims - My covers are released on YT first, and Ditto says they  have copyright claims! especially when I sent them to streaming stores?  I really expected better from them. I don't mind if they take down my covers from the stores so that I can use another distributor and upload them. Even that is not being done by them as yet !! I tweeted, contacted them by email, however - it's amazing silence! Please take down my songs if you see copyright issues, else let's at least chat/communicate on email - Not taking them down, shows incorrect intent. Ticket number #438659. Hope you will respond here atleast.Updated after Dittos reply. - You never contacted me prior to suspending. None of my content was fraudulent as they were instrumental covers created by me and You authorised covers to be upload to streaming stores. I replied back to you with proof of emails sent by Ditto where you mentioned its a cover and hence being sent to streaming stores. After no response from you for 3 days in the same support I asked you to takedown my covers if they had issues. You haven't yet taken down any of my covers. Infact after suspension some of my newer covers were sent to stores. If the covers were fraudulent, had issues, why haven't they been taken down yet? I also raised another support ticket for a takedown of 1 song just to check if you are really taking songs down, and I don't have a response yet to the new support ticket(72 hours +) , while you are stating non factual information here. What is the intent of stating something about copyright and Fraud when you don't take down my covers which are getting more than 1000 streams a month. Hence I repeat - you didn't contact me about anything before suspension, I have sent you evidence that you haven't. None of my covers are fraudulent as I have evidence of me creating all of them and all of that content are in public domain on my YT artist channel. You are free to takedown all the covers if you have received complaints about them. So please confirm that you have sent notice to stores to takedown my content if they had issues. Please  confirm that you have taken takedown action as I can't work with a non communicative unreliable distributor. Not taking down my content, and just sending emails or responses that my content is fraudulent and has copyright issues shows fraudulent intent from Ditto and not from me. Thankyou for responding here (atleast) with the same short email you sent me, without any evidence.

review_title: AVOID DITTO MUSIC (join me in taking them to court)
review_content: AVOID DITTO MUSIC! I have made the same experience, as some of the other people here.They have kept all my royalties and have hijacked all my songs since last year.I do not have access to any of my songs and they ignore  my emails.They have a system in place to cheat out artist of their royalties and they know very well what they are doing!They will close your account, how they say, because of artificial streaming. They will do that at the point, when you try to withdraw your royalties.In my case I even sent them proof by Spotify, multiple times, that there is nothing wrong with the streams on my artist account.My full story with them would be too long to lay it down here. My artist name is Cousin JMF. I own the music label Skyline Records in Germany.And I am preparing everything with my lawyers now to take them to court.If you had similar experiences, please let me know here or better contact me over the contact form on my website.I don't know if I can link our websites here. If i can't just google Skyline Records Frankfurt.

review_title: Throughout my instability, Ditto was the ROCK
review_content: Due to some instability on my part, an issue with Ditto's glitch with recovering funds from sales of Amazon's physical CD sales remained in a state of limbo on my account for years. Yet each attempt I made to rectify, I was greeted with sincere desire to resolve the issue and to cover more than just some missing dollars with that resolution. Last week I finally was still enough, long enough to allow Ditto to make good on their offers and they made very good. When the CEO takes the time to respond to a very insignificant artist so as to assure their satisfaction with the outcome, THAT is the distributor I will be staying with. Thank you all @Ditto Music for caring!

review_title: Responsive, supportive, reliable - what you need from a distro
review_content: Ditto aren't perfect, because no distributors are due to the high volume of music passing through their servers every day, but they're pretty damn close. If I've ever had an issue they've responded within 1 week and always fixed any problems with uploads, previews, changed artwork etc. The only thing I think could be improved is sending pre-save links sooner, I've got a release in 7 days and still haven't received a pre-save link. Good company values, CEO has their head screwed on and they won't take your music down if you decide not to renew your subscription, (unlike their competitors) really appreciate this as it's kind and empathetic to remember people run into financial difficulties and cannot afford to carry on with music (we all know being an independent musician is a huge money pit). Overall Ditto provides a good, reliable service. I hope they elevate their business in the future with the return of live shows and put on shows/festivals with Ditto artists, that would be incredible!
My best experience ever when it comes to issues being resolved Thank you Ditto 🙂

review_title: Ditto has made it incredibly easy to…
review_content: Ditto has made it incredibly easy to start a label and their system is so easy to work with that successfully marketing the music I have released has been a breeze and finding success was far easier than I expected.

I run a growing independent label in the UK.I chose Ditto as they have a way to upload multi artist compilations, with automated revenue splits to the artists.That's the only reason I joined and paid a decent amount for a "label" plan.So I uploaded the album. It got rejected as there was "too much writing" on the artwork. This is the same artwork that was used on the physical releases which sold in the thousands.So I changed the artwork to just the logo.It was rejected as the album name was deemed too "generic". I pointed out there are numerous albums that have generic names (1,2,3 etc - Live etc) They said no.Then one day they changed the album name for me to something similar, but not the same. Then I got a mail saying I needed to change the artwork to match this album name that they chose! I had a contract with my artists for an album that wasn't called what they called it, if it HAD been uploaded, I would have been in breech of contract.After toing and froing with their support (not in the UK, as they only respond around midnight) they assured me that this was not their guidelines, but ones laid down by their streaming partners. The release missed the date twice (it seems that they need 7 days to upload it)So I uploaded the album to Spotify, Tidal and Deezer via Distrokid, with the name I wanted and the original artwork which Ditto rejected. It took 24 hours to appear, with no problems.I pointed this out to Ditto, that if their "guidelines" are based on their partners requests, why has there been no problems with the Distrokid upload?They ignored my ticket and then closed it.I then got another mail saying that my album name needed changing as it was "too generic".I contacted them through Facebook. They said they wanted to sort this out. They "sorted" it out by closing my account and give me a refund.Their "support" staff seem to be scripted from a set of rules the company bought off Fiverr. Facts and sense mean nothing to them and any repsonses take at least 24 hours and are usually the same boilerplate.They're riding the "kudos" that Ed Sheeran & Sam Smith uploaded their first songs with them (years ago). That's all they have left. This company is the pits. Use anyone else.

review_title: I made the right choice choosing Ditto
review_content: My band and I are new to the professional music industry. We recorded our first track and we had little to no idea on how to put our songs out there. We did our research and cam across different reviews and opinion of people with their experience on different distribution services. At first, wew didn't really consider ditto. Not even second choice. We signed up for our first distribution choice but unfortunately (or furtunately because if this didn't happen we would be here on ditto), we encountered some problems with our release because they have some certain criteria that needs to be strictly followed (regarding the bit rate of the recorded song). We really can't do anything about it unless we record the track again. This was the time we considered other distribution services and luckily we came across Ditto. This was really one the right choices I made. I read how ditto works, its reviews and other information about them and I immediately signed up and paid for a subscription. I came across some reviews online that Ditto's customer service was very poor. But, I can certainly say they were wrong. We had so many concerns and questions about our release since this was the very first time we used as distrubution service and the customer service was really amazing. Once you send an email to their customer support email, they immediately give you a ticket and say that they are trying their best to accommodate all concerns of the users and I never had a concern that was not reseolved. Plus, the best part is that all my concerns were attended in less than 24 hours despite them having so much concerns from other users to attend to. So I can really recommend Ditto to other artists especially those artists who are new to the industry and need guidance with their release.

review_title: Before you sign to Ditto music please see a music lawyer
review_content: Please Read the small prints  before you sign any contract with Ditto Music. If I could give them 0.01 of a star I would but I’m feeling generous. It appears Ditto have total rights over your music. They can just sell your music with out your knowledge or consent to other platforms such as Amazon. It appears they also have the power to change the terms and condition of the contract when ever they want, so basically, they can switch the goal post. Technically, they own all the rights of your recordings, thus exploiting your songs to kingdom-com. Manipulation with a capital M. The music imdustry needs a total re-vamp, and an over-haul so we can filter out these professional rogues. I look forward to finding a reputable and honourable Music Distributor one day, that doesn’t en-slaved or exploit the artist out of there hard work and beloved music.I’m not surprised a lot artists end up with mental break downs and substance abuse. Further more there is no evidence that Ditto will produce transparent monthly statements of your earnings, therefore, I can’t imagine you ever getting paid fairly or decently.Please see a reputable industry standard music lawyer to read the small print and while at it get another lawyer to check that lawyer out! Before you enter into any contract with “Ditto” music  or any other similar charlatan... don’t be a fool!Don’t be a slave!.... not all that glitters is gold!You’ve been told.

actually we are new in digital music, before we selling a cassette music and then to VCD/DVD, but time to time technology growth faster, so we trying to catch up. we find Ditto in website, before we searching what is the best for us, like Believe, Distrokid, Merlin Nertwork etc, but we find Ditto, we believe this is our best choice for our company. and for Ditto support, it's quiet good but need more improve because its lack of fast respond, but for us it's okay as long can solve the issue. They provide useful content and information to help you learn about the business of music as well as a platform to enable you to put your creative contact out there and really drive the direction of where you want your music to be delivered.Being an independent artist with the resources to get your music on world renowned social platforms and have analytics showing you trends is so useful to us and Ditto are on hand with promotional packages to help too.  They help to give me a greater sense of  autonomy when it comes to managing aspects of my own artist development.

A great team, always responsive and very supportive.Special thanks to Daisy on RLIAB, such a great service and means I can run the Mayfield Records' label with ease. Now starting to use the PR service and keen to see how that develops too. Keep up the good work. Cheers Dom (MRL)

review_title: Don't use them there's many other…
review_content: Don't use them there's many other distribution platformsMy release got delayed after submitting artworks 3 times. I messaged the customer service for an urgent request to get more details about what was going on. I got response after 3 days which really delayed my project and plans to release my songs. The artwork ended up working fine with the other platforms, the redundant bits pointed on Ditto was just an overwhelming notification for useless concerns - they didn't understand that it's called ARTWORK and all added text was part for the Art supposed to be on the cover. Seriously guys, find another distribution company, DITTO is way way too useless

4th year releasing through Ditto. The release process just keeps getting better and better. The bugs with the upload tool now seem to be fixed as far as I can see. Really like the new feature that allows you to choose which 30s bit of track gets previewed rather than just a random selection. Keep up the good work.

review_title: I love this music distribution service
review_content: I love this music distribution service.  Easy to use, intuitive, generally good response time.  I would highly recommend to any aspiring artist looking for a quick, convenient way to put their music out in an efficient manner with no drama.

review_title: I came across Ditto through Instagram
review_content: I came across Ditto through Instagram. Did some research and thought it seemed pretty good. Paid for a year's subscription and submitted a song for release over month before the release date. It had been over 3 weeks by this point and I noticed that it hadn't came on to 'Upcoming' on Spotify in order for me to submit to playlist recommendation. I thought I need to contact them and find out. After emailing, I get an email back 3 days later saying basically that they put it onto the wrong account of the same name. Note that this wrong account was a default one made for me years ago which had absolutely no activity whatsoever e.g no music, bio, images, NOTHING. Whereas my actual account had over 20 songs, bio, images, monthly listeners. A clearly active account. They gave me the excuse that it was the computer system that did this. I have distributed with many many distributors and have never once had this problem, ever! Then after I tell them to change it, I get a email 3 days later saying that I've not replied to them for 72hours. By this point I had already sent 3 emails replying to their email. So I send another email replying to that requesting my song which is not even going to be released onto my account be removed from stores and I get a refund so I can work with a distributor that does its job properly. I then received an email replying to my request with 'if I can respond the correct link to have it changed'. Note that my song is to come out in less than a week at this point. I emailed them the same email about my requests. Today (3 days after) I received another email saying again that I've not responded to their email in 72 hours (even though they replied to my email)? I resent my request as at this point they've wasted my money and time. My song was meant to come out tomorrow!! Pathetic service.

Ditto has always been the easiest aggregator to work with, from the release options, to even updating releases to add them to new online stores and streaming services. Super affordable and amazing service in the past 4 years I've been with them

In the first releases we had some problems but they were all resolved. Overall the support has been very good. Just two points to highlight:1- Delay in responses2- I would like to have a more agile way to request Content ID's from Youtube because we usually launch the songs with videos and it takes a long time to enter Content ID making us lose royalties from Youtube that are important to us.I thank!Ale / Alexis

review_title: RUN AWAY! Dreadful in every way.
review_content: Hands down, the single worst experience I have ever had with any company ever. Would get zero stars if I was able to select zero.23 Feb An urgent notice on my account saying I needed to amend my artwork with no further information provided. 23 FebI raise a ticket to ask what I need to amend, then wait a week1 MarUpdate the ticket to enquire if there is any update4 MarResponse from Ditto - problem solved with 23 days of waiting for a response from Ditto15 March (Release day. Yay.)Release added to 6 platforms of the twenty or so selected, so I wait until the afternoon of release day (keen to promote my new EP). Still nothing. My heart sinks as I know I am facing weeks of waiting for them to check their support queue.Message sent to Ditto on Facebook enquiring why my release was prtially released - response received: "it appears here that your Beatport label status is still on pending approval"Ticket raised about Beatport label status. Response received:"Please allow them 24 to 72 hours to sort this out"18 MarTicket updated:"It appears here that you haven't got any records of your payment for your Beatport label set up. Please provide a screenshot of your payment so we can provide you an invoice for this purchase and will proceed with the Beatport label set-up so your release will show-up on Beatport as well. I'll be waiting for your response so we sort this out as soon as possible."I respond within 30 minutes querying where I would see the payment as my order was placed entirely through the Ditto system and I didn't see anything asking for payment.Six hours later, still nothing, follow up Facebook message sent enquiring if the adviser who is "waiting for my response so they sort this out as soon as possible." has been eaten by wild animals or fallen into a volcano.Dreadful dreadful dreadful service. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

I wanted to have second distributor just in case. So i registered with Ditto in November. They are using Payoneer as a source for withdrawl.It took 1,5 motnth until I was verified there and until when they send me a card. So that is insane. Another thing is , that Ditto send my royalties from Spotify after 3,5 month what you can get with Distrokid in 2.  After I recieved money I got 67% less than for a play on Distrokid. They said something about taxes and another stupid things. I am getting money so its my DUTY TO PAY TAXES IN MY COUNTRY !! They send me this : With regards to payments, I can advise that stores will take around 10-30% commission, 8% is automatically taken by the PRS, then there is around 3-5% variance in bank charges when the stores send the money over.  This is DITTOS advertising you can keep 100% of your royalties. It is 17.03. and my account still wasnt verified so I cant even withdraw those money from November nor December . They are distributors, if my music is okey with the stores why they have to again verify me ? IT´S BULLSH*T. BIG DISSAPOINTMENT. MUSICIANS & ARTISTS KEEP AWY FROM DISTROKID !!! THEY JUST STEAL YOUR MONEY !!

Initially helpful insofar as they told me I had to adjust the artwork for my album. This I did after two attempts, but still no release. I questioned this at least three times, but was fobbed off with unacceptable excuses. Finally, weeks later, I asked for a refund. Again, long delay, but eventually I received the initial £19.00. However, when I asked why the £40.00 paid for a quick release had not been refunded, I was told it was because I had not fixed the artwork issue. This is simply untrue. Disgraceful service and communications, and downright dishonesty. I went to Distrokid, and they have been fantastic.Update:After much persistence, I have at last received a full refund.
hello dear ditto 1. you have not paypal 2. we found mistaks in feat and perimary for release any track and you chose another artist just this but its very bad and very big mistakes i hope for you
Great experience with Morgan from Support Team. Moved my Beatport label from another distributor to Ditto super fast.

Terrible customer service. Their system for reviewing if your album is ready to be published is so frustrating. They don't tell you how to specifically fix the issues and if you contact them for support it can last more than 4 days to get a response.

review_title: I have worked with Benalynn and Morgan…
review_content: I have worked with Benalynn and Morgan and they've helped me with an expedited response time. They both have gottne my issues resolved and were easy to work with.
A truly incredible team to work with and always a great pleasure to work alongside these guys.

This company should be banned, there website doesn't,  work properly, there customer support take 3 - 7 days to even respond, I so regret joining theses guys..Also they ask for your address and personal details so you can get paid quicker, the App and code system doesn't work, but in reality they already have all of your personal data anyway! looks like data harvesting to me?

Ditto gives independent artists and labels the opportunity to strive in the current environment.  I like the process, but wish it could be more streamlined.  I wish service requests were able to be responded to a lot faster, and the sensitivity of release dates was taken into consideration more.

i have been using ditto for about a year now which i signed up for with a free promotion at the time so it basically did not cost me a penny for the first year so i could check this site out i am an independent artist producing mainly house and garage music and must say i absolutely love this site in terms of getting my tracks out there and the added bonus of finally getting paid for the music you produce which this site so easily distributesmy advice to anyone sitting at home listening and listening to your own produced music wondering if its any good or not stop that and just put it out there starting here
easy subscription and a good website to navigate in

review_title: Nice and Easy Does it...Every Time
review_content: Very simple website, nice and easy to use. Have used ditto for a good few years now and see no reason to leave them

review_title: Releases always delivered on time and…
review_content: Releases always delivered on time and have always been super helpful in dealing with any questions!

review_title: Affordable + Easy to use, only minor hiccup, quickly rectified.
review_content: The website is really easy to use and we got a great deal on the price for a year through a discount code of 75%! Following the upload to process our next single was great and the only real hiccup was that it seemed to get stuck at the "incomplete" stage.After a few tries it did go through but can't leave a 5* review i'm afraid because of the mild panic of thinking i'd done it wrong!

review_title: Don’t go with this distribution service…
review_content: Don’t go with this distribution service They hold money back If they get back to you it’s never responding to what you’ve asked them Iv lost a lot of money trusting these criminals

Hello, I'm really enjoying the experience of the website, but I would like you to have a service in Portuguese. when i need something i need to send e-mail to Ditto service in another country. Service ticket.

Their 5 Star reviews are suspect to be fake reviews. Be WARNED. All their 5 star reviews get uploaded in batches, and all have very similar stories, as if someone is just rewording the same thing to get the score back up. Countless people have been scammed by this company, locking you out of your account and keeping your money. AVOID this company at all costs.

review_title: Ditto have been amazing for me
review_content: Ditto have been amazing for me, I run a label plus play in a few bands and use this platform for all my releases, they are also really responsive when I need help.

review_title: Been with Ditto for 3+ years now and…
review_content: Been with Ditto for 3+ years now and it's been smooth sailing with no issues whatsoever. Very quick to respond to queries and great customer service as well.

review_title: I believe the volume was below 18 LUFs
review_content: I believe the volume was below 18 LUFs! Thanks for the review!

review_title: Held Back Pending Licensing Verification (NEED HELP)
review_content: Hello ditto music! I've been in Ditto since Aug 2020. After uploading songs on spotify, I have my royalties set. Yet when I try to withdraw funds, it says "Held Back Pending Licensing Verification" . Please help me get my royalties

Upload one track few years ago, didn't wait for much from it. but its feeding me for two years already. Ditto makes it happen to every possible store for small amount of 20 EUR year fee. Nicest distributor ever. Surely recomended

I am very happy with the service I've received from Ditto. As a frequent user of the Promo package, I can say that the campaigns have been very effective and have gone above and beyond what I have anticipated they would do. I would definitely recommend Ditto and have nothing bad to say about them at all!

review_title: Loyal long time with Ditto! Here's why...
review_content: I have been distributing my music with Ditto for a long time now, over 9 years! I have remained loyal to Ditto because of how easy, cost effective and fast it is to release music in this way. Another big factor is the excellent customer service. Highly recommended for independent artists!
Keep up the good work... Thanks

Amazing experience with them! You get exactly what they say will do. Best thing is rapid responses for all queries! Recommend for all upcoming artists and labels! Easy to work with just a shame they don’t offer longer and more promo packages

review_title: Put lyrics on our songs! Yey!
review_content: Everything so far is good but hopefully in the future we can add lyrics to the songs so that when my/others' listeners can sing along or for them to know the lyrics when they play our songs to spotify, apple music etc. That's all, so far everything else is great. Hopefully my songs can get more attention and listeners. Thank you and God bless!

review_title: Hi my releases went as planned and on…
review_content: Hi my releases went as planned and on time but my money has been held back pending licensing verification would someone be able to contact me regarding this matter please?

review_title: I have been with Ditto Music since…
review_content: I have been with Ditto Music since 2016. I love using them as a distributor.

review_title: Rudest customer service ever in life
review_content: Rudest customer service ever in life. Ever. Worse than the DMV or an emergency room on a Sunday night before a Monday holiday. Worse than postal workers on overtime. They talk mad sh** they would never back up in person.

review_title: A service I wouldn't reccommend to my biggest enemy
review_content: 1) Always pushed back my releases for absurd reasons2) Terminated my account for "fake streams", didn't pay me for my gained streams and never gave any proof about the so called fake streams3) Kept my releases up after termination, so they profited even further4) Charged me for the subscription over 10 MONTHS after suspensionTerrible, terrible, terrible. Never use this service. Considering taking legal action for compensation of my time, for using my music unlawfully (they promised to remove my releases when your account is suspended, they kept songs up on iTunes) and for charging me for a service I can't use.

Ditto was first company I ever used to distribute music, I always had issues with royalties being witheld during my tenure therefore went elsewhere however kept my old material via their service. I have had account closed after being accused of fake streams. I have provided evidence to prove this isn't the case yet account remains closed. You are policing how other users stream music with actions out of the artists control and I am seeing more cases when you guys have done the same to other people and keep getting away with it. I will be taking the matter further as you do not want to resolve or give understanding and accuse someone who has worked hard to promote his music.UPDATE 4TH MARCH 2020Ditto have written back stating they have seen other activity on other platforms which is based off their assumptions the actual stores haven't contacted ditto to state there is abnormal streams they have emailed me saying it appears to be abnormal streaming and now refuse to give me my ISRC codes. I contacted Spotify and they have no record of abnormal activity so ditto are lying to save face.I will be taking matter further as discussed.

review_title: Never use this company for music…
review_content: Never use this company for music distribution. Overpriced and will continue to bill you after canceling your account. They also have never replied over my inquiry on why I am still being billed. I had to manually cancel the payment in paypal. I can't even access the money they owe me. Even after they took $20 out of my account. That $20 was literally stolen, they didn't even give me a year subscription with it. Hands down one of the worst online companies I've ever used/worked with.Use repost by SoundCloud or distrokid instead for distribution. They won't treat you like trash.

If there is an issue, you reach out and they always get to the bottom of it. I've never had an issue with payout. I've been using Ditto since 2016 and I've no reason to switch. I do wish they distributed video to more than just Vevo though.. maybe that's something they put into the pipeline to accomplish
Ditto have been absolutely wonderful since the day I joined! Super friendly team! Always available to help with any issues and help take away any stresses I have around my releases. Thank you Ditto!

Poor service and lack of skill and care. Here are the many reasons:Rejecting music for reasons that are not valid such as '5 seconds of silence' when this is there for creative purposes. I have uploaded music to stores before with 5 or more seconds of silence with no issue whatsoever. Ditto reject the music for repair before they even bother submitting to the stores.Rejecting music based on the song title when the song title is clearly valid. Glitchy and buggy uploading system that sometimes takes several attempts to upload the music and complete the process.No option to delete uploads that are rejected for repair so I have to wait on the awfully slow customer service to respond to get them to remove my music from their servers.Terrible customer service. The worst I've ever experienced.They either have some automated process for rejecting uploads that needs to be addressed or the person(s) doing the checks manually need to trained on what is valid and what is not. I moved from DistroKid to Ditto as they had some options that were not available on DistroKid. Well, what a terrible mistake that was, I will be moving back to DistroKid immediately.

I specially ask for my song to be released on the 21st of this month (feb ) 20221..  my song release date changed to the 28..because of some cover art issues..  Without my permission.. I’m an artist.. I submitted my music to ditto, then broadcasted across my social media that I will be releasing the song on the 21, I even payed for pre-release to ensure my song will be available on the selected date... this is my first time using ditto... and I can definitely let you know that this will be the last.. as I already did a write up for the song.. promoting the 21st.. wrote multiple tickets no response..

Sometimes I love it.... sometimes I hate it... It is very hard to upload songs or videos. There are alwasy some kind of bugs. Also, to pay it send you through a stupid Brazilian system which doesn't work.

review_title: They literally held back our royalties…
review_content: They literally held back our royalties for over 20 days and soon as we log a ticket for our the enquiry they locked our account on the ground of illegal streaming activity, we send them our Spotify stats which clearly stats we receive around 1000 streams per day as a proof and they pretend to investigate on the subject took them over 10 days to do so and finally locked our account. Our songs are still live on stores and they are collecting royalties. We contacted spotify team and they said there is no such activity otherwise they would have taken down our release. When we contacted ditto they said they think that there is illegal activity. First of all if the store’s themselves had clarify that there is no such issue then on what ground they stand to make this brazer claim.
Customer service is terrible!Still waiting for my refund. I think my money is now gone.Stay away
Great easy service, would recommend to anyone!

review_title: Customer Service will be their downfall
review_content: I been with Ditto since I started my label back in 2017, Their customer service will be the downfall of Ditto, everything else was ok but Customer service will ruin this business.
One of the best music distributors I've worked withThank you for seamless uploading

Tried signing up for Dittomusic yesterday, but couldn't see how to create an album out of the tracks I uploaded.  I've created a ticket for help, but had no response or acknowledgement of my request. Should I move on to another site?
Ditto has helped me start my Independent Artist and singer-songwriter dreams. With their excellent service and generous efforts for my music to have a long reach.

Stay Away on this site they suspend your account without warning about fraud streaming activity,see the picture herewww ibb  co/31LVcBFthey lost all your earnings and artist all different storego to, amuse or landr  instead, they warning your account first if they caught fraud streaming activity

review_title: Ditto Music is definitely a company…
review_content: Ditto Music is definitely a company made only for SCAM and stealing artists' money (royalties)."Held Back Pending Licensing Verification" is their way you do this, as most of you here probably already know. Once you open a support ticket they block your account because of "suspicious streaming" and you lose any contact with them. Together with this, all your earnings are GONE FOREVER. This has happened to dozen of artists that I know. If the streams are "suspicious" then why the albums are not removed from the stores? Why the royalties keep coming but you cannot withdraw them? If there was a real issue, the stores would be the first that will take down the albums and stop paying the royalties!Two of my colleagues still have their royalties "Held Back..." but are scared to open a ticket because then for sure they will lose all their hard-working earnings.If there is a group organizing to go after what we are owed, we are willing to participate. All of us have more than 25k stolen from Ditto Music!!!
Really good and supportive service, I don't think ive had any issue that they couldn't deal with, very supportive swell, i've released numerous music and will continue to.

review_title: I have been using Ditto Music for many…
review_content: I have been using Ditto Music for many years now, the release process is simple, reliable and I feel in control at all parts of the process.The support team have been there for the small amount of times I've needed help.I highly recommend the service!Dusty Wagon

I signed up to Ditto in 2020 and I have never Regretted it. Their Platform is easy to navigate and Customer service is on point. The Best Distribution Platform in terms of getting your royalties directly to you irrespective of your location. Cheers

I love using Ditto because it is easy to set up, quick to understand and it is very easy to read my analytics. the only issue i'm having is with the payment i'm not sure whether or not i have to set up an account with Payoneer that wasn't made clear to me. I set up an account with them today just incase but other than that everything is good.
Wasn't too happy with the service I received initially but Morgan was very helpful and restored my confidence today. I appreciate it!

review_title: Very difficult to get your earnings
review_content: Very difficult to get your earnings. Got there eventually but they don't make it easy at all
Very good service, very reliable and easy to use.

Always an easy and smooth sailing experience, the process is very straightforward and easy to follow. Any issues with my release have been pointed out in advance allowing me the time to fix them.The Ditto team themselves are very helpful; my queries have been answered quickly and efficiently. I have enjoyed working with Ditto and look forward to building a reliable rapport.

review_title: Easy simple and very useful platform
review_content: Easy simple and very useful platform, great for independent artists.

review_title: Publishing thru Ditto for indie artists
review_content: I've self published thru Ditto for a number of years. I find the CS a bit slow and doesn't show any specialist understanding. My account seemed to have slipped from its auto-renewal and I had no notification which could have negatively affected my streaming products. The product is affordable tho, and I found the forms easy to navigate.
I love how ditto interface is friendly. I would recomend it for any independent artist and label 100%
Hello, everything is ok for me

I've been with Ditto for 4 years and it's been a little rocky.  They have always got my music out on time and in full which is great - the fundamentals, but customer service over the years have been really lacking.  I do eventually get answers to my problems, but I've learnt to allow three weeks...  Definitely something they have to improve.  That said, I have seen slow progress during that time, which has led to me avoiding changing my distributor.  All in all, they do the fundamentals well, but room for improvement.
Very easy to use, trust worthy worth every single penny.I hope to go viral with theses releases soon.

review_title: A super slick music distribution and video hub!
review_content: Loving Ditto's slick and streamline Interface coupled with a whole load of cool and valuable ways to get your music out to the world in a matter of days, and now the vevo partnership, just signed up for my channel, very excited to get my videos up there, good work Ditto! ROXY PRINCE from ROXY5000 THE BAND.

review_title: Con Artists & Bot Users. They try to steal money after 4 years...
review_content: They won't leave you alone! I had the worst experience of my life with them (I bought a promotion package with them) where they took control of my account and spammed fire emojis on billions of accounts, and "follow/unfollowed" on social media. I parted with a lot of my hard-earned money for this service which was PURE FALSE ADVERTISING.I honestly wanted a full refund BUT I was demoralised by their lack of customer service. I left it...I decided that I was an idiot for trusting anyone (why would a person willingly trust a business, eh?), so I blamed myself and moved on. BUT 4 years on they have STILL BEEN TAKING MONEY FROM ME, directly withdrawn from my account for no reason. I ONLY FOUND OUT BECAUSE THEY TRIED TO STEAL THE LAST £58 THAT I PHYSICALLY OWN IN THIS WORLD!!!! ARE THEY SERIOUS!?!?!?!?!?NOW I WANT A FULL REFUND FOR THAT ORIGINAL SERVICE THAT YOU CONNED ME INTO. YOUR BOT-RIDDEN, FIRE-EMOJI-SPAM TRASH.You are not a promotion company, you are immoral, sick & twisted. Try developing some empathy with your species before carrying on trading.

I had a large back-catalogue that I wanted to release on Spotify and a few others, and within a few days of uploading with Ditto it had all been checked, verified, and sent to dozens of stores throughout the world! The process is intuitive and informative, and the support from the team has been prompt and excellent, even throughout the pandemic.I was hesitant at first because there are some sketchy reviews out there, but Ditto works, the staff are helpful, and i've been paid my royalties - what more can you ask for? Excellent distribution service!

same story as always: you WILL NOT get any of your money. My entire balance is "held back pending licensing verification". It took weeks for them to replie after I raised a support ticket in their broken support system.Then they told my I am allowed to withdraw, after telling them multiple times that I CANT withdraw, they are now "reviewing my sales over the month before anything is cleared". Basically they will try everything to keep your royalties.

review_title: Awesome and Straight Forward Distribution Service
review_content: Very straight forward, easy to access and processes everything clearly and easily allowing you to adapt how each release is handled each time.Loved working with Ditto so far!

review_title: Those 5 star reviews are so fake it…
review_content: Those 5 star reviews are so fake it hurts. Ditto music should be prosecuted. They keep your royalties, make up excuses not to pay you anything. If you contact them you can expect a reply in a few months, usually the reply is useless.

review_title: Bad service, bad press, dodgy AF.
review_content: Honestly had a terrible experience with Ditto. From people not getting back to you for days or weeks on end to music being pulled down by mistake. Then there is the money side...  try getting your payments off them...do a little research there really are way better alternatives. It’s a small company but they have no training in customer service or how to run an actual company. The arrogance of them not fixing their processes and learning from their competitors is astounding. I can see they have written a response below asking me to submit a ticket. I long left the service after submitting many many tickets and having to follow up again and again on pressing issues. The response below is just PR stuff don’t let it fool you.

review_title: Ditto Music is a complete SCAM!
review_content: We own a digital music distributor just like Ditto. We decided to upload some of our artists music in Aug 2020 to see if the stories about this company were true and can now confirm that they are. Once royalties were due they gave us the "pending license verification" excuse and ignored our withdraw request. They are an absolute scam. If you are in a similar situation, call the police and report it. 2. File a statutory demand with the Government of UK's new web portal. 3. Ditto music scam dot com . Once we have more than 100k in damages together we will proceed to bankrupt their company by court order and seize assets.

Terrible customer service (probably the worst ive ever experienced) takes them weeks and weeks to answer your support tickets and then after months and months they seems useless and unable to help with anything.Also there is a growing number of artists (including me) who are finding it hard/impossible to get there royalties. There is something odd going on with some people saying it is a scam and there illegally holding onto people money. They owe me royalties and ive been trying to get them for months their either useless and inept or something very dodgy borderline criminal is going on.either way I definately would never recommend this service to anyone, truly is awful.

review_title: I could not be happier with this…
review_content: I could not be happier with this service. So far it's allowed me set up a label and release 2 tracks. Both have been in the hype charts in beatport, one of them in the top 10. The customer service is amazing, super fast response. I also read a whole bunch of bad reviews before I signed up. I figure the people leaving them must be part of the problem. Go get your music out the world.

In my opinion, Ditto is the premier site for self releasing music. Not only is it EXTREMELY easy to upload your music to all the stores, the analytics & royalty information on the backend is priceless & super non complicated to understand. I couldn't recommend Ditto enough.

review_title: Ditto is great... Until you want paid !
review_content: Ditto has been great to work with up until now that I want my payout. I’ve never had any issues before this. They’ve always been quick to address any issues before. The only option they give users for Payouts is Payoneer. If you look at any of the Payoneer social media pages the comments are full of people demanding their money to be released. Payoneer is not releasing peoples money. Personally I’ve been trying to login to my Payoneer account for months and can’t get in. I can’t get a human on the phone when I call their customer service. They’ve finally  responded to an email after emailing them numerous times only tell me my account had been shut down but won’t respond to tell me why or how I can fix the issue so that I can use their service. I’ve contacted Ditto multiple times over the last month or so only to be told “We understand your concern. Unfortunately Payoneer is our only payout option. We will pass this on to our internal team but there are no guarantees that anything will change”. Musicians have been hit hard enough during this pandemic without having to trust our payouts with a company like Payoneer. Ditto doesn’t seem to really be in a rush to make other accommodations for their artist. We are likely going to start shopping around for another distributor for our Record Label. If your thinking about using Ditto I’d first check to make sure that Payoneer isn’t who they are using for Payouts. Like I said above Ditto has been great up until this point. Ditto was great to work with and was always whack to help. Unfortunately they are not doing that now that it comes to financials.If Ditto fixes this issue without telling us we have to use Payoneer I will be updating and or editing my review.

review_title: Service unacceptable for a company that…
review_content: Service unacceptable for a company that charges £70 a year. The service of Ditto Music has declined over the years. As the company has grown its care for individuals or for people not willing to spend thousands with them is poor. In the years I have been with Ditto, I have been able to reach my royalties once... After numerous emails requests, signing up to all sorts of "payment companies" to receive my royalties, I was stopped once again due to licensing issues. Despite sending copyrights for cover songs several times, Ditto persist to stop me in my tracks and keep me from what is rightly my money.

review_title: Signed up mid 2020 , they never pay you , just ignored
review_content: Signed up mid 2020.
