Ditto is crooked and the customer service was terrible when I was with them for 3 years.

review_title: Ditto Music is a Criminal Enterprise
review_content: To everyone considering using DITTOmusic.com, save your time and money.Ditto Music is a Criminal Enterprise.I uploaded music to ditto (it took me several attempts).  The song formats were wrong, I paid extra to convert the files to their specified needs.  The album artwork was rejected because it contained "imagery", I had to settle for the artist name and that was it.FINALLY, I got my album approved and distributed.  I was proud to have finally uploaded an album, needless to say, I shared it with my friends and family.  They listened to the album and added it to their playlist.I saw there were two installments of "royalties" over time(nothing life changing).  I had to sign up to Payoneer, provide private information such as SS#, bank account info, upload a driver's license and do a biometric scan of my face.  I decided to withdraw my royalties AND then I could not log into my dittomusic account.  This was extremely frustrating.  My first thought was I had been hacked.  I sent an email and a few days later, they informed me that my account was under review for illegal streaming.   They asked me to provide them with receipts, websites, and playlists that were used.  I had nothing, since I never used a third party to promote my music, it was literally a handful of text messages to friends and family members.  During this time, I still could not access my account or the royalties/profits.I disputed and they told me my account has been terminated because their legal team suspects fraudulent activity.Needless to say, I am disappointed.  My music is still uploaded and I can not access my account.  I sent a follow up email requesting my royalties and the deletion of my album and I have yet to receive a response.Ditto Music is a Criminal Enterprise.Do not use their service.
The process of loading music into your website is a little bit complicated... If it could be easier and less complicated that would be nice.

review_title: Don't waste your money on Ditto Promo. (My contact details are in the review)
review_content: You are throwing your money away using Ditto services. I bought a Ditto Promo package (thankfully when it was on sale) for my most recent release for £250 (instead of £500). Here is what their 'marketing expertise' was able to give me:- 2 'online features' (basically in two low quality online spam-mags that anyone could contact and get content posted on - the better of which I had actually contacted myself too, so it's dubious whether Ditto or I sealed the deal) - their 'industry contact database' -  (which I'm happy to provide to anyone) is just a list of blog website addresses - no contact details at all- some basic info about social media posting schedules- some sub-par images which I didn't use- an instagram advert which had zero impact on my campaignSo then people will think that it's prob crap music I asked them to promote. Well... away from Ditto under my own steam, I was able to get:- Multiple blog features (around 18 at the moment in good blogs)- A very high quality blog premiere for my video- National press coverage- A record deal- International radio playSo... if you're thinking of hiring Ditto because you don't think you can do this yourself. Honestly, 15 mins on the internet yourself will give you better results and better info than what they will provide for £250/£500. Even better still, ask around if anyone you know knows a PR person who is just starting or up and coming. Your £250 will buy you a dedicated PR person who will care about your music and who will do their best for you, rather than just do some crappy mail-shot to a poor quality list. Staff were polite, but that means nothing if the outcome is so appalingly poor. Going on the reviews here already, this is just standard practice for Ditto.As for distribution, I use Emu Bands and have never had any problems with delays etc. And am not tied to a poor company like Ditto for the rest of my career (that's what you're doing when you sign to Ditto).So there you go. Feel free to contact me at steadywavesuk on facebook and I'll pass on the 'industry contact database' any answer any questions.EDIT: Just found out that Ditto actually paid for the 'blog' coverage for the spam-rags that they got me 'features' in. The blogs just messaged me direct to ask if I wanted to be to have my next single 'featured'. Don't throw your money down the drain with Ditto - £250 would go a long long way on Submithub.

review_title: Withdrawal denied in a closed circle
review_content: Hello, everyone. It seems I'm not the only one experiencing problems in the current situation.My problem is a withdrawal one and it is related with the "Held Back Pending Licensing Verification" writing on the WD page. I am basically not allowed to make a full withdraw of all my earnings. All of my releases are fully verified, active and original and I haven't received any warnings or information about the current distraint. Thus, I decided to file a ticket, which upon posting went... nowhere. I briefly got a message saying "We are currently experiencing a high volume of support requests. Please be patient while we resolve your issue.", then checked my active tickets - NOTHING. Did it a couple of times in the span of a week, maybe. I searched for other electronic means of contacting Dittomusic - there are none. Tried a UK based phone number - disconnected. Now I tried to post a ticket and it finally had the luck to appear in my active tickets, but it is long overdue. I literally have no idea what have I breached, no guidance on how to fix it, if there actually is something that I have done or not. Dittomusic may be using the COVID pandemic as an excuse to abandon its' users, but I want to assure them that professional companies have long found a successful recipe to work at full capacity during these rough times. I am very disappointed and expect to be contacted by one of those "busy" people that are experiencing the high volume of tickets, so they could assist me in the trouble.
So they want me too prove my streams. Spotify said Im fine. I keep asking for proof , n they wont, which means they are lying.
Not a good company. They are illegally claiming other artists contents. The law will catch up with them sooner or later. My advise is do not sign with them. Save your self the stress and headache.

review_title: Were adequate for 3 years, now they are scamming decent people
review_content: Were adequate for 3 years, then blocked account due to 'illegal streaming'. There is no such thing as illegal streaming, there are no laws or regulations which govern how music is marketed or advertised. I was asked to send details of my advertising, which was only Facebook. I requested evidence of a breach of terms of service or indeed 'illegal streaming'. They refused to provide. I regrettably suggest people avoid as they are not even meeting people half way in conducting an investigation or producing evidence.

review_title: Dittomusic is a criminal enterprise. Beware!
review_content: Dittomusic is a criminal enterprise. They will break the law and take your money. Here is my detailed story:1. Usually, earning reports are available three months after the actual month in which the songs were streamed. So I uploaded my songs to Dittomusic, waited three months and then wanted to access my money. In order to do so, they required following information from me, which had not previously been specified in the terms of use: A copy of my ID and a video of me, scanning my biometric data. First of all, this alone is highly suspicious: No other company requires biometric data, and the need to provide these will be communicated to you only once you request your money. It is likely that your data will be used for criminal schemes.2. Nevertheless, I provided the data and was actually able to withdraw money, which initially surprised me. The fact that I needed to provide biometric data scared me off nevertheless and I did some research, seeing that the reviews on trustpilot had suddenly plummeted, and finding a horrible Dittomusic review on YouTube (Check out Steve Freeman's review). So I canceled my subscription. As my music had been uploaded for three months, and I had only been payed for one, Dittomusic still owed me money for the next two months. I was entitled to these profits, as specified in the terms of use. But when the second month was over, there were no earnings shown - zero. I wrote the support. They stated I had the option to resubscribe (and pay again) and access the correct report or wait a few months until they would have a look at my earnings. I chose to resubscribe. Once I did that, I saw the correct earning report, but STILL was unable to actually access my money.3. When I wrote the support that I couldn't access my money, they said that their licensing team had to have a look at my songs before payout, to make sure I owed all corresponding rights. This argumentation is COMPLETELY INVALID, as Dittomusic had already payed me the month before for the same music. If they really would check the licensing before payout, they would have already done so. Besides this, there were no information provided how this 'check for verification' was allegedly carried out. At this point, it was likely that those simply were empty words in order to come up with a reason to scam me and take my money.4. Then, suddenly, I was unable to log into my account - without any notice whatsoever. Not only did Dittomusic break their terms of use by withholding my money without reason, they also withheld their service from me, for which I still was paying - which means that Dittomusic broke the law. When I wrote them again, they accused me of steaming fraud, without providing any evidence, and asked me to provide evidence that prooved my innocence. Legally, a shifting of the burden of proof is unjustified. Now it was obvious, that Dittomusic's operation of business is to take their customers money, then accuse them of steaming fraud and hope that the customers can not afford a lawyer. I canceled my subscription again and was never paid.5. According to this operation of business, it is obvious that Dittomusic is a criminal enterprise. They still owe me money and I demand them to pay me.6. All these 5 star ratings on Trustpilot seem to come in a cicle of a few months, once a lot of 1 star reviews have been gathered. I assume those are fake reviews by Dittomusic itself.Summary: NEVER EVER EVER USE DITTOMUSIC! THEY ARE A CRIMINAL ENTERPRISE, THEY WILL SCAM YOU AND TAKE YOUR MONEY!!!

review_title: Don't entrust your music to these people

Communication was like you would imagine a court case in some dictatorship where the accused has to prove his innocence (even though he does not exactly know what he allegedly has done), not the other way round. Someone really has to do something against this company.

review_title: I had very high hopes for Ditto and they blew it.
review_content: TL;DR - Your releases may not come out on time and you won't get any indication why for days. Customer service is bottom of the barrel, unresponsive and not helpful. Best you can hope for from them is a half apology on twitter. I had very high hopes for Ditto, and after reading lots of reviews (and admittedly ignoring the negative ones about their customer service) I gave them a shot. I give them two stars because when everything works fine, they do deliver, but when things go wrong...well, let me tell you the story of our most recent release.1) They changed how many days you have to submit music without notifying us. I had to change all of my artists' entire release schedules because we were ready to submit 11 days before (the cutoff used to be 10 days before release), but they changed it to 14 days overnight. For a small label this is quite inconvenient because we can only dedicate so many resources to a given release at a given time, and thus we schedule things quite specifically.2) We bought the chartbreaker package for this specific release. This is where things really started going downhill. Once the new release date was decided, the track was uploaded to the platform and the chartbreaker package was applied, everything looked normal. We get closer to the release date and there's no confirmation of the chart registration and no pre-release has happened. Come release day THE TRACK ISN'T ON STORES. I check the account again and it still says "Processing" as opposed to "Sent to Stores". I send in a support ticket and tweet at them to find out what's going on. Two days without a response to my multiple messages, and then I get a weak apology saying that "it appears that it encountered an error upon delivery". At no point was I ever notified that there was an issue. I have now been battling for over 2 weeks to get a refund for the chartbreaker package. After back and forth and waiting 9 days for a response, they've now come back to say they'll give me a partial refund for the pre-release. The track was released in dribs and drabs to the various services 7-12 days late.Whether I get any money back or not remains to be seen, but the fact of the matter is that my release did not come out on time and nobody at Ditto seemed to care. I could have forgiven the lack of pre-release, no confirmation of registration for charts or social graphics being made, but the fact that they couldn't even get my release out on time with a two-week buffer and no feedback really gets to me. My company looked like fools to the artists that entrusted us with their release. This doesn't even include my experience trying to get the deliverables from the Ditto Promo Package for a previous release. Suffice to say, I'm getting ready to take my money elsewhere. All of our releases will move off the platform and we won't employ their other services henceforth. This probably would never have happened to any of their artists with high streams that bring in a lot of attention. But for the smaller companies and artists growing your following, I highly recommend you take your money elsewhere to a company that'll actually care about you and your projects. I hope you don't have to learn the lesson the painful way.On a positive note, The CEO is fun to chat with on Twitter when talking about new features or things you'd like to see them do. Shame that none of these new features have come to fruition yet and that he completely disappears when the company is not doing what you're paying it to do.

Otherwise, Ditto is fantastic, and easy to use/navigate through, and the prices are very fair.

review_title: Careful of this Company they are not…
review_content: Careful of this Company they are not recommended by  Spotify, Tuncor CD baby and Distrokid are though .I have asked them on numerous occasions why in 7b months have I never received a Statement or Royalties on my account ..They blocked the account citing irregularities yet there is no valid proof . My Lawyers have suggested an audit on their records being as they are not forthcoming .There is no evidence of foul play on my account I have even reported this to the Cyber Police ..ditto decide to send out Campaigns recently to justify they are supporting the independent artist on the corrupted stream market ..Its a shame they haven't felt the need to support the Artist before but now they are pushed they have to act . Blocking an Artist for their account whilst they themselves are in breach for not paying a penny in commission in Seven months of the account being opened and then using a lousy excuse that a fraudulent stream was detected, yet provide no proof...How many more musicians will have to suffer whist the greedy Companies take advantage and feel they are above the Law.They leave a bad name in the industry. A law must be passed to stop this scam .the reviews you read that are low rated take note they not made up  but genuine people. Dittos recent marketing Campaign encouraging anyone that will comply, offers freebies in response for  leaving a glowing review ..please be careful as this is not helping the industry but feeding the pockets of these greedy manipulators that will do anything to cover up their failings. review_title: Give it a try - you won’t be disappointed.
review_content: When I first signed up for Ditto, I wasn’t sure what to expect as there wasn’t a great deal of information out there about other people’s experiences with the service. Having been signed up since late last year, I’ve been pretty happy with the service so, although there have been/ are a few minor things that I think should be improved. The service has been reliable (I think one scheduled release date has been missed, which was then expedited and sorted within a few days), and the customer service has been helpful in sorting out my profile for many of the platforms (if you have the same/ similar name to an existing artist, you can end up with your music attached to someone else’s - this was sorted out pretty quickly and easily by the customer service staff).A couple of points that could be better:1- They should change the message that you will hear back in 24-48 hours when you contact customer services - it’s nearly always longer than this. 2- Allow artists to request an early upload (for submission to Spotify playlists) from within the upload process - currently I the only way to do this is to message customer services and ask for it. 3- Automatically start a new artist profile for new artists - it l would just be easier to merge a couple of profiles if needed, rather than listing the songs and giving details for each platform. Overall, I would recommend Ditto to anyone looking at self-distributing their music - they provide a great service at a great price!Additionally, I’ve noticed lately that there is a 90 day free trial to the service too, so you can see for yourself!

The quality of the website and overall ease of use and what you get for the money is good, the money transfer is pain free and things are mostly straight forward.My only problem with Ditto is their staff, not friendly at all. I have to create a couple of tickets to get a response which from the message it seems that whoever answered was not in the mood. that's the biggest problem with Ditto. honestly, it doesn't take too much to be friendly we are not your enemies trying to take your precious time we are your customers.

Excellent excellent service. Above and beyond. When I need to change song credits or upload a tweaked audio file, (my bad or maybe my perfectionism), Ditto respond very quickly and helpfully. A pleasure to experience such good customer service.

review_title: This Company think they are above the…
review_content: This Company think they are above the Law , warning to all they are Liars .. Spotify do no even recommend them for Distribution they are not on Spotifys recommended.They Lied and told me a Company sent me false streams , The Company they accused are far from the cow boy operation they pretend to run . They have not paid my Royalties for 6 months and blocked me out of my account saying there is illegal streams .I have asked for evidence which they cannot provide .I called a Lawyer at Random and what a coincidence his colleague was already dealing with a separate case very similar .The Lawyer said these people are "Scumbags " they were rude to the Lawyer and the client and refused to co-operate , now they know that its not cost efficient for the client to pursue a claim , therefore they ignore any communication .Everyone is advised to report these suspicious and ever so regular activities on blocking our account  because they don't want to pay up.. Cyber Crime Fraud Online , Trading Standards .Investigation Online Bureau , all of these independent Associations are reviewing complaints that are taken seriously from complaints recieved . Spotify customer services are not in the Scam with these people , they are very helpful and directed me on getting my music back in the stores the same day ..This is a Company that cares about the independent artist and also want to stamp out irregularities with distributors like Ditto that steal musicians entitled Royalties. If we dont all contribute to this serious matter this will continue occurring and affect many more innocent individuals ..Lets stamp out crooks that give the business a bad name. The reviews you read are real and please dont assume that Dittos wild claims of fake streams are credible, if they are then why are artist complaining to the relevant Institutes following their ill treatment of having their account violated from the very people PAID to protect them .I will keep you updated and will try and message as many independant  ombudsman    that protect the consumer in cases like this where the Company thinks they are above the law.

review_title: Bad Experience to start, Locked me out, No communication

After canceling one fraudulent charge through paypal and canceling the recurring payment, they waited one month and recharged the subscription again.When they hadn't yet taken my account away and held my royalties hostage and refused all communication, the service they did offer was bad. None of my releases went out on time, none were ever ascribed to the correct musician's page. The releases in fact had to be drawn forcefully from them with internal tickets after the release date came and went, they didn't get to it till a week later.The level of incompetence and suspected fraudulent activity I have had from this company is astounding. No one should ever work with Ditto Inc, either they are malicious or simply incapable of good business practice.

I signed up with Ditto Music because it appeared to be the best distribution service that offered distribution to Beatport (the selling factor here)I purchsed the Artist Subscription for $19.00 (for the releases), and also the $49.00 Beatport service.Now in their defence, the Beatport label was set up in 4 days, which looked great!However my first track sat "in Review" for nearly 4 weeks. It wasn't until I submitted a ticket and tweeted out at them that the track was pushed through to stores with only 4 days until release (not enough time if you plan on submitting to Spotify playlists)Fast forward to the second and third tracks I have up for distribution with them, and again 4 weeks later one is still 'in review' and the other is 'approved' but has not been pushed to the stores. luckily this time I have my previous experience to tell me I need to push them into sorting my releases out.Have never experienced any problems with DistroKid or RouteNote.

DO NOT USE THIS SITE! I started using DITTO back in 2018 and found it quite easy to get started on. Unfortunately after adding artists to my roster things got much more murky. I had a 5 artist subscription but each time I tried to release their music I would be prompted to up my subscription or asked for more money even though I had already paid. The instruction is confusing and often I couldn't release the music I wanted to even though I'd paid to do so! I had finally had enough and cancelled my subscription back in Aug 19. However today DITTO took more money from my account without my consent!  I've had to file a report with PayPal to have it refunded. It even says on their site my subscription is cancelled so I have no clue what they're doing. I thought I would go and take my royalties quick before more problems and low and behold you have to subscribe again paying MORE money if you want to access the money that you're artists have earned!! Unbelievably bad, like I said at the start DO NOT USE THIS SITE!!

review_content: We had problems from the very start (for which I don't entirely blame them, since we started using Ditto during these challenging times) and the thing that makes me leave this bad review is the customer care experience I had.I opened several tickets to get some help about both the release we planned and the promotion pack (bought from them), but the only replies we received arrived only after several days (4 at best) and were not very helpful, mostly because they almost seemed like automatic ones.Luckily my last ticket has been dealt with great professionalism and competence by AMIE (from the promotion support team), which helped me beyond her area of expertise. She's been incredibly patient and she deserves some praise.I don't really like to leave bad reviews but without Amie's help, this would've been a 1 star.

review_title: THIS GARBAGE A** PIECE OF S**T SCAM…
review_content: This company is a low down dirty scam. I've been using them for 2 years and no matter how early I submit they ALWAYS are late. The release was NOT sent to the stores until 3 days ago. So you're company is a lie. It does not take up to 10 days it takes you up to 20 days to release a song. HALF a** at that! I'm disgusted with you jerks! This will be the last time I ever release my music through this bogus company. No matter how early I submit you repeatedly ruin my releases so give me all of my info so I can transfer everything to a real distributor and I'll be transferring all of my music cashing out my accounts and deleting all traces of this relationship before the year is up. You people are sick and disgusting liars who prey on unsigned artists. I'm sick of your lies and excuses for every release I have. Every single one is always late so with the same respect you show me I'm going to say drop my single and don't worry about ever doing business with me again oh and I will be reporting you and posting these transactions online for the public to see how sick and disgusting you people are. Unbelievable. EVERY song for two years? Go to hell.
