We had to go on Twitter and broadcast the problem that there was no response as well as email the Managing Director. 2 weeks on and they are "still trying" to sort out the problem which is a "system issue".Web SiteWhere do we start with the web site. If you have all day I could wax lyrical about all the issues suffice as to say it is the biggest pile of cow dung you will come across. Considering all their business for releases is done through it I can't believe I repeatedly get told "Yep we know about that problem" and "Yep you need to try a different web browser or device".On one occasion I logged into the web site and the debug tools tab for their developers was actually live for me to be able to look at what was going on with all the server processes and databases. Total gold mine for any hacker that would want to gain access to your personal information.Most of the time you will get at least one malformed page per visit where it will show you the source code where the page displays incorrectly and you have to hit refresh.Vevo VideosThe Vevo video uploads section is screwed and they know about it and so the only way to resolve this is to Dropbox them the video and email all the information so it manually gets uploaded. (This by the way you only find out when you submit, after having completed all the information and waited for your video to upload to their server).You can't edit anything and if you create a video and then try to delete the set up you were going through you have no chance. It just sits there holding its head in shame. It's normally called something like "Null" as the video title.Missing OutletsDon't count on getting your release pushed to all the outlets that you specify. It's pretty much pot luck as to what you get and certainly don't think this service will be useable if you want to use a mix of artists. We paid for the "Ditto DJ" subscription which would allow us to push certain artists to Beatport and a couple of other EDM specific outlets on top of the usual indie/pop etc we needed for other artists. To date we have not successful achieved this (even though they are legal remixes of our own artists) by world renowned DJ's.Also if you have the Beatport service there is a bug in the site where you have to go to step 4 of the process and then head back to step 1 after you have saved step 4, saying you don't want to use Beatport as this part will over write any settings you had for Genre on step 1. Those crazy kids at Ditto having all these fun and games with us ;)PricingHo ho ho. Now this is the fun part. There is no consistency between what anyone says on the help desk, what you request when you submit the release and what you actually get.So we pushed a single out with an A/B at 99p each. That went well as we were hoping and launched with 99p per track. We then pushed an EP. The EP consisted of 4 tracks and we had set each track at 99p. Want to know how it got released once Ditto pushed it? I'll tell you... Amazon at £14.99 iTunes at £9.99 Google £5.29So we got told by the help desk (a week and a half after submitting the problem) that Google charge more which is a crock of cak as we had previously pushed other stuff out at 99p which is the price we set. Also apparently as one of the tracks was over 10 minutes (DJ Remix of the original) the outlets treat it as an album. Are you kidding me???No where do they explain this and honestly if this was the case, why is it not advised to you when uploading? It seems like a pretty major point that should be noted. Add to this that one of the tracks on the EP is only available to download if you buy the album itself (we never asked or set this option and incidentally were advised this option was not available on Ditto when we enquired previously) so this means you can get 3 tracks for 99p each by buying them individually but if you want the 4th (the main remix) you have to spend £14.99 on Amazon to get it!Pre Release ServiceWe don't need no Pre Release Service.... well you'd better not need it as it doesn't work properly. When you push out a pre-release it doesn't work as they set random pricing (see above point) so what are the chances someone is going to pre-order a 4 track EP at £14.99???Text Message Pre Order ServiceWell this was a waste of money and we never got a refund. The whole idea of this was to be able to get people to text and purchase the song as a pre-order. Sounds like a great idea right? WRONG! You only got the information for it on the day of release so how were you meant to distribute it and get all those presales in? Nuff said on this. At least they have now withdrawn this service.Subscription RenewalSo you've used Ditto's service for a year? Time to renew the service? So as you'd expect the auto-renew doesn't work. You get downgraded to the ether and all of a sudden you don't have a record label on your portal. Ok I can handle having to go in and manually renew but hold on... what's this? The renew doesn't work... No it's not April Fools it's DITTO! So yep when you manually renew, all your label info has disappeared for any releases you have sitting there that you were preparing.Lets try and recreate the label again on the portal... do I really need to tell you what to expect? Yep you got it in one. You can add it again but it doesn't save any info. So now you have to go back to the help desk and submit another ticket... (switches computer off and gently backs away, sits in the corner of the room in the foetal position and sobs).In summary...All we wanted was a reliable service to push content. Nothing with bells and whistles and if we had a problems with that, then support to address/rectify the issues.Please don't think we are one of those awkward ones that starts issues for the hell of it. Far from it, we spent time our self trying to see if we could resolve it before getting in contact with support. They have admitted to the aforementioned bugs in their system and the MD has even been emailed screen grabs, OS version info, browser info, ISP connectivity info and debug info. I mean we have gone above and beyond to try and feedback on a technical level the problem we have experienced and be as helpful as we can. It was all a total waste.Ditto looks great and they tout their PR of it being an award winning service (years ago I might add for a bundled "Record Label in a Box" service ..hmm should have smelt a rat there).You can't polish a poo but they have just thrown buckets and buckets of glitter on it to try and make it seem appealing and disguise the fact it stinks.Trying to use Ditto's web service is like going outside in sub zero temperatures and standing in the snow for an hour in your underwear, then coming back in with hypothermia and trying to play a game of operation with a steady hand.Look at all the other Google reviews if you think we're being biased.Do yourself a favour and do a Google search for a more reputable service provider who delivers on their claims as my experiences have been long term and not a one off.

review_title: I have been trying to have my Digital …
review_content: I have been trying to have my Digital sales payments transferred from Ditto via their payment system. Despite the amount due to me being far in excess of their minimum payout threshold, still no payout. One part of their system shows I am only due a figure below their minimum payment threshold, but the sales figure they report are far higher than the minimum threshold..I have been trying to contact Ditto music UK for several weeks now to rectify the situation and on another matter. I have sent them three e-mails to which they have not replied.They have no telephone number so I there for cannot continue with this company any more.Deltiimo & Louca Music Records

review_title: Good results and good communication for …
review_content: Good results and good communication for our Ditto Music press campaign. Would recommend

Ditto really worked hard to meet and exceed my expectations! I was genuinely a bit dubious after reading some of the reviews here, and I must admit that I might have been a little harsh on them to start with (even after a solid experience with Ditto back in 2013).What did win me round big time, was the lengths they were prepared to go to in order to help a totally unknown band out. I was genuinely blown away.I have found that choosing a digital distribution company is a bit like choosing a mobile phone contract. None are perfect, but you have to try and find the best fit for your needs.On the back of that, I really would recommend giving Ditto a chance, we did and they really did come through for us!

review_title: So great site and they answer 24 hours …
review_content: So great site and they answer 24 hours and give me all what i want and my agent Mike Murphy sooooo greaaaaaat i love u ditto you made my day everyday
Does anyone know when deezer, iheart, tidal, and napster will pay earnings on ditto music. I joined April 2017. Daily reports only show googleplay, itunes, Spotify.

I was a bit skeptical at first because I have never heard of the company. I released one record and it was seamless so I released a second one shortly after that. This one however had issues. They (customer service, Anthony) worked with me via e-mail to get the issue resolved. It turns out it was corrupted files. He walked me through the repair process and made sure that everything was fine with the release. Very well done!

review_title: I've read a lot of reviews on here.
review_content: I've read a lot of reviews on here.A lot of these reviews look like they are coming from customers who didn't do something right the first time when uploading their music and expect Ditto to bend over backwards to fix their mistake.My experience so far has been overly positive. I am the kind of person who likes to give credit where credit is due. I had a small issue with my release as well as a few questions about how Ditto operates. I spoke with a support person, Phil, who was able to easily resolve my issue and ease my mind. I have worked with other companies and for those complaining about lack of customer service from Ditto must have never used their competitors. Ditto BY FAR has the best customer support over both TuneCore and CDbaby. I actually logged a support ticket with TuneCore about 3 months ago to have my music removed and have yet to hear back. My only concern with Ditto is that their website is dated and the release builder is junky and just terrible overall. The release builder is very complicated and gives a lot of warnings if it appears you are putting information in incorrectly. Their website appears to work better with Google Chrome over Safari which is a shame considering how many musicians use Apple products. I look forward to continuing working with Ditto Music for all future releases for my label.

Such a discrace. I decided to go with Ditto Music because it looked like a better platoform and it was cheaper but all I've had is problem after problem. I pulished 3 original albums and the first album took them 1-2 months for them to change the release date and while I wanted to get the the second and third album date changed to the original release dates I got a reply back from ditto which took ages for them to respond saying that they no longer update release dates and other features. I've spent over £70 to get the albums on the ditto music platform and I know for a fact I will not receive a refund. I will be going back to Tunecore. Do not use unless you get the same bad service.

review_title: They really are the best in this …
review_content: They really are the best in this industry, they have helped us a great deal in every aspect. they customer service is amazing and understanding at the same time, they have answered every question the best way and without them our journey would have been a very rough one.

review_title: I wish I had read the reviews here …
review_content: I wish I had read the reviews here before I started my dealings with ditto. They are not professional and did not pay me my royalties.  I took the time and effort to upload my music to them and they reported over $200 in royalties but would never pay it. One excuse after the other, whenever I could get a response. Most of the responses did not address the questions I had. They were just canned responses. And they do not have any way to talk with a representative, only email.
Absolutely wonderful.I would give other artists your contact details instantly. What a service.

review_title: Ditto Distribution - Tried them all - Staying with Ditto!!!!!
review_content: Just had to shout out about Ditto Support member Mike Murphy ... for close to 2 years Ive been able to e-mail him at support and had nothing but quick responses and FIXES and been treated as respectfully as I've ever been (and I've been doing this for quite awhile). He honestly cares and gets the job done. I've worked with several dig. distributors in the past as both an independent label owner and working for existing labels that used every distro out there ...... Ditto has delivered for me in every aspect and the support I've gotten from Mike Murphy at Ditto has been the best period!After close to being with Ditto for nearly 2 years at this point, and having been releasing through other distributors in the past with disturbing and unprofessional treatment, I can honestly say they are the best dig. distributor out there.Timely releases, timely payments, when I've discovered tech issues on their site and alerted them, they've corrected them promptly and thanked me for alerting themMost importantly, customer service has been excellent .... any issue I've come to them with has been dealt with and I've been treated like a human ....which should not be a major point here but after dealing with other distributors for over 5 years and having worked at labels myself, it is a big deal. Thanks to Ditto and Mike Murphy in support. The best!!!!!!
after payment, no response at all. no email reply, no response in their support system, phone voicemail box is full.avoid!

(First off. Be wary of the 5 star reviews like many people say. When my followers gave honest 1 star reviews on there facebook, members of staff at ditto give themselves 5 star reviews to counter balance the numbers which I have screenshots of) So..What can I say that had not already been said in previous reviews?? Maybe a few things.. Upon the first album release attempt with them prices were wrong on every store. When I called up about this matter I was extremely dissapointed as you can imagine. Rather than try and help me they said its more conveniant for them to just delete my album!? Now thats customer service. That came from a manager. I wanted a copy of the call because of how I was spoken to and guess what? They do not record calls! funny that. Open game to speak to people how they want. That is not the reason for my review because they agreed to try and resolve this. Upon second release attempt yet again had pricing issues. I was told it was an error with the store. The store tells me to go to Ditto music as they arrange the prices.. Wow. Back and forward! Now the price bracket which was set was way off the prices they were making it! even on second and third attempts.. Then which really got my back up they for no reason at all changed the price on the only store that had the correct pricing! They changed it with no reason.. No word of warning.. It was just changed! They made it half the price it was. Its not only ruining my charity donations but also its just going to leave me out of pocket. Everything leading up to my release was on point with the press, bbc news and even a letter from Kensington palace recieving praise from Prince Harry. My release meant a lot to many people and because of all the problems I had to stop so many people purchasing it. I am not getting responses from my email either. Up to 24 hours it says? Been over a week. Because of this I can only be honest when the press want an update on my release. Which also means my supporters can only be honest on Trust Pilot when announcements get made of my current release. From looking at my release on the site it doesn't even look like they registered my release with charting which was also a service I paid for. Do yourself a favour and AVOID. I should have took my friends advice and went with a different distribution company.Mike Logan Stubbs

review_title: Pretty much what a lot of people are …
review_content: Pretty much what a lot of people are saying here: Positives: Quick setup when it involves sending them money.Negatives:1) Poor communication, lost emails and lots of claims of "issues" 2) Deliberate stalling3) Mistreating the paying customer once the customer has paid 4) Withholding royalties from remixes of tracks from labels who have ceased to exist5) Downright sneaky6) the list is endless. To be honest, I am surprised at how they have lasted this long. The fact that the reviews are so extreme is revealing.

review_title: I discovered a few days after …
review_content: I discovered a few days after submitting my band's album for release through Ditto that I had unwittingly registered us for the international charts (which we didn't need at that point) and so, on a Saturday night, I emailed Ditto to ask if it were possible to refund this part of the submission. I had a reply within hours, and it was very satisfactory. So far, I'm impressed!

Extremely poor in communicating. We wanted a PR campaign for our release. Initially we were BOMBARDED with emails from them asking how they could help and promising to get back to us once they had checked out our music. We chased them once, we chased them twice. They BLATANTLY LIED that that they would get back to us 'later today' and then 'tomorrow'. Why oh why not just say you weren't interested rather than act like stupid idiots?  Avoid this company at ALL COSTS. Extremely unprofessional!

Everyone at the Ditto team are top notch. When brainstorming on our campaign, Maya really took the time to listen and get to know me as an artist and because of that my campaign was seamless, consistent and totally unique. Social media can be extremely overwhelming and daunting, but Maya made it fun and creative. Ditto really lifted the veil for me when it comes to having an online presence and showed me not only is it one of my greatest tools for growing my fan base but also another way to be imaginative. Their graphics team is stellar and James knocked it out of the park every time. I've more than doubled my online fan base, have learned so much about how to make social media work for me and will definitely be working with Ditto again in the future!
Ditto has GREAT costumer service and quick communication! I appreciate that very much!

review_title: Ditto Music released our album on the …
review_content: Ditto Music released our album on the wrong date with the wrong masters, so every fan who purchased our music received the old mixes.We delivered our final masters six weeks in advance, and they still messed it up. They even confirmed via support ticket that the masters have been updated, but that was not the case.Since they do not offer phone support in any way, urgent matters like these cannot be attended to or fixed as soon as possible.Use CD Baby or TuneCore instead.

review_title: Genuinely overwhelmed by the level of …
review_content: Genuinely overwhelmed by the level of support they've given me as I've set up my Record Label using their 'Record Label In A Box' package. Very prompt email replies, often with incredibly detailed responses to help me out. If I have a query that they cannot answer, they always know the right person who will - to me a sign of excellent customer service. I would wholeheartedly recommend Ditto Music to anyone seeking a professional and trustworthy service.

review_title: Ditto Music are a fantastic online …
review_content: Ditto Music are a fantastic online music distribution company who go above and beyond to support local artists and music related ventures. Keep up the great work and keep helping the Australian music community, if only more companies did this!

I trust Ditto to deliver for the bands I manage. They go above and beyond with looking after artists with their release strategies and marketing and are always available to answer questions and provide advice. Legends.

review_title: Ditto music are the only sane choice …
review_content: Ditto music are the only sane choice for music distribution if you live in Australia. Competitive pricing, local support and most importantly of all, real humans that you can interact with, who care about your music and work their hardest for you.I'm never using anyone else!!!
Ditto Music is the best! All the staff are so helpful, kind and hard working. They always have the time for you to answer any questions you may have. I recommend them to all my artist friends! :)

The help team are fantastic ,really friendly and ready for any problem you bring forward. I would have given a 4 star only because of 1 problem but I don't know if it's dittos fault or another companies so I'm more than happy to give 5. On a whole ditto has provided exactly what it says on the tin and I would highly recommend them to all artists ,bands and musicians. They won't fail you. 😊

review_title: I've been reading some of these reviews …
review_content: I've been reading some of these reviews and I have to say, I have found the  method of replying to emails only, to be extremely frustrating for someone trying to work in real time. I have asked several questions that I could not find clear answers to in the FAQ's, but have had to wait 24 hours or more, for what then turned into an inadequate answer or has led to a further question, which then isnt responded to for a further 24 hours +. This might be great for someone who is not on a time sensitive deadline or who is used to putting up releases but for someone trying to get their way around the maze of digital releases, it's not very comforting to be worrying about responses for two days at a time and who is also being asked questions by co-writers that I am unable to answer. I have tried calling, but all I got was an automated message. I tried responding to the email but got the obligatory "noreply@" and I've even tweeted and asked for someone to call me for what could probably be sorted out in 5 minutes on the phone. I just need a bit of help, but this protracted system is not helping me

LOLLLL, these guys a completely ignorant, they didn't reply to my messages on Instagram, Facebook or email. I have called called and called and have never got to speak to anyone ever. They asked me to email and never got back to me. Also Trustpilot I would look at there reviews they seem to be completely fake, if you look at the pattern they will leave 5 or 4 star reviews and it's always about the same thing which is how good they are with emails and how well they performed. WORST COMPANY EVER, AVOID AT ALL COSTS !!! go with. CDBABY OR TUNECORE

review_title: Terrible terrible terrible. AVOID Ditto music
review_content: Terrible company. Awful customer service. I've had four releases with them and I've always had problems with them. I'll never use them ever again and I strongly suggest that you DO NOT GET INVOLVED WITH THIS COMPANY!

review_title: I have listed three songs listed so far …
review_content: Since leaving the review below, this company did get in touch with me soon afterwards and have since resolved my problem. The person in touch was professional and helpful and did do what he said he was going to do. I agree to acknowledge this when it was done (which I have now done). Obviously the first comments still apply for that period in time, but from now on, I hope not to have any further problems or I will be making further edits. I still think though that there should be a contact telephone number to speak to people and I don't like this email only option. It sends out the wrong signals to customers and I have expressed this view directly. It also will not change. I have now uprated from 1 star to 3 star and will monitor any further activities as more tracks are uploaded.I have listed three songs listed so far and the prices were wrong and varied from place to place. his has been partly corrected.Meanwhile, only one song is recognised when you search for it using the singers name and track title, so this in effect is useless. Just think of all the songs that cold contain the word 'love' or' rock' etc... This is basic data to say the least and should come up on any search via ITunes and amazon etc.... Only one of the three songs is correct and I had more to list!!!As for responding to emails, well!!!    -   we are now up to a month and with no reply despite being chased. I also notice that the telephone number has since been taken down off their webpage (well that's a surprise!!!) and to search for this on google, they now have a message telling you to email them which is a joke!.They are unprofessional to say the least and I even paid a premium for the one song to be listed. Looks now like I will have to get my money back via the credit card company, unless of course they are reading this review and are likely to do something quickly.

Don't respond to emails and the service is really bad and unprofessional. They don't go by an SLA and you only know what's going on by being placed on hold for 20+ minutes until you get through to customer service.By far the worse and recommend going to CDBABY

They never answer the phone and I mean never, I have tried for the past 6 months everyday.They don't respond to emails or social media. I am so disappointed with this company. I tried contacting them on ever possible platform they offer and had no response. I even called there branches in Australia and Sweden and same thing no answer or straight to voicemail. I called a few companies who are in their building for operation in Liverpool who stated they have not seen anyone come out of their office. Starting to think it's a scam !Has anyone else had this sort of outcome from Ditto ?

Everyone at Ditto Music is always so Incredibly  helpful and not to mention friendly! It's always a pleasure dealing with them and what i love most is their website and how easy it is to navigate! Everything is simple and also affordable! For an independent artist I love working with ditto! Thanks to Anthony for always answering my millions of questions !!

review_title: A great way to get my music out as an …
review_content: A great way to get my music out as an independent artist and start off with a legitimate foundation of releases

At first, I had a hard time getting things together. And I did miss a few emails that were important to completing the process. Today, I spoke to Steve in Nashville and we went through my entire dashboard in my account. By doing this, we were able to determine what was needed to finalize everything. He never rushed me off the phone and we talk for a good 1/2 hour. We only hung up after I was satisfied that my important questions were answered. I now cant wait to work the "Record Label in a Box" process and get things rolling! Thanks for your help Steve!

Quick, cheap and easy way to put your music online.We just released our 4-Track EP last week via Ditto. Creating the release does take a bit of time but their platform is very clear and simple to use. In case of doubts they pretty much answer all questions you may have in their FAQ section.We've uploaded our songs 3 weeks prior to the release and it went fine. I got a bit worried at first because I couldn't find the release on Spotify by typing the artist name but tried searching for "artist name album name" and could see it. In the next 2 days, you could search by the artist itself so I guess Spotify takes 1-2 days to refresh its data.We had a couple of sales on release day and I'm looking forward to seeing if Ditto delivers in terms of payments.Great customer services and definitely worth it.

review_title: Ils ne vous paieront jamais / They Don't Give Royalties
review_content: Ils ne vous paieront jamais j'attends mes royalties depuis 4 mois aucune nouvelles....I ask for royalties in January we are in April after 3 messages and one cancellation (and consequently another request) nothing Also they have take my money for subscription but they don't give me the status so i can not use it !So Ditto is clearly a Stealer i will probably do a Justice Action if they don't give me my money soon If you are in the same case as i am don't hesitate to post something too !

review_title: Still waiting to receive my royalties
review_content: They are able to take your money and upload your music to stores quickly, but when it comes to requesting royalties you have earned, ditto make it very difficult for you to receive your money. They will come up with any excuse not pay you, if you request more than £100 payout. Be very wary of Ditto.

It is very good to work with you,but there is two things are not so good likeother distributors.1-You take a long time to transfer money,it takes at minimum 14 days.2-Also you take a long time to reply to our emails.We hope you more success.Best Regards.

review_title: I can join the team company via music
review_content: Your ear's help you to listing the good sound quality mix and mastering your music with good equipment for studio

This service at Ditto is so excellent. I loaded my video and with the proper steps that were made for me by your admin made it a smooth transition. My video was uploaded instantly. I will keep working with your company to enjoy this smooth, friendly and fast service. Thank you so much :)
Ditto music is really good company, I think. Lee Parsons - you're absolutely great!

Havent honestly gotten to use the distribution yet due to lack of funds but my experience so far with ditto music has been overall pretty amazing everything was self explanatory and have everything set up for when i get the money for the distribution of three cds      ~ iC53 Lystapool
Ditto really helped provide a platform through which my band could reach a wider audience. The very reasonable prices, and t's and c's, meant it was a no brainer.
Ditto music does great business an they will guild you threw everything.

review_title: Generally Good Service but Ongoing Issue Still Not Resolved
review_content: Up until this year I have been very impressed, reasonable pricing, our releases distributed to all of the main outlets as well as some smaller sites and easy upload and renewal of releases.Which brings me to why I am only giving Ditto 4 Stars...Around 3 months ago two of our releases disappeared from Spotify, this was the result of Ditto changing and updating their systems and as someone who works with computers and databases I am totally sympathetic to these kinds of teething problems.Michael from their customer service team has been polite and helpful throughout but 3 months on the releases still haven't returned to Spotify and I am paying for a service I am not receiving whilst having to defend my choice of Ditto to my band mates who want to know why it's taking so long!I would like to think I am an unfortunate anomaly and wouldn't discourage people from using Ditto, however, I can't give them 5 Stars with this issue still ongoing!
Love the site hope to work with you soon

Ditto is easy to understand. They have the credentials behind them to also be able to back up their work and the results that they are able to deliver. I have contacted them and I normally don't have any issues with dealing with my inquries, it normally takes them max a day or two to reply, which to me is quite reasonable.

I can see myself as an producer/ artist long term with ditto there is a little time lag in response with them but they always catch up and go a little further to make you feel satisfy at the end, I realize as a producer and an artist we can get frustrated easily when things don't happen away and ditto understands this, they realize every artist are different so they need to create an unique approach in solving situations, whenever they are falling behind they always apologize and get it right in a PRO fashion, this is primary in my book as being a professional of excellence

Ditto Music are a great company to work with. As a new Singer/Songwriter, I didn't know anything about getting my music to digital platforms or the many other aspects of the music industry. Ditto was a great help in guiding me through the process with their knowledge and friendly staff. They are inexpensive and are very quick at responding to all emails / questions that are thrown their way. I would highly recommend Ditto Music to all independent musicians.
They are very responsive and have help me setup a record label.
ditto is doing a great job for upcoming artist.

For six years, without any huge, breakout releases, Ditto Music has treated me as if I were a top income earner. The customer service and direct truthfulness is refreshing and in an industry that is bogged down by people who promise a lot while delivering little, Ditto is an industry disruptor.

review_title: Ditto's quality of service is unbeatable.
review_content: Regardless of their size, Ditto remains a down to earth company with the best of intentions for their artists. They spent over an hour going through the ins and outs of music publishing and answered all my questions over the phone and I left reassured of my decision. Also in regards to pricing Ditto is competitive and offer extras that go a long way. I would highly recommend Ditto for any artist releasing on the major platforms.

review_title: recommended you're company to several artist. keep up the good wrk

review_title: I don't like giving 5 star reviews... but
review_content: Ditto Music deserve it.I have followed Ditto Music right from their early days, when I saw their founder speak at a music conference. He spoke of a vision where all the stress and hassle was taken out of distributing music in the "Internet Age".My music wasn't ready for release at this time, but I signed up to the mailing list, asked a few questions, and registered as a label with them.Fast forward a few years, my music is "good enough" to be released, Ditto are my first port of call. I couldn't find my label info, so I emailed a couple of questions, and got speedy, helpful replies.Then I just had to follow the steps on the website and I've now got a steady stream of releases coming out.I have given 5 stars as Ditto Music:Do everything they sayAre very competitively priced (especially with the unlimited plans)Offer the best customer service I have experiencedTreat me like a person, not a "client" or "customer"Answer any questions, and bring up any issues with releases as quickly and helpfully as possible.Take all the hassle and stress out of releasing a record.Basically, I like Ditto Music because they treat me like a person, and do everything I want them to, so I can spend more time writing music.

As a label owner I've been thrilled with how simple it is to upload and get the music "out there" over the past couple years. The customer service is really good and the compensation I received for a mistake they made was more than enough. If you want simple and easy to use there can't be many better services.

review_title: The best digital distributor out there—no contest.

review_title: Wonderful Distribution Service & Excellent Service From Ditto Australia!
review_content: The Ditto site is user friendly, set up in a logical way and easy to navigate. Having one central point of contact for music distribution to such a wide variety of global retailers is very convenient for independent artists, it is an excellent service. One important improvement I could suggest is in the set up process, the site should warn you that as soon as you pay, your music and whatever artwork was loaded up, may be seen and heard on many digital retail sites within 24 hours – regardless of your future nominated release date. I pre loaded my songs and some mock artwork weeks in advance of the release date, while I waited for my CD’s to pressed. I then nominated a future release date and pre paid. I found that while the songs are not available to be purchased on these retail sites prior to your nominated Ditto release date, they will appear on many sites like Amazon, MediaNet and 7Digital, where the songs can be played as soon as you pay Ditto (within 24 hours). The artwork/image I loaded up (which was not the album cover), went straight out also - and it is a real effort to get the individual retailers to change the image/artwork that was pre loaded, to the actual album artwork you wish to display. That said, the service I received from the wonderful Sarah H in Ditto’s Melbourne, Australia office was truly exceptional. She was extremely knowledgeable and helpful over the phone on several occasions and very quick with her email responses. Sarah is a real asset to Ditto and thank you so much for your wonderful advice and service, it has been a real joy working with Ditto Australia. I would highly recommend your service to all musos who have a need for distribution.

review_title: Excellent Staff, amazing website design, here to help you with whatever project you have

Not only are they experts in the field of the music business but they care and want to help you acheive your aspirations! Feeling very welcomed from everyone at the Ditto team and I look forward to working with them more.
This is the best way to sell your music online ! I have gotten all deposits and no games when your money is made!

review_title: Does What I Need It To Do.
review_content: After shopping around for distributors extensively, I decided to go with Ditto, albeit with some hesitation. There was simply no one else offering access to the stores I needed to get my music to at the price point they were quoting. I had read literally hundreds of horror story reviews about these guys and admittedly came into this business relationship with some prejudices.To date, I have released four singles through Ditto and am happy to say that, a few minor hiccups aside, things have gone rather smoothly. I only had to contact customer support once and was responded to by a representative that same day. After a few back and forth emails, the issue was resolved by the following morning. To me, this is exceptional service, but I can't speak for everyone.Ultimately, I am satisfied with the service I receive from Ditto, but I do see areas where things could be improved. Ditto does what I need Ditto to do. For me, that's enough.
Unfortunately, the platform brings a lot of problems and bugs that made us obligated to demand a lot of the support service.

I would NEVER use Ditto music again. It took me over 1 YEAR to get them to remove one of my songs from spotify.  Countless emails and phone calls, voice mails never returned.  Their customer service department is literally terrible.  It's only over email and if you try and get some help over the phone, you will never get a call back.  Use another digital distribution company.  Ditto sucks.

review_title: Great, affordable service but releases could be handled better

It's even worse for fans who stay up all night waiting as well.Ditto should automatically email the itunes link a few hours before the release is set to be available. That would prevent a lot of delays. There should also be a contactable after dark team who handle things like delays with midnight releases. Other than that it's great, prices are fair, the process is simple.

I haven't used the service fully because we are recording music at the moment. The big thing I notice is more opportunities are needed for artist. While there seem to be a good amount of opps as a starting point, the majority are based in the U.K., which I understand. What I would be looking for, in no particular order:1: Management opportunities. A list of managers or management agencies who are looking for independent artists. 2: More shows and touring opportunities. It would be nice to see buy on options for artists with a little bit of money. Also, tours that are allowing buy ons. Late NIght talk shows, like Fallon, Kimmel etc, have smaller and even unsigned bands perform. How would we be able to? 3: Merch discount opportunities. Companies that are willing to work with smaller labels and artists with maybe a discounted priced or smaller order quantities. 4. Promotion opportunities. Smaller, boutique agencies that help artists get on traditional radio, traditional charts, Spotify playlists, magazine interviews, blog reviews, etc. 5: Website opportunities. Smaller web companies that want to work with independent artist for a discounted rate. Sometimes artist need more from a website than the build your on sites available.

review_title: In fairness to Ditto they have significantly improved some aspects of their service over the past few years; particularly their website. However I have had various issues with them, particularly duri
review_content: In fairness to Ditto they have significantly improved some aspects of their service over the past few years; particularly their website. However I have had various issues with them, particularly during the process of submitting releases, and I find the restricted access to sales analytics / trends if you're not an unlimited member very stingy. I paid high (in comparison to their competitors) upfront fees to make these releases and to make matters worse I have to pay annual fees to keep those releases up in the stores too, so I think full access to analytics should be the least they could offer in return. CD Baby is cheaper not only with their upfront fees, but there are no annual fees after that, and they give you full access to analytics for multiple stores as well, so I think Ditto should try to match this level of service. It would also help if they brought their prices more in line with the likes of CD Baby and abolish those annual fees. There is literally no justification for those annual fees anyway because once the release has been sent to the stores, that's it; there is no further work for Ditto to do to keep that release up there, so it's just blatant profiteering. I would really love to be able to support Ditto because I like working with smaller companies and helping them grow, but until their overall service improves I won't be submitting any more of my releases through them.

review_title: Support to get your music out
review_content: Various tools to help get your music released and even run your own record label. Interesting articles on techniques

review_title: We have had nothing but good experiences with Ditto till now. They seem to always go that little bit further for us.
review_content: We are running a Record Label In A Box with Ditto and are very happy with the amount of service we get from DItto with it. Can only recommend working with them.

review_title: Small fish in a big pond?
review_content: I have an unlimited release plan and make half a dozen releases a year as a 'micro' label. The cost compares well to most alternatives and Ditto's automated systems are good and continue to improve. There has been an issue with getting out releases on to eMusic. Ditto appear to want to be helpful, but this issue has been going on for almost two years and I have contacted them on a number of occasions. They tell me that the releases have been received by eMusic and they will look in to it. But nothing results from this. I cannot chase this up myself with eMusic, so I rely on my aggregator. Ditto have failed in this regard. I also have a release that was taken down in 2014 that is still available at all stores. Ditto told me that they cannot compel the stores to remove it. At the moment I don't think that they have the leverage and/or have not developed a relationship with the large stores in order to get them to resolve these kinds of wider distribution issues.

review_title: Has literally taken Ditto years to sort release issues
review_content: We paid extra for an artist name change to be made and delivered to all shops maybe 3 years ago now and this STILL has not been fully delivered & sorted with all services as Ditto promise. There's been so many emails sent back and forth and passing the bucks & requesting us to reupload tracks again & again. No one ever seems to be able to get it sorted, so it's a constant waste of our time. Also Ditto is definitely not the cheapest distribution service anymore, I'm considering one of the other services which has one upfront fee then nothing else yearly, which works out a lot cheaper in the long run.

Having had previous experience with uploading my music to digital distribution platforms, I can honestly say that Ditto just made the process a breeze. From the admin side of things to the uploading and sorting out of the music and its distribution needs, the process was painless and swift. For once, I actually felt the information on their website was relevant and what I needed to hear as an artist. The subsequent decision to use Ditto Music was an extension of that good vibe.

My  experience has been terrible customer service was prompt but never any help and all ways took time to resolve any issues with lots of back and forth, also earnings from iTunes Spotify Apple Music will display the report 50 to 100 day after a sale or stream and other stores may take up to 12 months I would all so like to point out when I joined it was not this amount of time had it of been I would have never joined as up to 1 year is no good for me, stuff was getting listed in  wrong genres the day of  release by the time I got it sorted people would not see the right   Genre till days have passed by this time we would be days back so people would not see us it  muck up the release and made for lower sales, I was so upset by this I  managed to talk a distributor my self and was able to list in their outlet and in the 1st  quarter had more sales then the whole time I was with ditto in 2 years with all the shops ditto listed us in, so now can only say ditto may be good for some but for us was  terrible and would avoid at all cost, thank you ditto for the worst time ever
